description: SECONDS BEFORE Jacques Lipchitz died in 1973, the 81year* old sculptor told his wife, Yulla, she must complete the three major commissions he had outstanding, monumental bronzesamong the largest he'd ever donefor Jerusalem, Philadelphia and Columbia University.

title: New York Delays Restoring Status Of 205 Officers Now Paid by U.S.
description: New York City decided yesterday to delay for a week the restoration to permanent status of 205 police officers who were laid off and then rehired on a ternporary basis for a year. Their restoration to permanent states had been scheduled for today.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times on March 24 reported incorrectly that children should receive initial immunization against diphtheria at 18 months of age. Health officials say the initial series of shots should he given at 2, 4, 6 and 18 months of age.

title: Mexico Postpones Big Expansion At StateOwned Steel Complex
description: MEXICO CITY, March 31Mexico's new Government has decided to postpone a $3 billion expansion program for the stateowned Sicartsa steel complex at Las Truchas, which was the principal prestige project of the administration that left office four months ago.

title: Anaconda Settles Its Chilean Claim
description: The Anaconda Company, a subsidiary of the Atlantic Richfield Company, said yesterday that it had worked out a compromise settlement with the Overseas Private Investment Corporation on a claim involving two of the company's copper properties that were nationalized by the Chilean government in 1971.

title: Pop Music: Fun in the Leon Redbone Manner
description: LEON REDBONE's eccentric musical vision is rooted in the 1920's, a decade that witnessed one of the most remarkable creative flowerings in the history of American popular culture. The rhythmic laugh he uses to accompany many of his guitar breaks comes directly from the 20's recordings of the Memphis Jug Band.

title: Reporter's Notebook: 2 Views of Moscow Talks
description: LONDON, March 31As Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance makes his way home from Moscow, he is facing a credibility problem of the kind that afflicted many of his predecessors.

title: Heavyweight Bouts Head Local Program Tonight
description: The quarterfinal round of the World Television boxing championships will be held tonight at the Beacon Theater, Broadway and 74th Street, with two 10round heavyweight fights topping a sixbout card.

title: Market Place
description: The yearly flow of annual reports is now at floodtide, and corporations in growing numbers are using questionandanswer sections to reply to issues raised by the owners of the businesstheir shareholders.

title: Letters
description: A Birthday Celebration

title: Senate Opposes Grain Dealer Fees For Costs of Federal Inspection
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (AP)The Senate voted yesterday to stop charging grain dealers for Federal supervision of the inspection and grading of the grain at inland points.

title: The Pop Life
description: NOW THAT New York's punk rockers have made some records and begun to venture beyond the city, they find themselves being judged by people outside the cult that has nurtured them. Sometimes, that can take the form of reviews from adulation to dismissal. And sometimesas Television has experienced on a few its dates with Peter Gabrielit can mean outright hostility from audiences.

title: Largest of 40 Blazes in the Pine Barrens Is Contained
description: Largest of 40 Blazes in the Pine Barrens Is Contained Coast are in the Pine Barrens. There were no early reports on damage to deer and other wildlife in the area.

title: Rightist Leader Of Brazil Sends Congress Home
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 1President Ernesto Geisel used his extensive powers today to dissolve Congress for an undetermined period after the legislative opposition blocked the passage of a Government bill on judicial reform.

title: In a Turkish City,Anything Goes, Or Comes, by Way of Smugglers
description: GAZIANTEP, TurkeyIn the municipal market here, within sight of gendarmerie headquarters, one can buy Chinese toys, Italian soap, Japanese radios, Russian cameras, German record players, English tea, Czech glassware, Swiss chocolate, American coffee and French perfume. Most of the goods are smuggled.

title: Minor Deviations Disclosed by G.M. Over Foreign Fees
description: DETROIT, April 1The General Motors Corporation, in its annual 10K report Ito the Securities and Exchange Commission, has disclosed what It terms minor deviations from business standards, mostly involving overseas operations.

title: Nordic Devaluation Planned for Monday
description: BRUSSELS, APRIL 1 (UPI)The currencies of Sweden, Denmark and Norway will be devalued on Monday, the Belgian Finance Minister, Willy De Clercq, announced today.

title: U.S. Aide Pledges Jawboning to Help Keep Food Prices Down
description: WASHINGTON, April 1Although her direct responsibilities as an Assistant Secretary of Agriculture give her little control over food prices. Carole Tucker Foreman has pledged to adopt the role of the jawboner on this issue in public and private forums.

title: AIDES SAY U,S. ERRED ON MOOD OF SOVIET
description: PARIS, April 1The Carter Administration apparently miscalculated the mood and intentions of the Soviet leaders before and during Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance's trip to Moscow, and this miscalculation contributed to the Americans reaction of surprise when no progress was achieved in ending the impasse on limiting strategic arms.

title: U.S. Embassy Wins Soviet Gains
description: MOSCOW, April 1As a small counterpoint to the failure of Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance's mission to Moscow this week, the Soviet Government has agreed to a series of measures designed to make life somewhat more comfortable for American diplomats and their families.

title: Taiwan Bridges the Income Gap While Maintaining High Growth
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  When Amy Hsu finished junior high school five years ago, near where her father has a small rice field, she went to work in one of the many electronics factories that have sprung up in Taiwan taking advantage of the island's cheap labor. She lived frugally in the factory domitory, finishing high school in night classes.

title: Cyprus Negotiators Meet, Reject Each Other's Plans
description: VIENNA, April 1 (UPI)Greek and Turkish Cypriot negotiators rejected each other's proposals today in the Cyprus peace talks but agreed that their dialogue should continue.

title: Slaying Suspect, 17, Seized
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.,April 1 (UPI)Detectives last night arrested a 17yearold youth wanted in the slayings of four young brothers in Indiana last February. He is David W. Smith of Wingate, Ind.. the third of four suspects in the slayings to be taken into custody. He was arraigned on four counts of murder in the first degree and ordered held in Fayette County jail for extradition to Indiana.

title: Paola Angelucci Is Wed To Howard Greenfeld
description: Paola Angelucci, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfredo Angelucci of Rome, was married yesterday to Howard Greenfeld, son of Mrs. Isadore Greenfeld of New York and Palm Beach, Fla., and the late Mr. Greenfeld.

title: One Dead in Jersey City Fire
description: JERSEY CITY, April 1 (UPI)One person was killed and six were injured today in a fire that swept through a row of apartment houses. Robert Wood, 26 years old. was found dead in the apartment he shared with his mother on Highland Avenue. Twelve members of two families were left homeless by the fire.

title: 50Cent Fare Until 79 Expected
description: The city's 50cent transit fare can be sustained through December 1978, and perhaps longer, provided there are no unexpected changes in the rate of inflation or the level of Federal aid, Harold L. Fisher, the new chairmandesignate of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said yesterday.

title: Philadelphia Museum Head Quits
description: Evan H. Turner, director of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, resigned yesterday after 13 years in the post. The resignation was accepted with deep regret by William P. Wood, president of the museum's board.

title: Carter Urges Other Nations to Join in Aiding Portugal Financially
description: WASHINGTON, April 1  President Carter has written personal letters to the leaders of four major industrial countries asking them to join the United States in an effort to help hardpressed Portugal meet its international financial obligations

title: Length of Bertolucci's 1900 Causes a Production Dispute
description: The length of Bernardo Bertolucci's big new film, 1900, has become the voretx of a dispute involvingdepending upon the various principalsart, business and law.

title: HEAD OF PENTAGON DOUBTS SOVIET PACT BEFORE FREEZE ENDS
description: WASHINGTON, April 1Secretary of Defense Harold Brown expressed strong doubts today that the United States and the Soviet Union could reach agreement on a reduction of their strategic arsenals before a current freeze on strategic weapons expired next October.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: The air disaster in the Canary Islands offers an imitation of cinema art by nature. Although the tragic end of the story is known in advance, examination of the skein of causality will hold people's attention for a long time to come.

title: Blumenthal Expects No Big Gain In Interest Rates During 1977
description: LOS ANGELES, April 1 (Reuters)Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal said today he did not expect any significant increase in United States interest rates this year.

title: People in Sports
description: Spencer Haywood, who missed 44 games this year as he drifted in and out of the New York Knicks lineup, finally had surgery yesterday on his left leg. The operation was performed by Dr. Donald O'Donoghue in Oklahoma City.

title: Great Treasure Hunt Fails; New Mexico Legend Lives On
description: WHITE SANDS, N. M., April 1Old Doc Noss would have loved every minute of itall those people clustered day after day near the summit of Victorio Peak, his peak, waiting patiently through the heat and wind and rain and sandstorms for word that a fabulous lost treasure, his treasure, had once again been found.

title: Jane St. John, 92; Served as a Nurse In 2 World Wars
description: Jane Rignel St. John, who was awarded the Croix de Guerre for her service as a battlefield nurse during World War I, died yesterday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center after a brief illness. She was 92 years old and had homes in Manhattan and Woodstock, Vt.

title: John Dyson, the Gadfly Of Carey's Administration
description: ALBANY, April 1So here's this state agency head, running around advocating tax breaks for the rich and delaying cleaning poison from the rivers.

title: Dance: Riverside Season Opens
description: The Riverside Dance Festival opened its spring season Thursday night at Riverside Church with a sprightly joint program by Robert Small and Diane Boardman.

title: Five Yanks Over .300 Mark Bring Joy to Club President
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 1Now that Chris Chambliss and Sparky Lyle are signed and Graig Nettles is back in uniform, Gabe Paul, president of the Yankees, is back in the mood to count his blessings.

title: Market Up as Jobless Rate Dips; Dow Scores 2d Gain in 12 Days
description: The stock market, buoyed by encouraging economic news, registered a broad advance yesterday in continued sluggish trading.

title: W.H.A. Roadrunners Fold
description: PHOENIX, April 1 (AP)Citing financial losses totaling more than $6 million over the last three years, the Phoenix Roadrunners announced today that they would suspend operations following their final game of the season next week.

title: A Westchester Jury Awards $1.9 Million In Negligence Case
description: WHITE PLAINS. April 1A jury in State Supreme Court in Westchester County awarded $1,948,324 in damages yesterday to the widow of a man who died five months after apparently suffering an undetected injury in a minor automobile accident.

title: just Where Do Bunnies Come From?
description: Children have their own fanciful ideas about where chocolate bunnies come from, but the people who really knowthe merchants who sell themcan give you an exact address. It is 9603 Beach Channel Drive, Rockaway Beach, Queens.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M. WQXR. Symphony No. 82, Haydn; Violin Concerto. Dittersdorf; Festival Overture, Smetana; Jeu de Sons from Suite No. 2, Tchaikovsky; Hero and Leander, Herbert; Overture to The Crown Diamonds, Auber; Horn Concerto, Schoeck; Gymnopedies 1 and 2, Satie; Three Greek Dances, Skalkottas.

title: NEW YORK ALLOWED TO PREPAY ON CITY U.
description: ALBANY, April 1In the waning moments of yesterday's marathon session on the state budget, the Legislature passed a bill that would permit New York City to prepay its $52 million, 25 percent share of next year's City University budget.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: India's Regime to Investigate Corruption Charge Against Gandhis
description: NEW DELHI, April 1India's new Government told Parliament today that it would order investigations of corruption charges involving former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, her son Sanjay and a defense minister in her Government.

title: Quebec Regime's White Paper Declares Province a French Society
description: QUEBEC, April 1The Quebec government today declared this province a French society and told the Englishspeaking minority it could no longer dominate economic life.

title: So They Moved, Because of Wife's Job
description: The moving men don't know what to make of it. Neither do many of the new neighbors. Even old friends sometimes find it hard to believe that a man would give up his job and his home because of a wife's career.

title: Sights Which Put Pornographers to Shame
description: To the Editor:

title: New York State, City Tax Refunds Mailed
description: ALBANY, April 1 (AP)An estimated $800 million to $900 million in state and New York City incometax refunds started going into the mails today. The refunds were held up by the Carey Administration to avoid making the payments in the fiscal year that ended at midnight yesterday.

title: Henry Van Brunt Smith, at 75, A Scion of 17thCentury Settlers
description: Henry Van Brunt Smith, an exporterimporter, died Thursday at his New Canaan, Conn., home. He was 75 years old.

title: The Theme, Unmistakably: Small Is Beautiful
description: By his middle years a man of our time has had to observe the Death of EverythingWestern Civilization, the Puritan Ethic, the Novel, God, Literacy and Conversation; it is a bit like living in a graveyard. No doubt at least some of these deaths have even occurred, though my eyes and ears tell me that most of the obituaries are premature; and of at least one demise I can report with authority that it just isn't so. That is the Death of the Small Town.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Berg's Lulu, 2? SaIntSaens's Samson e? Dallla, 8.

title: Around the Nation
description: ATLANTA, April 1 (UPI)Mayor Maynard Jackson today dismissed 1,024 striking sanitation workers and said that the decision was the most painful he had ever made. He asked Atlantans to take garbage to temporary collection points while replacements were hired.

title: In Memoriam
description: COHENSam, beloved father and grandfather. Lovingly remembered. Daughters Pearl, Eleanor, grandchildren Irwin, Helena.

title: City U. Aide Quits After Lawmakers Assail Budget Data
description: The vicechancellor for budget and planning of the City University of New York has resigned, only days after his performance came under new criticism from members of the Legislature.

title: HEAD OF PENTAGON DOUBTS SOVIET PACT BEFORE FREEZE ENDS;
description: WASHINGTON, April 1Secretary of Defense Harold Brown expressed strong doubts today that the United States and the Soviet Union could reach agreement on a reduction of their strategic arsenals before a current freeze on strategic weapons expired next October.

title: Brazil's Chief Dissolves Congress as Foes Block His Judicial Bill
description: RIO DE JANE?RO, April 1President Ernesto Geisel used his extensive powers today to dissolve Congress for an undetermined period after the legislative opposition blocked the passage of a Government bill on judicial reform.

title: Spain Leads Greece, 20
description: ATHENS, April 1 (AP)Spain took a 20 lead over Greece today by sweeping the opening singles matches of thirdround European Zone Davis Cup tennis competition. Jose Higueras defeated Nicholas Kelaidis, 60, 60, 61, and Manuel Orantes beat Nicholas Kalogeropoulos, 61, 62, 60.

title: Seder at Guild for Blind Stresses Link Between Passover and Easter
description: A traditional Passover seder, or ceremonial meal, at the Jewish Guild for the Blind this week ended with an unusual toucha performance by Milt Hinton and his fivemember group from Hunter College.

title: 15Day Bills Average 4.632% at Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, April 1The Treasury sold today $4.5 billion of 15day bills at an average return of 4.632 percent. The department received $14.9 billion of tenders for the bills, which mature April 21, 1977. Accepted tenders included 28 percent of the bids at the highest yield.

title: Wreck of 747's Sets Back Cause Of Insurgents on Canary Islands
description: LAS PALMAS, Canary Islands. April 1A major political casualty of the collision between Boeing 747 jets Sunday is Antonio Cubillo, selfappointed secretary general of the Movement for the SelfDetermination and Independence of the Canary Archipelago.

title: James Coco's Dream Came True
description: Several weeks ago James Coco dreamed that his apartment was vandalized and that all of his personal possessions were destroyed. Terrified, he called an actress friend, who is an expert on dreams. He described his nightmare to her. She listene? and then asked, A little worried about your opening?

title: Mary Brazell Is Married To Peter Ives at Harvard
description: Mary Margaret Brazell and Peter Nelson Ives, members of the class of 77 at RadcliffeHarvard, were married yesterday in the Memorial Church of Harvard University. The Rev. Peter Gomes performed the nondenominational ceremony.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, APRIL 2, 1977

title: U.S. Companies Are Prepared
description: At JohnsManville Corporation near Denver, Jerry Murray, regional media relations manager, said that the language proposals did not seem likely to affect his company.

title: WITNESS TIES OSWALD TO OILMEN AND CUBANS
description: WASHINGTON, April 1A Dutch journalist said today he had told the House Assassinations Committee that the mysterious potential witness who allegedly committed suicide Tuesday had told him that Texas oilmen and antiCastro Cubans had conspired with Lee Harvey Oswald to kill President Kennedy.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 79yearold retired ironworker chased away two muggers who attacked him in the lobby of his Bronx apartment house at 2320 Creston Avenue, but collapsed 10 minutes later and died of an apparent heart attack. Detectives of the Senior Citizens Robbery Unit in the Bronx said it was not clear whether the victim, Eugene Buksz. had been followed home by his assailants or whether they had been hiding in the lobby. Mr. Buksz had been carrying about $70, but the muggers got nothing, the police said.

title: Cauthen Absence Leaves Aqueduct Bettors at Odds
description: It was Steve Cauthen Day yesterday, but not at Aqueduct. The 16yearold jockey won the last four races at the Big A on Thursday, then returned to his Kentucky home and the good ol populace of Boone County turned out to honor the leading rider

title: Deaths
description: ADELSONRuth. The Marx Fraternity records with deeo sorrow the passing of their beloved member.

title: Gold
description: Selected World gold prices Friday. London: morning fixing $148.25, off

title: John Dyson, the Gadfly Of Carey's Administration
description: ALBANY, April 1So here's this state agency head, running around advocating tax breaks for the rich and delaying cleaning poison from the rivers.

title: People and Business
description: Preliminary skirmishing over President Carter's energy proposalsnot expected to be announced until April 20is heating up. Thomas A. Murphy, chairman of the General Motors Corporation, continued his attack yesterday, concentrating his fire on reports that stiff taxes might be levied on purchasers of larger cars. Terming such notions rash, illconceived and illprepared, Mr. Murphy, speaking at a luncheon meeting of the Sales Executive Club of New York, called this idea the most simplistic, irresponsible proposal ever made.

title: Charge by Boomis Found Unsupported
description: A Manhattan grand jury has been unable to find corroboration for an allegation that Christopher Boomis, the realestate developer, was promised participation in a lucrative building project in exchange for secret contributions to the 1973 mayoral campaign of Abraham D. Beame, according to sources close to the principals.

title: ARTHUR N. OTIS
description: Arthur N. Otis, chairman of the board and director of the Merchants Refrigerating Company, at 850 Third Avenue, died Thursday in Sarosota, Fla., at the age of 83.

title: Long  Lasting Pacemaker
description: A rechargeable heart pacemaker patented by Pennsylvania State University medical researchers may last as long as 20 years and require only infrequent medical checkups. The hermetically sealed implant's recharging system is designed to be used by the patient in his own home. Page 27.

title: Schmidt Says That Palestinians Should Have Role in Middle East Talks
description: BONN, April 1 (Reuters)Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany said today he believed that the Palestinians must take part in any reconvened Geneva talks on the Middle East.

title: UNEMPLOYMENT RATE FELL TO 7.3% IN MARCH AS COLD WAVE EASED
description: WASHINGTON, April 1Unemployment declined in March as workers who were laid off in the winter because of severe cold and fuel shortages returned to work, the Labor Department announced today.

title: Notes on People
description: Indian Prime Minister Morarji Desai, embroiled in a dispute over his published criticism of female leaders, said today that he had apologized to Premier Sirimavo Bandaranaike of Sri Lanka and to Margaret Thatcher, the opposition leader in England. But his refusal to apologize also to Indian women prompted members of the Congress Party, men included, to walk out of the upper house of Parliament. The Prime Minister, when asked to apologize to Indian women, said I have said whatever I have to say, I am not going to apologize here. Do whatever you like. The Congress Party had been led by former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, whose Government had detained Mr. Desai for 19 months. Mr. Desai was quoted in Time Magazine as saying: Women on the whole have better, softer qualities than men and on the whole they don't go as devilish as men. But when a woman becomes devilish, she beats all records.

title: 10 Will Lead Philharmonic
description: The New York Philharmonic is to be led by 10 guest conductors next season, during which it will be without a music director. The tenure of Pierre Boulez ends with the conclusion of this season and that of Zubin Mehta, music directordesignate, will not begin until the advent of the 197879 season.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of post positionsLetter designates OTB listing

title: Egypt and Northrop Await Carter Decision on Planes
description: Preliminary negotiations for the sale of as many as 200 Northrop F5E and F5F fighters to Egypt have been completed, according to well placed banking sources but final approval of the agreement awaits the decision of President Carter.

title: Personal Investing
description: In the several years he has spent counseling corporate executives on how to handle their money, Peter M. Mazonas, a vice president of the Bank of America, has discovered that the brasslike the very richreally are not so very different from you and me.

title: ANTIPOVERTY FRAUD IS CHARGED TO FOUR
description: An official of the BedfordStuyvesant Youth In Action Community Corporation, two former officials and a Brooklyn building owner were indicted by a Federal grand jury yesterday on charges of fraud and embezzement involving $135,000 in antipoverty funds.

title: Larchmont Dweller Turns a Flashlight On the Cat Burglar

title: At Passover and Easter, the Egg Is the Symbol of Rebirth

Tomorrow, Christians observe Palm Sunday, marking the start of Holy Week, which culminates on. Easter Sunday. Both are celebrations of deliverance and rebirth, and in the observance of both Passover and Easter, the egg is a symbol of that renaissance, just as it was in ancient times when pagans celebrated the spring solstice.

title: 'Raggedy Ann' Is Indeed an Animated Movie
description: "This is too good to be true," one of the animated innocents happily exclaims early in the fairy-tale capers of "Raggedy Ann & Andy" that turned up yesterday at 50 theaters in the metropolitan area. That ecstatic, if double-edged, observation is truthful. The moppets who for decades, have been cuddling up to the titular stories and those floppy dolls are likely to agree with it even if curmudgeons over the age of 12, say, probably would quibble over such superlatives.Considering the largely rudimentary animated subjects dealt to kids on television, the technical professionalism of "Raggedy Ann" is both a rare and welcome addition to the entertainment offered pre-teens these days. At any rate, the script concocted from the ever-popular tales introduced more than 50 years ago by Johnny Gruelle for his ailing, young daughter, Marcella, needs no more justification for youngsters than a lollipop.The adventures the scenarists have devised are, essentially, a search, starting from Marcella's toy and doll-filled playroom, for Babette, the French doll, who is kidnapped by another doll, the Captain. If the peripatetic Raggedy Ann and her brother, Andy, make it successfully through a forbidding forest, a tossing sea, a looney kingdom ruled by a wacky sovereign and the dangers of a blob called Greedy, it shouldn't hurt the youngsters more than a second lollipop.Importantly, the artisans hired by the producers were largely expert in handling their two-year production chore and the $4 million budget supplied by the International Telephone & Telegraph and Bobbs-Merrill, their literary subsidiary in this, their first feature-length animated presentation.The large team of veteran animators headed by Richard Williams, whose young daughter, Claire, appears in the film's sole live-action sequences, contributes meticulous interpretations so that Raggedy Ann, the pirate Captain and the comically lonely Camel, for example, seem to be properly mouthing and singing their delights and fears.In most instances, their voicessupplied by such actors as George S. Irving, Joe Silver, Didi Conn and Alan Suesprovide them with fairly convincing juvenile and comic conviction. And if the music and lyrics of 17 songs by Joe Raposo ("Sesame Street," etc.) are not extraordinary, they are, like "Candy Hearts," pleasantly tuneful."Raggedy Ann & Andy" should charmingly fill the bill for the young fry who haven't had their kind of animated feature since Disney's "Robin Hood" in 1973.

In the trials for tomorrow's 100mile race. he had the fastest time with his 250 c.c. Yamaha in 2 minutes 2.03 seconds.
