title: Reds Again Favored, Mets Again Not
description: The National League turns into its second century on Wednesday when the Cincinnati Reds open their pursuit of a third straight World Series championship, and nothing has happened in the spring training camps the last six weeks to reduce the widespread feeling that they are indeed the team to beat.

title: The Nation
description: The Senate has joined the House of Representatives in attempting to reinforce public confidence in Congress by adopting a code of ethics to disocurage conflicts on interest. Although the Senate's version is still somewhat more stringent than the House's, it was relaxed substantially before passage last week, evidently to minimize discrepancies between the two versions and to enlarge support for the code among the Senators. The vote was 86 to 9.

title: Anne F. St. Goar And Shippen Page To Wed in August
description: The engagement of Anne Franchot St. Goar to Shippen Lewis Page, son of Anderson Page of Philadelphia and Exeter, Me., and the late Mrs. Page, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Walter T. St. Goar of Brookline, Mass. A wedding next August is planned.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: BALDWIN PLACE  Come Blow Your Horn, starring Joseph Hunt, Jonathan Marten and Judy Arbaugh. Thursday at 2 and 8 P.M., Friday and Saturday at 8 P.M. Mahopac Farm Playhouse, Route 6. $4.40 to $6.50; student, elderly and group discounts available. 6281169.

title: Robyn Moses Fiancee Of Felton P. Mathews
description: The engagement of Robyn B. Moses, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Conrad Moses of Wilmington, Del., to Felton Peters Mathews, son of Margaret Felton Peters Mathews of Devon, Pa., and Dr. Neilson M. Mathews Jr. of Radnor, Pa., has been announced by the future bride's parents.

title: Notes: Factory Tours
description: The United States Government has come up with a project designed to make play out of workat least for touristsby issuing a directory listing more than 1,500 businesses and factories offering free tours to visitors.

title: Ups and Downs of a Man's First Day at the Races
description: I walked around the corner toward the newspaper stand, glanced quickly to make sure no one was watching, then nervously reached into my pocket for a dollar in change. An old man's sandpaper hands grabbed the coins. He dropped them in his pouch and held out The Racing Form for the next day.

title: Article 16  No Title
description: Article 16  No Title

title: INDIA WILL MODERATE BIRTHCURB PROGRAM
description: NEW DELHI, April 2The new Cabinet minister in charge of birth control said today that the program would be considerably moderated, to eliminate all elements of compulsion.

title: Cosmos Want N.A.S.L. Title for Pele
description: The Cosmos are under a lot of pressure to capture the title in the North American Soccer League's 11th season that opens on Fridayand with good reason. It will mark the end of an illustrious career for Pele, and the Cosmos want to make it a triumphant season for the king of soccer. We've got to win it for him. Giorgio Chinaglia said last week pointing to Pele, and we've got to win it for our fans. We must win it.

title: Corporate Boardrooms Beckon Women Academics
description: Jill Ker Conway, president of Smith College in Northampton, Mass., has been named a director of the IBM World Trade America/Far East Corporation, an arm of the giant computer company.

title: 2D SESSION IN ALBANY EXPECTED TO BUSTLE
description: ALBANY, April 2Shortly before the Legislature adopted the new state budget this week, a legislator sat down to write a constituent newsletter about the Legislature's accomplishments in the 1977 session. The legislator, a Senator from New York City, could not think of any. The newsletter was canceled.

title: I once loaded up a few in a world Series ...but we got shallumped by the Dodgers.
description: Blossom by blossom, Swinburne wrote. the spring begins. Inning by inning, this week, spring blooms as baseball reappears From Boston to Toronto to San Diego. But it's a new scene for the old ball game. Players become free agents put up at auction: team owners bemoan the economic revolution while bidding millions of dollars: leagues maneuver to expand into new markets. Even the ball has a different manufacturer.

title: Suzanne Riley Hall Is Wed,
description: Suzanne Riley Hall of Garden City, L. I., widow of Frank W. Hall, who was president of Albert FrankGuenther Law Inc., advertising agency and public relations concern, was married yesterday afternoon to Curtis E. Neldne? of Delray Beach, Fla., a widower and retired general partner of White, Weld & Co., investment bankers. The Rev. Ralph Ahlberg performed the ceremony in the Community Church, Garden City. Mrs. Neldner is a member of White, Weld's advisory board.

title: Kennan On Carter's Diplomacy
description: WASHINGTON, WASHINGTON, April 2As the old Russian proverb would put it, Secretary of State Vance went to Moscow for wool and came home shorn, but probably this is no disaster, and may even bring both sides closer to reality.

title: Putnam Lee, Consultant, Weds Eugenie H. Greeff
description: Tugenie Haven Greeff, daughter of ??????? ?eorge Haven of New York and the late ?eorge Griswold Haven. was married yesterday afternoon to Putnam Lee, a financial and estate planning consultant. He is a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Ronald Currie Lee of Bedford, N. Y. The Rev. Thomas C. Truscott performed the ceremony at the Westhampton (L. I.) Presbyterian Church.

title: The Particular Genius of Maya Plisetskaya
description: One enormous disappointment of my balletgoing life came in 1956 on the occasion of the Bolshoi Ballet's first foray to the Westdancing a onemonth season at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden. There should have been three primaballerinas  Galina Ulanova, Raissa Struchkova and Maya Plisetskayaand, indeed, special souvenir books were produced on all three of them. But Plisetskaya didn't come. Rumors at the time abounded. Ulanova was said to be jealous of her, she herself was said to be a poor security risk, or she was currently out of favor with the then director of the Bolshoi Ballet, the late Leonid Lavrovsky. But whatever the reason, Plisetskaya made that first trip.

title: Class and Caste in India
description: 468 pp. New York: Thomas Y. Crowell. $10.

title: Mets Ready To Trade Kingman
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., April 2The war of the words broke out again tonight when the New York Mets disclosed that Dave Kingman was demanding $2 million for six years, and therefore they were trying to arrange a trade to accommodate him

title: Top Uganda Jurist Is Jobless in County
description: UGANDA'S first black Attorney General and a former member of the International Commission of Jurists is living in a sparsely furnished Mount Vernon apartment, unable to practice law in New York State, he says, because he needs character and fitness references from Idi Amin's Government.

title: Some Little Powers Are Making Big Arms Sales ...
description: LONDONAlthough the United States and the Soviet Union account for 80 percent of the world's trade in weapons, several nations, primarily in Western Europe, that have a small share of the market are contributing to the potential for conflict in many areas of the globe.

title: There Are Rings Around Uranus
description: Observation of the solar system, accelerated in recent years by spacecraft and other new technology, has uncovered a big surprise: A flying observatory has found that Uranus, the planet seventh from the sun, is encircled by at least five rings.

title: Exhibit of Auto Imports Opens at the Coliseum
description: It's imported cars only through April 10 at the Coliseum, with two floors of Ferraris, Aston Martins, Lamborghinis, Jaguars and Mercedes Benzes being displayed in Auto Expo/New York.

title: Goodman Pressing the Liberals For Early Decision on Nominee
description: The next and crucial test of strength in the Liberal Party over a mayoral nominee will come on the. question of the timing of the party's endorsement.

title: Carter Rights Aide, Visiting Argentina, Warns on Violations
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 2Patricia Derian, President Carter's appointee to head the State Department's human rights office, has given notice to Argentina's military Government that rights violations here will influence United States economic aid decisions.

title: Stiff Challenge Is Facing Mayor Elected as a Radical in Madison
description: MADISON, Wis, April 2Dressed conservatively in a dark blue, singlebreasted suit, Mayor Paul R. Soglin hardly fitted the image of the radical he was elected as in 1973 and 1975, nor did he sound like one, as he addressed a recent meeting of the East Madison Rotary Club.

title: Miss Carlin Fiancee Of H. S. Hoffmann
description: Mr. and Mrs. Gabriel S. Carlin of Stamford, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Beverly J. Carlin, to Howard S. Hoffmann, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jadin C. Hoffmann of San Francisco.

title: Nancy Prosser Rath of Bankers Trust And Robert Nigro to Wed Next Month
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Stearns Rath of New York and Litchfield, Conn. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Prosser Rath, to Robert Allen Nigro, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence A. Nigro of Yardley, Pa.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TuesdayLong Island Triumph Association meeting at Hideaway Inn, Route 107, North Massapequa, L.I. (north of Exit 29 Southern State Parkway), 7:30 P.M. Information: phone Steve, (516)5388359 or Rov(516)7856957.

title: Islanders Lose, 53, as Do Rangers, 41
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., April 2The point was this: If the Islanders had beaten the Boston Bruins at Nassau Coliseum this afternoon, the chances were good they would become the thirdbest club in the National Hockey League in total points. The prize for that was knowing that if they reached the semifinal round of the playoffs. they would not have to face the Montreal Canadiens.

title: Sartre Thinking and Talking
description: FRANCE got over the epochal disturbances of May 1968 quickly enough; JeanPaul Sartre has never got over them. They came without warning and stripped him of both his authority and his public. Ever since 1945 his had been the most rousing and intelligent voice to be heard on the French left. He might have the superior brain and vocabulary of a professional philosopher, but he saw himself too as the people's tribune. The political analyses and recommendations that tumbled so urgently from his restless mind were far too abstruse for the people; but there is no shortage of middleclass radicals in France and it was they, the young ones particularly, who soaked up whatever Sartre had to say. In all that time he had no rival as the director of progressive consciences; Andre Malraux had switched from left to right politically and gone in for active Gaullism; Camus had begun stoutly as a quieter, more responsible alternative to Sartre but had faded badly by the time he was killed in 1960.

title: A New Trade Strategy: Not Made in Japan
description: SINGAPOREJapan Inc. is coming to Southeast Asia. In Europe and the United States, doors have been slamming against the entry of Japanese products. But the situation is different herefrom the Communist states of Indochina down through Thailand, Malaysia and Singapore, across the Straits of Malacca to Indonesia and up to the Philippines. Japan has discovered the potential of its own back yard.

title: A Visit With Joan Didion
description: HER office is a chamber in which to dream waking dreams. There are props and cue cards. While she worked on A Book of Common Prayer a map of Central America hung on the wall. Set out on a table were postcards from Colombia, a newspaper photo of a janitor mopping up blood in a Caribbean hotel, books on tropical foliage and tropical medicine and a Viasa Airlines schedule with MaracaiboParis circled in blue. MaracaiboParis I thought those were probably the perimeters of the book, Joan Didion said.

title: WALDHEIM DOUBTFUL OF A NEW COLD WAR
description: VIENNA, April 2Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations said here today that there was no prospect of another cold war even if the relationship between the United States and the Soviet Union had cooled.

title: Auditing the I.R.S.
description: ANY American who writes a book on income taxes that is even mildly critical of the system deserves high marks for courage. Anybody who reviews such a book favorably, especially if that anybody has not yet submitted this year's 1040 form to the Internal Revenue Service, is crazy. Thus I am writing this review under a pseudonym. If there is a real Mr. Erdman, I hope that he will not mind this harmless little joke.

title: Deaths
description: ABDALLHisein (Harry), on April 1977, beloved husband of Aishe, devoted father of Taller Bega and Mary Romano, also survived by 4 grand. chlidren. Services 10 A.M. Tuesday, at The Walsh and LaBoaa Funeral Home, 8713 87th St., Woodhaven, N. Y. Interment In follow at Pine lawn Cemetery, Farmlnedale, L. I.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: A Ripley's BelieveItorNot quality attends most of the following bookswhich suits me fine, and evidently suits a lot of us as we slouch toward middle age. Cruising the nonfiction shelves in search of the extraordinary, one findswedged among the howto manuals and photo albums of famous generals horses an abundance of books that shock, titillate. confound, amaze and are certainly stranger than fic tion. Hanggliding in an armchair, here goes.

title: Cultivating An Unlikely Land
description: RANCH houses and highrise apartment office buildings may be the architectural order of the day, but along the QueensNassau border neither the wrecking ball nor spaceage blueprints will displace one surprising survivor from the 18th centurya 52acre farm.

title: Some Concrete Steps for I84
description: THE future of Interstate 84, which now links Danbury and Hartford and is eventually to continue on to Rhode Island, appears a bit more promising these days, despite a pledge by environmental groups and certain state energy and environmental officials to fight the extension of the road through the eastern. part of the state.

title: Crash Dead Due in U.S.
description: DOVER, Del., April 2 (AP)Two Pan American Airways jet freighters will bring the bodies of the 323 persons who died in the crash of a Pan Am 747 jumbo jet in the Canary Islands to Dover Air Force Base tomorrow for identification, a Pan Am spokesman said. Five hundred and seventyseven were killed last Sunday when the Pan Am plane and KLM 747 collided on the ground at Tenerifa.

title: Article 17  No Title
description: Article 17  No Title

title: Jury in Supreme Court in Brooklyn Finds Gilmore Guilty of June Murder of Ted Gross, ExLindsay Aide
description: After deliberating for about 10 hours, jury in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn found Kenneth Gilmore guilty of seconddegree murder in the slaying of Ted Gross, once an aide to former Mayor John V. Lindsay of New York City and a former Youth Services Commissioner.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: LOS ANGELESHarold Marvin Williams, who was nominated by President Carter Wednesday to become the next chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, was born in Philadelphia. But he grew. up and served his business apprenticeship in Los Angeles, whence also came Roderick M. Hills; the current S.E.C: chief.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: photographers have been fighting to have photography recognized as a fine art since its inception nearly 150 years agoand recent interviews with print curators at major museums and art galleries confirm that it has finally arrived. The prices being paid for fine photographs at recent auctions here and abroad have soared to new heights, and collectors are clamoring for rare masterpieces.

title: Firehouse in Need of a Tenant
description: POMPANO BEACH. Fla., April 2 (AP)To keep a $475,000 Federal grant, this city is building a firehouse it does not need. And city officials are trying to decide what to do with it.

title: Springtime for Hitler
description: MUSING in his headquarters in 1944 on his place in history, Adolf Hitler said that, perhaps one day after he was dead and buried, an objective Englishman would come and treat him objectively for the present generation neither can nor will. David Irving, who relates this story in his massive book Hitler's War, clearly believes that the prophecy has been fulfilled. So does his publisher, promising the reading public a view of Hitler and the sixyear war the world has never before seen.... David Irving's Hitler will stand athwart the annals of Nazi Germany and World War II from this time forward. This is not a Hitler drawn on the same tired, mutually supporting material, but an ordinary, walking, talking human weighing 155 pounds, with graying hair, largely false teeth, and chronic digestive ailments . . . probably the weakest leader Germany has known this century.

title: THEATER
description: LIFE AS A DREAM and death as the only reality is a theme best suited to faces with a few lines and sorrows etched into them. But, by its own admission, one of the strengths of The Company Storethe student arm of the Hartman Theater Companyis the youth of its members. And this goes a long way toward explaining why  despite satisfactory staging by Wendy Chapinthe company's second production of its first seasonEugene lonesco's Exit The Kingfalls short of success. The bright young faces of The Company Store suggest a school play rather than a performance at professional level.

title: INTERVIEW
description: EDWARD H. DUGGAN was born in Buffalo nearly 75 years ago, but the soft Irish tones of his Cork County ancestry still come through, at least in voice and manner. His activities speak more urgently.

title: Osaka Calls the Tune at Quasar
description: FRANKLIN PARK, Ill.Robert T. Bloomberg is accustomed to working for companies whose home offices are far away. He used to work in Los Angeles for a company whose head office was in Michigan. Now he works in this industrial suburb of Chicago for a company based in Osaka, Japan.

title: Conservatives And Patronage
description: THE Conservative Party, which usually emphasizes its ideological bent, is involved in oldfashioned patronage politics in Nassau County that world make a Tammany Hall chieftain blush.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: I sometimes think I should not be allowed out in the company of actresses. I don't mean arm in arm, or tttt, or on the sly or anything like that. I'm not one of your bon vivant reviewers, taking advantage of my august position to lure ingenues into by web, promising to sip champagne from their slippers as soon as George Sanders gets through with the bottle; I'm a contentedly married man, under close observation. No, I mean I simply shouldn't be aliowed where actresses are: in the theater, for instance. The minute I see one of them do something I likeand the treacherous creatures are always doing something I likeI seem to develop a backbone of aspic, a tremor in my notetakinghand, and a vocabulary confined entirely to words conveying ecstasy. It's very embarrassing, I sometimes think. At other times I wonder. Is it possible that the enchanting things are exactly as good as I think they are?

title: Youth Symphony Coming of Age
description: THE Norwalk Youth Symphony, considered to be one of the top young people's orchestras in the country, is now 20 years old. And the occasion is marked this year by special programs and concerts, by returning alumni and by a new junior orchestra.

title: Braves Defeat Bucks, 9493; Dantley Sets a Club Record
description: BUFFALO, April 2 (AP)Baskets by Chuck Williams and John Gianelli carried the Buffalo Braves to a 9493 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks in a National Basketball Association game at the Memorial Auditorium tonight.

title: Weddings
description: HatcherMartin

title: INTERVIEW
description: FROM TIME to time in recent months, an animated, outgoing 41yearold Island woman her dark hair streaked with gray has been seen on campuses of the State University system.

title: New York, After 10 Years, Finds Plan to Create a Coney Island Park Is Unsuccessful
description: Ten years ago, New York City decided to create a seafront park on the 12acre site of Coney Island's famed Steeplechase Park whose parachute jump, carrousel and electric steeplechase course helped to make Brooklyn a legend.

title: Muddy Course at Aqueduct Enables Cinteelo, $12.80, to Win Westchester
description: HOT SPRINGS, Ark., April 2 (AP)Clever Tell, the oddson favorite, scored a fourlength victory today in the $134,200 Arkansas Derby, completing a rare double for his owners, trainer and jockey.

title: When an Employer Insists
description: May an employer order an employee to submit to psychiatric examination?

title: NURSING HOMES FEEL PENSIONS PRESSURE
description: Some of the 90 private nursing homes represented by the Metropolitan New York Nursing Home Association may be forced to shut down as a result of pressures for recovery of contributions owed union pension and welfare funds and new proposals for higher pay and improved benefits, a spokesman for the homes has warned.

title: Long Beach Is Taking Another Shot At Promoting Grand Prix Auto Race
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., April 2 (AP)It's that time when staid, sunbleached downtown Long Beach is transformed into a Formula I racing circuit, complete with the color, fanfare, excitement and inherent danger supposedly associated with a true Grand Prix.

title: Mark Leswing Plans to Wed Miss Donahue
description: Mr. and Mrs. Theodore P. Donahue of New York and County Kildare. Ireland, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Barbara Casey Donahue, to Mark Davis Leswing, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick P. Leswing of Inverness, III. formerly of New Canaan, Conn.

title: 3 FOUND FATALLY STABBED IN APARTMENT IN BRONX
description: Two women and a man were found bound and stabbed to death last night in a firstfloor apartment in the Crotona Park section of the Bronx, the police said.

title: Opening in Lincroft
description: THE paintspattered stage is, alternately, a prison cell and a courtroom. The actors play mercenary soldiers awaiting trial in Angola. The author, Lou J. Stalsworth, leans forward in his seat on the side of the stage to watch three of them complete a scene.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: Heflin Mack Lankford, a 58yearold lifeinsurance salesman of Montgomery, Ala., crashed head on into another car and killed a teenager when driving while intoxicated. On Feb. 13, 1976, he was sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: ROBERT L. LA FRENIERE
description: Robert L. La Frenire, a partner in the New York law firm of Debevoise. Plimpton, Lyons & Gates, died early yesterday following an automobile accident near his home in Huntington,L.I. He was 40 years old.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: The author of this long essay on racism is an unusual man. Born in Texas, educated in France, where he remained at the onset of World War II, a student of medicine, music and philosophy he has spent much of his life trying to understand and combat man's inhumanity to man. In 1959 Griffin had his skin medically treated so that, for a while, he appeared black.

title: Probable Pitchers
description: (Last season's records in parentheses.)

title: Sally G. Damon, Lawyer, to Wed
description: Sally Georgia Damon and Roger Dale Turner, who graduated last year from the University of Chicago Law School, plan to be married in Rochester on June 4.

title: He Works In The Dog House
description: THE DODGE VAN, as neat as a pin, has been carefully outfitted by its bearded young owner. But no murals decorate its exterior, and no deeppile carpeting is tacked within. The only evidence of the owner's mission is a small, neat sign. Call it a shingle. It reads: Mobile Vet erinary Service.

title: 4 Major Government Programs Benefit Poor Almost Exclusively
description: WASHINGTON, April 2More than 50 Government programs provide some form of cash or services for various categories of poor people. Many, such as Social Security and veterans pensions, benefit the poor only coincidentally. What follows is a description of four of the major programs that benefit the poor almost exclusively:

title: In the Home Buyer's Bazaar, It's the Custom to Haggle
description: Call it negotiating, bargaining, or hagglingit goes on in almost every real estate deal in the Northeast.

title: The Drug War On Cancer
description: In 1968, when my mother was dying of cancer, drug treatment was the poor relation in the family of cancer therapies. Patients like my mother, with advanced cancer that had not responded to the standard treatmentssurgery and radiation therapywere pumped full of toxic drugs in the hope that some would grant them respite, albeit temporary, from the ravages of their disease.

title: Foreign Auto Makers Are Finely Tuning the Engines of Change
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Radio station WBAIFM, the listenersponsored station that had been off the air for seven weeks in a staffmanagement dispute, was silenced again yesterday by vandals who entered the studio overnight and cut its telephone cables, including one leading to its transmitter on the Empire State Building. The station had returned to the air Friday evening after an agreement had been announced concerning union recognition and program policy.

title: After Ragtime, a New Rhythm
description: ON THE THIRD floor of his brownshingled home in New Rochelle, E. L. Doctorow is working on a new novel. I am engrossed by it, said the 4yearold author of the best seller Ragtime, which is now being made into a movie. He refrains from revealing details of his current work, although the considerable financial success of Ragtime has not made the arduous task of writing a novel a more relaxed and selfassured endeavor.

title: Susan Guthrie Betrothed To Alfred Stephen Ceresa
description: The engagement of Susan Lynne Guthrie to Alfred Stephen Ceresa has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Guthrie of Harrison, N.Y., parents of the bridetobe. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred G. Ceresa of Whitestone, Queens. A fall wedding is planned.

title: Amy Weigel  Is Betrothed
description: Frances P. Weigel of Pelham, N.Y., and William F. Weigel of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Amy Weigel, to William E. Minor 4th, son of Mrs. Hulse Hays Jr. and Mr. Minor 3d, both of Cincinnati. The couple will be married June 18.

title: Joseph Matthew Dempsey To Wed Sandra A. Kezer
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard F. Kezer of Shrewsbury. N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sandra Adams Kezer, to Joseph Matthew Dempsey, son of Mr. and Mrs. William T. J. Dempsey of Malden, Mass. A wedding in August is planned.

title: Douglas Weed Fiance Of Jeanne E. Collins
description: Charlotte C. Collins, treasurer and safety director of Wallingford, Conn., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Jeanne Elizabeth Collins, to Douglas Howard Weed, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward E. Weed of New Canaan, Conn.

title: Researchers Beginning to Learn Traits of Cancer Cells That Can Be Tested for, or Predict, Best Treatment
description: SARASOTA, Fla., April 2Researchers reported here today that they were beginning to zero in on special characteristics of cancer cells that could be used to test for or predict the most effective approach to treatment.

title: When Space Is a PremiumHang Plants
description: Growing up in New York City I had little contact with nature. All of this changed when my husband and I were married 30 years ago and we decided to live in a beautiful country area. My husband, who spent his early years in the country, introduced me to gardening and in a short time I was truly fascinated.

title: NASSAU TO ADD BUSES WITH U.S. FINANCING
description: MINEOLA, L.I., April 2Improvements in Nassau County's bus system will be made under a $4.8 million grant from the Urban Mass Transportation Administration, County Executive Ralph G. Caso announced this week.

title: Home Style.
description: Buy an old house and fix it up. And fix it and fix it and fix it.

title: Barzini Recalls New York and the 20's
description: I WAS having a drink in a Kuala Lumpur bar with a Malay princess educated at the London School of Economics. A British sailor kindly said to her: You speak English good for a wog. WASP's and others must undoubtedly have told Luigi Barzini that he writes English good for a wop, though he is not a wop (meaning a guapo, or Neapolitan) but a settentrionale, a northerner. His father was the great Barzini of Milan, first of the modern Italian journalists, the man who dragged Italian out of the mire of regional dialect on the one level and the ivory tower of pedantry on the other, making it serve plain, honest reportage. The family emigrated to America, and young Luigi worked hard at an adopted language to become himself a considerable journalist and a charming, witty and erudite interpreter of the Italians to the Englishspeaking world.

title: CatholicJewish Meeting Condemns All Proselytism
description: Interfaith experts are hailing the outcome of the sixth meeting of the International CatholicJewish Liaison Committee last week in Venice at which Catholic participants lined up behind a position that strongly condemns all forms of proselytism.

title: San Francisco Sues Unions
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 2 (UPI)Six locals, 16 unions and 17 union executives are defendants in a $14.2 million suit filed by the city of San Francisco over losses the city says it suffered in the 38day strike by city craft workers last spring.

title: Infant Formula at Issue
description: A threeyear campaign by church agencies against the marketing of powdered baby milk in poor countries has resulted in what may be the first lawsuit ever filed against a corporation by a group of its own shareholders on ethical grounds

title: Teresa Lynch Is Engaged to Robert Brennan
description: Dr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Lynch of East Hills, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Teresa Mary Lynch, to Robert Owen Brennan, son of Mr. and Mrs. B. Elliott Brennan of East Williston, L.I.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: WHEN a tall extension ladder is used around the outside of the house to climb up on the roof, or to get up to one of the dormers, one commonsense safety precaution usually recommended is to have an assistant hold the bottom of the ladder to keep it from slipping when the person who is climbing is up near the topespecially if he must step off the ladder and onto the roof to get the job done.

title: HIGHLIGHTS .OF THE WEEK
description: . . . Tne Untied states trade deficit in February widened to a record $1.87 billion, chiefly because of higher oil imports. . . . Officials in the Carter Administration expressed fears that the $50 tax rebate proposal was in jeopardy in Congress because of ideological differences and political resentments. . . . The value of construction contracts in February, according to F. W. Dodge, rose to $7.5 billion, up 14 percent from the yearearlier level. . . . Prices farmers received for commodities rose 1 percent from Feb. 15 to March 15, the Agriculture Department said.

title: Shouldn't Suspense Films Do More Than Just Kill Time?;
description: Near the climax of Black Sunday, at that point in the film when all the people watching it are supposed to be sitting on the edges of their seats, I was slumped back in mine asking myself boring questions about plausibility. There on the screen in front of me was the explosives'aden Goodyear blimp, poking its way lazily through blue sky toward Miami's Super Bowl, carrying two terrorists intent on assassinating the United States President and 79,999 other football fans, but all I was worrying about was why the intelligence officers aboard the pursuing helicopter simply hadn't radioed ahead to clear the stadium. John Frankenheimer, the director, three very expensive screenwriters and some excellent actors, including Bruce Dern and Robert Shaw, were knocking themselves out make this nightmare fantasy come true but my principal concern was with communication , I'd been disconnected

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: REPRESENTATIVE Lester L. Wolff returned last week from four days inspecting what he calls our Maginot Line, where the enemy is continually outflanking us and infiltrating our country.

title: Newburgh Divided Over the Possibility Of Flights by SST
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y.If the state ever gets serious about allowing Concorde supersonic planes to use Stewart Airport here, an informal survey of residents indicated, it will find a divided local constituency and a cautious but not unreceptive officialdom.

title: Turns to Consumer
description: cause there is so much disagreement between the Korean and Chinese schools that we cannot develop a set of standards, Mrs. Houis said.

title: The Region
description: In dry legal language and in impassioned feelings often tinged with racial and class overtones, a major contest is now under way in the region, and in the nation, over who is to live in newly developing suburban areas.

title: BRAZIL'S OPPOSITION ASSAILS GEISEL MOVE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 2In an unexpectedly combative mood, the opposition party in Brazil denounced today the suspension of Congress by President Ernesto Geisel and called on its followers to join in a peaceful struggle for the conquest of democracy, with liberty and social justice.

title: A Clouded Crystal Ball
description: THE wag who said that if all the economists in the world were put end to end they still wouldn't reach a conclusion didn't allow for the practitioners of that science at the NassauSuffolk Regional Planning Board. The board's economists put out its forecast for 1977 recently for the Long Island region and the conclusion is a grim one.

title: School Aide Faces Inquiry by Board Over Reading Test
description: The Board of Education is investigating whether a Manhattan school superintendent took advantage of his position on a testselection committee to obtain and distribute copies of the citywide reading test in his district weeks before it was to be given.

title: Welfare Is a Major Issue for Carter
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Within the next month, a special study group of the Carter Administration will send the White House a detailed analysis of the nation's welfare policy, That report, to a President who has promised to overhaul a complicated and often inequitable welfare system that has developed over many years, is likely to stimulate one of the most intense political debates of Jimmy Carter's Presidency.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Trade talk. Along Publishers Row this spring everyone has more than one eye peeled on the trade paperbackthe type of softcovered book issued by nearly every American publisher, usually sold in bookstores at an average price higher than its massmarket counterpart. While the sales of massmarket books has levelled off in recent years, the trades constitute one of the fastest growing sectors of U.S. publishing: sales up 78 percent during the last five years to account for $124 million in 1976.

title: FRANK H. CONNOR, 74, OF CARL FISCHER INC.
description: Frank Hayden Connor, president of Carl Fischer Inc., one of the bestknown publishers of classical music in the country, died Friday at his home in Darien, Conn. He was 74 years old.

title: Now Mr. Carter Has Lost One in the Struggle Over Nuclear Arms Control
description: WASHINGTONIn the discouragement of the moment, it appeared an almost apocalyptic development, something that ought to prompt the Bulletin of Atomic Scientists to move the minutehand on its doomsday clock a little closer to midnight.

title: Soviet to Allow Entry of Five Books of Moses as Gift
description: The Soviet Government has granted permission to an interfaith organization to print and ship 10,000 copies of the Pentateuch (the Five Books of Moses) to Moscow as a gift to the Soviet Jewish community.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: ONE of New Jersey's inveterate train riders, Senator Clifford P. Case, Republican of Rahway, has set out again to derail the PATH, Extension Express, calling it a particularly wasteful use of funds:

title: Schoolboy Puts Shot 694
description: TACOMA, Wash., April 2 (AP)Vince Goldsmith of Mount Tacoma High School heaved the 12pound shot 69 feet 4 inches today and won the shotput event at the Daffodil Relays. Meet officials said Goldsmith's toss was the best among high school athletes in the nation this year and moved him to seventh place on the alltime national prep list.

title: Mr. Califano Explains
description: Apparently chastened by the controversy over remarks he made earlier this month that seemed to favor racial quotas to redress past discriminatory practices, Joseph Callfano, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, has admitted those remarks were A mistake. Mr. Califano said he really meant to imply that discriminatory practices would best be rectified by affirmative action, such as special training programs. Several educators had expressed their disagreement with Mr. Califano's remarks directly to President Carter, and Mr. Centeno conceded that quota was a nerveJangling word.

title: GARDENING
description: SOME beginning New Jersey gardeners seem to be afraid of planting seeds outdoors too early. It depends on what you propose to plant.

title: Spring Is the Time for a Home TuneUp
description: All professional maintenance and repair men know that a regular program of preventive maintenance, accompanied by prompt attention to minor repairs as soon as the need for them arises, is the surest way to ward off major breakdowns later on.

title: Most Governments, in Fact, Are Outraged by Opposition From Organized Religion
description: NAIROBI, KenyaOne of the few internal challenges confronting both the white minority regimes of Rhodesia and South Africa and many black African governments is opposition to national policies from religious groups.

title: Retired Firehouses Find New Careers
description: Engine Company 24, a small turnofthecentury firehouse at 78 Morton Street in the West Village, was showing definite signs of a midlife crisis only a year ago.

title: Dr. J. M. Jessup Plans to Marry Kathleen Foxen
description: Kathleen Amy Foxen, an inpatient administrator at the New York Hospital Cornell Medical Center, and Dr. J. Milburn Jessup, a former resident in surgery there, plan to be married May 7.

title: Music in Review
description: An active member of several local chamber groups, Andre Emelianoff was heard on his own for the first time here on Wednesday night in Carnegie Recital Hall. With Meg Bachman Vas as his pianist, he offered a nicely varied program: Schumann's Adagio and Allegro, Debussy's Sonata, a Beethoven Sonata (Op. 102, No. 2), Webern's Three Little Pieces (Op. 11) and the Cesar Franck Sonata.

title: Efforts to Establish Commodities Fund Collapse in Geneva
description: GENEVA, April 2The 107nation conference on a multibilliondollar fund to stabilize world commodity prices ended tonight in failure except for an uncertain agreement for a new meeting in November.

title: Lonely Suburbs, Lonely. Souls
description: IREACT to suburbs like an alcoholic to Antabus. I grew up not on the wrong side of the tracks. but nearly on the tracks. Hungry for my due, I left the house that shook when the 4:09 came through, and moved into the suburbs. After three months, I left those suburbs for the city. I fear the lonely conformity and resent the affluence of suburbia. That was nine years ago. Today, if someone offered me a house in the suburbs, could I refuse? Could I survive? I have seen my friendsespecially the womenwither there quietly without protest. Their friends are the parents of their children's friends. A college roommate married an engineer and moved to Tarrytown: I'm so involved in the doing of things, I have lost sight of why I'm doing them. Is it because it's the thing to do, or because I really want my daughter to have ballet lessons? She floundered at the age of 32, drowned under her house and children and husband's business associates, and I have never seen her since.

title: ENCOUNTER
description: Idly walking along the Thames Embankment several years ago, I noticed a sign announcing, Boats to Kew.

title: Scope Is Wide, but There Is Different Treatment for Different Groups
description: WASHINGTONPresident Carter did not make much publicly of his instructions to the armed services last week to upgrade automatically the undesirable discharges of 60,000 of the 69,170 Vietnam military deserters, to offer the same opportunity to 92,000 others who got undesirable discharges, and to review the cases of 260,000 more. Nor did he or anyone else at the White House draw attention to the wide scope of the instructions.

title: Levich, 60, Still Awaits Exit Visa, Living in Ostracism in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, April 2  Glory to the Great Soviet People proclaims the sign atop a yellow apartment building on Leninsky Prospekt, where Veniamin G. Levich, an internationally known physical chemist, stubbornly resists scientific annihilation

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: President Carter's guidelines on conflict of interest have been heralded as the first step in restoring trust in our public officials. At least the President and his advisers, who wrote the new code, have promised as much. However, scrutiny of what has been offered confirms the cliche that the more things change, the more they stay the same.

title: City Opera: Boito's Mefistofele
description: In the performance of Boito's Mefistofele given by the New York City Opera on Thursday night, Judith Ehrlich, a soprano from Clifton, N.J., made her debut with the company singing the customarily paired roles of Margherita and Elena.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Article 9  No Title

title: The Answer Was Nyet
description: The centerpiece of dtente between the United States and the Soviet Union has always been the striving to end the stockpiling and development of strategic nuclear arms. Each side already has enough to destroy the other many times over, yet the effort to set limits must, by any human measure, go on or one day there will be no humans for measuring.

title: From Berkeley to Jerusalem
description: Shabbat in Jerusalem: No buses run, no newspapers are published, the highways are filled with teenage soldiers hitchhiking  their Uzi machine guns strapped to their shoulders. Everybody is trying to find his way home. In the Old City, a group of nuns retraces the Stations of the Cross down the Via Dolorosa. Over at the Wailing Wall, a circle of Hasidim dances around a young boy; when that bar mitzvah is done, he'll leave the wall, a man. From the religious frenzy of the day, sunset will strike Jerusalem like a hammer. The city seems to belong to the ages; its stones take on a ghostly blond iridescence, its sky becomes a peculiar de Chirico blue.

title: CRIME
description: There is a slight departure in the latest Dick Francis novel, IN THE FRAME (Harper & Row, $8.95)the hero is neither a jockey nor a trainer. Nearly all the Francis books until now have been concerned directly with the race track in one way or another. But the hero of In the Frame is an artist who paints horses. Thus the smell of track and paddock is missing. But that should not distress the many admirers of this popular writer. And there is one sequence in which the hero goes to the races and the odd bob or two.

title: OPEN BORDER STRAINS U.S.MEXICO RELATIONS
description: HOUSTON, April 2A century ago, a Mexican President, Sebastian Lerdo de Tejada, cautioned his people about the potential dangers when two nations, one rich and powerful, the other poor and weak, exist too close together

title: Mays Dance a Tribute to Sokolow
description: It's a little out of the ordinary to dedicate only half a program to someone, but half is better than none, especially when it is the better half. On Friday evening Jim and Lorry May devoted the concluding part of their varied and enjoyable dance concert to the works of Anna Sokolow and paid her a warm tribute. Beloved isn't a Word one tosses around carelessly, and they treated her work as tenderly as they obviously regard her.

title: Pisani in Place for 78 Race
description: WHAT does it mean when a state senator from Westchester spends his own money to zip up to Buffalo to speak at a consumer conference, or braves snowstorms to fly to Syracuse to discuss children's rights before the Junior League, or to Dunkirk, N.Y., to address an ItalianAmerican organization?

title: Briarcliff Students Return to a College Soon to Join Pace U.
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y., April 2Briarcliff college students returning from vacation will resume classes at a somewhat different school Monday, one without a president and about to become a part of Pace University.

title: San Jose Women Take Top 3 Places in Fencing
description: HARRISONBURG, Va., April 2 (AP)San Jose State, which yesterday won its third straight team title in the National Intercollegiate Women's Fencing Association, swept the top three places today in the individual competition.

title: Connecticut Boy. 14. Electrocuted
description: GREENWICH, Conn., April 2 (AP)A 14yearold Greenwich boy was electrocuted yesterday on Conrail property, the police said. The boy, John German, climbed through a hole in a wire fence on a railroad overpass and his foot hit an overhead wire carrying about 11,000 volts, the police said.

title: A Shopper's Price Odyssey
description: For two years the people have been holding offit has to be a good year, says Henry Bell, who sells Toyota cars in Caldwell, N.J.

title: A Seminary of Eight
description: ATOP A HILL looking serenely toward Stamford's bustling business center a few blocks away, but in a world removed in mood and spirit, stands St. Basil's College, said to be the only seminary in the United States dedicated to training priests for the Ukrainian Catholic Church.

title: VonnegutBig in Russia
description: THE most popular American author in the U.S.S.R. this decade is Kurt Vonnegut. Most of his anthologized stories, and all of his novels except Mother Night, The Sirens of Titan and Slapstick have been translated into Russian. Several novels have appeared in Estonian, Latvian and other Soviet languages as well. Quite likely all of his works will eventually be published in the U.S.S.R.

title: Detente With the Babysitter
description: THE CHARACTERS: The Mother. The Father. The Babysitter, age 16. The Daughter, age 6. Scene One  The Mother and Father on the front seat of a car on the Merritt Parkway early Saturday night.

title: Cathy Rush Quits in a Blaze of Trails
description: Cathy Rush has the sevenyear itch. After guiding women's basketball to national prominence as coach of Immaculata's quintet from 197177, Mrs. Rush has resigned to do other things that need doing. All the 29yearold ?? at immaculata was win three straight national titles (197274): compile a 14915 wonlost record, and blaze numerous trails for the advancement of the women's game.

title: The Golf Clinic
description: The season can start nowit's Masters time.

title: Bich Making Third Bid for America's Cup
description: With the same aggressive spirit that launched ballpoint pens and lighters onto countertops around the world, Baron Marcel Bich of France is zeroing in on the America's Cup. It hasn't been easy for the 62yearold baron. Nothing as simple as a flick of a Bic. But he will be in Newport, R.I., again this summer for his third bid for the cup in seven years. And he'll have company. For the first time, there is a challenging fleet of four 12Meter yachts. And for the first time, there will be lengthy practice sessions and preliminary trials10 weeks in all to hone boat and crew to peak performance.

title: A SoninLaw From Teaneck
description: NEW JERSEY may have lost a dentist when Jeff Keller of Teaneck succumbed to the call of the theater. But the way his career is going, it looks as if the state will some day be proud it has gained him as an actor.

title: Some Discordant Notes
description: Mr. Rudoff continued to press his case with political figures and state agencies, calling for a complete audit of the symphony.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: SEVERAL years ago, our children grown up and settled far away, we left New York City and moved to Oradell, and in a little house on a quiet street we began a different kind of life. We weren't exactly frightened, but we both confessed to a bit of apprehension. After all, we didn't know a soul in town.

title: What Is Hard Porn Doing In a Nice Place Like This?
description: Peach Fuzz is not the name of a new ice cream flavor. If it were, say residents of Kew Gardens, Queens, they would be a lot happier.

title: ART
description: THERE are certain dirty words in art criticism and, although they may not appear dirty to the layman, they have a dirty connotation among some art circles. One of the words is design, which, like its sister wordsillustration, decoration and patterncan be used to signify a visual experience that might be interesting on many levels but does not quite have the stuff to make it in the lofty realm of high art.

title: Ann Dunham Engaged To Michael A. Hartson
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Putnam Dunham of Ridgefield, Conn., and St. Huberts, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ann Johnson Dunham, to Michael Alan Hartson, son of Mr, and Mrs. Richard Louis Hartson of Keene, N. Y.

title: The Region
description: New Jersey has tentatively adopted a new approach to end the redlining of decaying city neighborhoods by mortgage lenders: The state sold $100 million in taxexempt bonds last week and will use the money for smallhome mortgages at lower than usual interest rates.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The Bicentennial Year is over but the Bicentennial Era goes on and on. The medal shown here is typical of what may be had by the members of the American Bicentennial Commemorative Society over the next few years

title: Leader of Nigeria, Presenting Budget, Stresses Austerity
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, April 2 (Agence FrancePresse)The head of state, Lieut. Gen. Olusegun Obasanjo, has announced a $13.8 billion budget for the coming Year, combined with an austerity program including tighter import controls, a selective continuation of the wage freeze and emphasis on agricultural development and industrialization.

title: William Clark to Wed Amanda Hoagland
description: Amanda Hoagland, who will graduate next month from Bowdoin College, plans to be married June 11 to William Merritt Clark, who graduated from Bowdoin last year and is an assistant coach in Bowdoin's athletic department.

title: White/Caucasian
description: DAVIS, Calif. The campus on the dusty floor of Sacramento Valley halfway between San Francisco and the High Sierras seems a remote place for the birth of another great challenge to the resilience and fairness of the American Constitution. But a small envelope delivered to that rural outpost on Nov. 26, 1972, set in motion just such a battle. And the ultimate outcome of what is now called Bakke v. the Regents of the University of California is regarded by many as the most important matter affecting race relations and minority groups in the United States since the schooldesegregation ruling of 1954.

title: New and Noteworthy
description: THE AMERICAN LANGUAGE, by H. L. Mencken. (Knopf, $7.95.) An abridgment of a nowclassic inquiry into the development of English in the United States by an idiosyncratic Baltimore newspaperman that helped clear our cultural air during the Age of Babbitry and marked the path for future scholarly inquiry; this version is the work of Raven I. McDavid Jr. with assistance from David W. Maurer.

title: Meadowlands
description: Time2:04 .

title: A Psychologist Who Doubles in Brass
description: WHEN Joan Kakascik of Saddle Brook goes to Fort Dix next month, it won't be to visit a boyfriend or a husband. It will be to learn how to fire crewserved weapons, such as a grenade launcher, a machine gun and light antitank weapons.

title: Realty News
description: By most standards, 100,000 square feet is a major office space commitment. It is the equivalent of about four full floors in a mediumsize, modern skyscraper, enough space for about 500 workers.

title: Lawyer Says Texan Told Him Oswald Had Aid in 63 Plot
description: DALLAS, April 2 (UPI)An attorney said today that George de Mohrenschildt convinced him before he died that there had been a conspiracy to assassinate President Kennedy, but never did indicate that he was involved in it.

title: Peggy L. Washer Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Washer of East Rockaway, L. I., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Peggy L. Washer, to Andrew L. Anmuth, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Anmuth of Harbor Isle, L. I. The wedding will take place next month.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Shocking though it may seem, the Soviet Union and the United States now have enough salt to ruin every bowl of soup on earth 36 times. It is this grim statistic with its nasty implications for the palate of mankind that has led to the salt talks between Moscow and Washington.

title: . . . and how it got here
description: FOR nearly five years now, while she relived endlessly the most remarkable encounter any nonofficial American has had with a Chinese leader since Edgar Snow first ventured to Yenan, Roxane Witke has felt the need of something like an exorcism to release her from the psychological and intellectual burdens that were laid on her by that imperious first lady, Chiang Ch'ing. She had a certain witchlike quality, Witke said the other day. She cast a spell over the people who were near her, and she cast a spell, I know, over me. It became impossible for me to speak about her, even to think about her. I had to disenchant myself.

title: Hurtling Down the Housatonic
description: BEFORE the first crocus signaled spring, while snow still spotted the bare land and motorists headed north with skis mounted on their automobiles, some hardymany would say foolhardysouls in this state decided, using the fuli force of their imaginations, that winter had come to an end. As soon as Connecticut's frozen rivers thawed and the water temperatures crept a degree or two above freezing in. early March, the devoted whitewater canoeists and kayakers scurriedpaddles, wetsuits and courage in handfor the rapids.

title: MRS. TRUDEAU IS REPORTED TO MISUSE FREE AIR PASS
description: TORONTO, April 2 (UPI)  Margaret Trudeau, the wife of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada has been using a free pass provided by Air Canada for her trips to New York on photographic assignments for People magazine The Globe and Mail reported today.

title: Trout Season Opens Saturday
description: SINCE March 14, a handful of New Jersey fish experts have been catching trout in the state by the thousands. By 8 o'clock next Saturday morning, they expect. to have netted 169,000 of themall at least eight inches longand, by May 27, more than 543,000.

title: Khaalls Is Jailed
description: Hamaas Abdul Khaalls, leader of the group of Hanafl Moslems who held 134 hostages for three days in Washington three weeks ago, has been Jailed after a prosecutor told a judge that Mr. Khaalis made bloodcurdling threats in tapped phone conversation. Mr. Khaalis had been allowed to remain free in his own recognizance as part of the agreement that won the release of the hostages. Prosecutors claim that Mr. Khaalis overheard threat to kill 200 unnamed persons violated a provision of the tightly worded agreement, which required that he not engage in any conduct which would result in his arrest.

title: Star of Tar Heel Circuit Is in Pennsylvania Show Today
description: The English and American Ch. Haywire Hetman of Whinlatter, the Star of the Tar Heel circuit and a dog that never lets up in the ring, is back in competition today at the Laurel Highlands show in Johnstown, Pa. Harry's got to be the top terrier in the nation thus far this year, noted Cliff Hallmark, the wire fox's handler. The duo just returned last week to Mendham, N.J., after Harry pocketed the Tar Heel shows at Roanoke, Va., Greensboro, N.C., Raleigh, N.C., and Fayetteville, N.C.

title: ART
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR

title: LOST HORIZONS OF RUSSIAN PAINTING
description: Russian painting had, until lately, a very low profile. To get to know it, you had to go to Moscow and Leningrad, and you had to know at least enough Russian to read the labels on the frames. Guides were impatient. There was almost nothing to read about Russian painting. In winter in the U.S.S.R. it gets dark right after lunch, and in summer the heat and the crowds leave you giddy. And your friends weren't even sympathetic: Russian painting, they said, was like Egyptian burgundysomething to be sampled as a curiosity and thereafter pushed firmly to one side.

title: M.T.A. and County Disagree on Railroad
description: IT seems probable that the 6,000 users of badly rundown upper section of Conrail's Harlem Division, which serves a growing part of the county above North White Plains, are in for some improvements beginning in a year, maybe, or two, or three or four, or five.

title: HIGH RADIATION FOUND IN HOUSING IN FLORIDA
description: LAKELAND, Fla., April 2Three scientists from the Federal Environmental Protection Agency have found dangerously high radiation levels in more than onethird of the homes they tested in a development built on reclaimed phosphate mining lands a few miles south of this quiet central Florida city.

title: Adult Athletes Who Act And Play Like Children
description: I've been led to believe that in competitive society, the ultimate is to feel worthwhile, to feel contented, to feel you've accomplished something.

title: A Bright Idea to Help Fund The Arts
description: Congressman Fred Richmond is trying once again to get an arts bill through Congress. The arts need help. A decade ago there was much talk about the cultural explosion, but some of us did not take it seriously then, and events have upheld our pessimistic judgment. Inflation is killing off arts organizations left and right, and our biggest organizationsopera houses, museums, drama and dance groups, name itare in desperate trouble, all of them, with an everwidening gap between income and expenses

title: Carolyn Post Bride Of Stephen Williams
description: In St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Wellesley, Mass., yesterday afternoon. Carolyn Oakley Post, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles D. Post of Weston Mass., and Christmas Cove, Me., became the bride of Stephen Judson Williams, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Williams of Perrysburg. Ohio. The RevJames R. MacColl 3d performed the ceremony.

title: Letters
description: Dealing with Castro

title: Kearny Designer Finds Success in Boys' Clothes
description: GAZZELLE DIAZ, a willowy young design student from Kearny, has just scored her first hit. Miss Diaz, a secondyear student at the Parsons School of Design in New York, is the winner of the school's J.C. Penney competition in clothing for boys, for which, the talented 20yearold has received a $300 check and the thrill of seeing her design translated into reality.

title: 90 Years of Medical Service
description: IN MARCH 1887, six doctors met in a home on North Stockton Street in Trenton and organized a oneroom medical facility known as the Trenton City Dispensary to help the city's indigent patients. The need was so great that two years later the first homeopathic house of mercya 25bed hospitalwas opened in a nearby farmhouse and a year later the city's first training school for nurses was founded there.

title: The World
description: In Summary

title: Inconsistency Is Marking Knicks Season
description: Last Feb. 8, after the Knicks had shot 58 percent, collected 36 assists and beaten the Lakers, 125107, Coach Jerry West of Los Angeles said, The Knicks put on a clinic and we watched. They executed about as well as they have since the 197273 championship season.

title: Monumental Battle Looms Over AirCrash Claims
description: The event that insurance underwriters had dreaded for years, the collision last Sunday of two 747's, will create a monstrous complex of claims that many experts believe will shatter the present limits and systems of compensation.

title: From East Germany: A Look Back on the Nazi Terror
description: The Holocaust is a saleable topic in foreign films these days as exemplified by Line Wertmuller's boxoffice hit Seven Beauties from Italy and by Frank Beyer's.Jacob the Liar from East Germany. The former, as everyone knows, deals with survival in a concentration camp. The latter, as almost no one knows, looks at survival in a ghetto, and it was nominated for this year's Academy Award for the Best Foreign Film, a category in which it won at the 1976 Festival of Americas.

title: The Search for A Summer House
description: JOSEPH C1OFFI is a 24yearold dataprocessing auditor for a major insurance brokerage concern who also happens to be a house hunter. The last two summers, he has spent his weekends and vacations in Belmar as a groupie, one of the hundreds of thousands of young people whose annual descent on the Jersey Shore in search of sun, sea and sand help to make the resort trade one of the state's biggest industries.

title: 8 Nations Ready for World Title Hockey; Islanders Lose, 53, as Do Rangers, 41
description: While the Czechoslovaks, the 1976 world champions, have conceded that last September's Canada Cup was the most valid test of world hockey supremacy, the Soviet Union still maintains that the world championships beginning April 21 in Vienna will determine this season's best hockey team.

title: INVESTING
description: Commodity people tell an old story about a French balloonist who is wafted over the English Channel and lands at the edge of a meadow.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: A 4thGrade Reader Is Hardly Illiterate

title: A Tale of Three Mayors
description: LOS ANGELES, April 1There's seldom a vacation from politics for big city mayors, as witness the widely varying circumstances under which California's Big Three find themselves currently on the run.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To The Editor:

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Field Trips in the Spring
description: On several recent days, a sense of spring crept through the canyons of New York like a frightened girl.

title: Miss Kirkland Engaged
description: The Rev. Dr. H. Burnham Kirkland, metropolitan district superintendent of the New York Conference of the United Methodist Church, and Mrs. Kirkland of Scarsdale, N.Y.. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Chase Kirkland, to Dennis R. Rasmussen. Miss Kirkland and her fianc live in Denver.

title: 3 Women Tie for Lead By Stroke
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., April 2Midway through today's third round of the ColgateDinah Shore golf tournament, just before the national telecast began, the bad weather that had plagued the richest tournament in women's golf turned fine, and the stage was set for a stampede finish tomorrow with three players tied for the lead and nine others within three strokes.

title: His Name and the Governorship Are Once More Linked
description: ALBANYPerry B. Duryea Jr. has looked at power from both sides now.

title: Susan Britton Married to Gregory Pettingill
description: Susan Whyte Britton, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Richard Chadwick Britton of South Portland, Me., was married yesterday to Gregory Martin Pettingill, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lee D. Pettingill Jr. of Glyndon, Md. The Protestant ceremony was performed in the Baker Chapel of Western Maryland College in Westminster by the Rev. Dr. Ira G. Zepp and the Rev. Paul Deckenbach.

title: Book Review
description: FICTION

title: BRIDGE
description: WESTCHESTER plays a big part in the world's biggest bridge competition, the Grand National Team Championship, which last year attracted some 6,000 teams in North America. In the current season 94 teams entered in Westchester, probably the biggest entry anywhere in relation to population.

title: 2 States Eligible for Drought Aid
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP)President Carter has declared drought emergencies for the states of Iowa and Washington. An announcement Thursday said that Mr. Carter's action will provide emergency livestock feed assistance by the Agricultural Stabilization and Conservation Service to assist livestock producers in Federal Disaster Assistance Administration subsequently designated Lyon, Plymout and Sioux counties in Iowa and Benton and Yakima counties in Washington as eligible for immediate assistance.

title: Riddick and Foster Excel
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., April 2 (AP)The Philadelphia Pioneers, led by Steve Riddick, an Olympic gold medalist, and Charles Foster. a worldclass hurdler, set three meet records today in the 15th Colonial Relays at the College of William and Mary. Four other marks also fell.

title: West Orange Stresses New Recycling Program
description: WEST ORANGEEvery other week, Lenore Baer reaches for the bottles she has cleaned and stored away. It is her turn to put them by the curb for pickup as part of this Essex County community's recycling program of separating glass and Paper from other garbage.

title: TelebooksHistory and Economics
description: THE two works under review are telebooks; that is to say, they have been written to accompany television programs. In consequence, it is as difficult to judge them on their own as it is to assess an operatic libretto unaccompanied by the music.

title: Kathryn McKinley Is Bride
description: Kathryn Sue McKinley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon W. McKinley of Summit, N. J., was married there yesterday afternoon to Gilbert G. Roessner Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Roessner of Summit and Palm Beach, Fla. The Rev. Robert V. Morris, assisted by the Rev. John P. Egan, performed the ceremony in Calvary Episcopal Church.

title: Apathy and an Ageold Struggle
description: Till taught by pain, Men really know not what good water's worth. George Gordon, Lord Byron

title: Not Everyone Wants Utopia
description: IN 1948, a group of New York City residents committed to the concept of cooperative ownership and  admirers of the then radical modernity of Frank Lloyd Wright retained the architect to design a community and group of homes along the lines of his principles of organic unity. The result was 48 sprawling, mostly flatroofed, splitlevel homes that fit like jigsawpuzzle pieces into the hills, rock outcroppings and trees of a 100acre enclave in the town of Mount Pleasant.

title: California and Nevada in Impasse Over Urbanization at Lake Tahoe
description: LOS ANGELES, April 2Politicians of two states remain deadlocked about how to curb the destructive urbanization of a nationally prized, natural area, Lake Tahoe and its environs, on the CaliforniaNevada border.

title: In the U.S. This Week, Sadat Will Try to Determine If the Optimism Is Justified
description: BEIRUTAs President Anwar elSadat of Egypt arrives in Washington this week for his second visit in less than 18 months, the stalemate between Israel and the Arabs about reconvening a Middle East peace conference remains but beneath that bleak outlook, Arab and foreign analysts discern a number of subtle signs of change that they regard as hopeful for achieving progress, although they caution It may take a long time to tie up the package.

title: State Quandary: Site for New Prison
description: ALTHOUGH more than half54 permit to he preciseof the persons sentenced to prison in New Jersey each year come from Essex, Passaic, Bergen, Hudson and Union Counties, none of these counties has a major state correction facility.

title: Design
description: The renewed interest in Art Deco could have been a passing fad. Instead, it continues to influence current interior design. Bolstered by museum exhibitions, the best relics of the period have acquired the status and price tags of collector's items. Current furniture design, too, has adapted soft, voluptuous forms and satin covers from Art Deco styling, and banquettes and chaise longues, popular early in the century, are the height of elegance again.

title: Coming Soon: A Guide to the Arts
description: DID you know that one of the world's foremost experts on Stradivarius violins lives in Larchmont? His name is Hubert Goodkind and he is the author of The Violin Iconography of Stradivarius Violins, a book that contains photographs of every Stradivarius in existence. It took seven years to research and write.

title: Brooklyn Law School Professor Battles the State Over Fiscal Issues
description: Prof. Leon Edward Wein of Brooklyn Law School insists he has no qualms whatsoever about having taken on the formidable Fiscal Establishment of New York State in a series of legal battles.

title: The Traders Are Not All Convinced by U.S. Professions of Restraints on Weapons Sales
description: The Traders Are Not All Convinced by U.S. Professions of Restraints on Weapons Sales

title: MUSIC
description: COMPETITIONS are unkind, unfair and probably fattening, but until somebody comes up with a better system for pinpointing worthy talent, they are here to stay. Certainly they are flourishing in Westchester and Fairfield, where a number of contest winners will be reaping the performance rewards of victory this month and next. Other young players will collect their recently won prize appearances next season, and at least two competitions are still very much up for grabs.

title: LETTER FROM PRINCETON
description: AN ASSERTION I once disputed is that husbandhunting is the chief occupation of college girls. Not at Princeton, I insisted, not in the land of preparation for, and promise of, bright career prospects

title: The Gospel According to Anthony Burgess
description: When the first threehour installment of the twopart Jesus of Nazareth historical drama is presented tonight at 8 P.M. by NBC, it will be without the sponsorship of General Motors, which invested close to $5 million in the project over a period of three years.

title: Moscow's New Hostage Policy
description: PARISWhile optimists speculate that the bleak, negative policy displayed by Moscow during Secretary of State Vance's visit will pass, pessimists believe the Kremlin has decided to test President Carter's resolutionjust as Khrushchev tested Kennedy in Vienna (following the Bay of Pigs disaster). Khrushchev apparently decided Kennedy was a cookypusher and secretly installed nuclear missiles in Cuba. Kennedy forced him to withdraw.

description: SUNDAY, APRIL 3, 1977

title: World News Briefs
description: MADRID, April 2 (AP)The Spanish Supreme Court declined to rule today on the legality of the Communist Party, passing the question back to the Government of Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez.

title: Pop: Mainstream Johnny Mathis
description: When Johnny Mathis began making records, in 1956, rockandroll had barely begun to challenge the hegemony of middleoftheroad pop music in the marketplace. Columbia Records was heavily committed to mainstream pop and completely opposed to rock, and they must have seen in the young Mr. Mathis an alternative to the raw energy of Elvis Presley and Chuck Berry.

title: No Hillbillies in These Hills
description: An Oral History. Edited by Laurel Shackelford and Bill Weinberg. Illustrated. 397 pp. New York: Hill & Wang. $12.95.

title: Thai Retains Ring Title With 6thRound Knockout
description: TOKYO, April 2 (AP)Saensak Maungsurin, a tough southpaw from Thailand, knocked out Guts Ishimatsu, the Japanese challenger, in the sixth round today to defend successfully his world junior welterweight crown for the second time. Saensak, a strong prefight favorite, landed the knockout blow at 1 minute 56 seconds of the sixth round to score his eighth victory, including seven knockouts, in nine fights.

title: Article 15  No Title
description: Article 15  No Title

title: DINING OUT
description: How is one to rate an Italian restaurant that covers cannelloni with a halfcooked sauce still tasting of flour, yet for the,same meal flames a duck with triple sec so that its crisp skin crackles under your fork and orangesimmered liquid bathes its tender meat?
