title: For Quick Sale: Lovely House in the 131coklyn Navy Yard
description: This 171yearold house Is called the Matthew C. Perry House, or simply Quarters A, by Navy personnel. It,haS been home to the commanding. officer, of the Navy Yard pest since 1806, when the mansion, framed in hand hewil oalt; was built for the then considerable price of $20,900. Commodore Perry lived in the house in 184143. One of the early occupants and his family found the mansion l: comfortable, although there was some doubling up among the 13 children+= the seven bedrooms did not quite go around.

title: Congressman Says C.I.A. Pledges to Stop Sponsoring EnglishLanguage Books
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Representative Don Edwards, Democrat of California, said today that the Central Intelligence Agency had informed him it was no longer secretly underwriting the publication of Englishlanguage books as part of its clandestine propaganda effort.

title: Report to the U. S. S. R.
description: Dear Leonid: I hear you were surprised when Henry didn't show up at your place the other day, but that was no reason to treat Cy like a total stranger. The fact is, Henry has moved out of the neighborhood and taken on three or four new jobs and is making a mint, and Cy has moved into his place.

title: Market Place
description: Investors in the Digital Equipment Corporation, maker of minicomputers, were shaken last week when the International Business Machines Corporation, the industry colossus, cut prices on a computer memory system competitive with an important Digital product.

description: Article 2  No Title

title: Shirley Graham DuBois, 69, Writer And Widow of Civil Rights Leader
description: TOKYO, April 4 (AP)Shirley Graham DuBois, widow of the black American civil rights pioneer W. E. B. DuBois, has died in Peking of cancer, Hsinhua, the official Chinese press agency, reported today. She was 69 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MAN'S NATURE At 8 o'clock tonight, in the auditorium of the American Museum of Natural History, the public is invited to attend a filmlecture tribute to John Burroughs, the internationally known naturalist. The John Burroughs Memorial Association was founded in 1921, shortly after his death.

title: Big Board Studying Sport Betting Claim
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that it began an investigation last week that a person on its trading floor was accepting bets on sporting events. The exchange added that it was acting on the basis of an assertion it had received. The Big Board said that the investigation would continue until all facts are developed.

title: DOLLAR OFF ABROAD, GOLD PRICE RISES
description: LONDON, April 4 (AP)The dollar declined against Europe's major currencies today while the price of gold rose ahead of the International Monetary Fund's gold auction, scheduled for Wednesday.

title: Business Records
description: Monday, April 4, 1977

title: Palestinian Guerrillas Strike Back At Rightist Units in South Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 4Palestinian guerrillas opened a major counterattack today in southern Lebanon against Lebanese rightwing Christian militia forces that receive supply and artillery support from Israel.

title: Home Demand Still Strong In Spite of Cost Pressures
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (UPI)Buyers of new homes require $5,000 more on average for a down payment now than they did only four years ago, according to the nation's central bank.

title: Hunting With Birds of Prey
description: HARTFORD, April 4 (AP)The Connecticut 'egislature's Environment Committee approved a bill today that would legalize hunting with birds of prey . would require hunters to get a permit before they trained or used birds of prey, generally falcons.

title: More Boys Than Girls Admitted For Third Year by Hunter High
description: For the third consecutive year, more boys than girls have won admission to Hunter College High School, which was allfemale from its 1869 founding until 1974. The school, for gifted children, at Park Avenue and 94th Street.

title: OilSoaked Birds Washed Ashore
description: WILLAPA BAY, Wash., April 4 (UPI)Hundreds of oilsoaked birds washed ashore over the weekend on ocean beaches north of the Columbia River and south of Grays Harbor, and officials were unable to find the source of the oil.

title: BEAME PLAN IS DUE ON EDUCATION BOARD
description: A sweeping proposal by Mayor Beame to scrap the New York City Board of Education and replace it with a citywide Schools Commissioner, serving at the pleasure of the Mayor, is due to be made public in a month, at which time Mr. Beame plans to conduct public hearings on the merits of the plan, city officials said yesterday.

title: S.I. OIL DEALER ACCUSED OF RECEIVING STOLEN FUEL
description: A Staten Island heatingoil distributor was arrested yesterday and charged with receiving more than $700,000 worth of fuel oil stolen over a fiveyear period from Exxon storage tanks in New Jersey.

title: Vietnam Buried on L.I. 10 Years After Death in Airceaff
description: BELLMORE, L. I., April 4 (AP) Nayy Lieut. William Klenert was buried in the Long Island National Cemetery in Pinelawn, L. I., 10 years after his death.

title: Exterminator Killed by Fumes
description: LAWNDALE, Calif., April 4 (UPI)An exterminator working to eradicate bugs, in an apartment complex collapsed and: died from the noxious gases. Nelson. Pineda, 34 years old, of Long Beach; Calif., was accidentally gassed to death during the fumigating operation Saturday.

title: Around the Nation
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., April 4 (AP)Nantucket islanders made it known today that they would rather not be part of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts if they cannot have their own seat in the Legislature.

title: WARREN STUDY INFLUENCE LAID TO F.B.I. BY O'NEILL
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (Reuters)Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. said today that he believed the Federal Bureau of Investigation had told some witnesses not to tell the Warren Commission the full truth about President Kennedy's assassination.

title: CHARLES S. COSTER
description: Charles H. Coster, a former United States vice consul in Florence, ied there on Sunday. He was 79 years old.

title: The Sadat Visit
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.President Anwar elSadat's current visit to Washington dramatizes United States interdependence with moderate Arab govermnents and the need for this country to pursue, no matter the obstacles, the strategy of Middle East peace enunciated last month by President Carter.

title: Pact Is Called Near for Pier's Use For Cargo Instead of a Car Pound
description: The New York City Commissioner of Ports and Terminals, Louis F. Mastriani, said yesterday afteh meeting with a prospective lessee of the city pier at 36th Street and the Hudson River that they were close to agreement on a contract. But whether the agreement with the prospect, the United Cargo Corporation, would solve the problem caused by police use of the pier for towedaway cars could not be determined.

title: Deaths
description: ACKERMANSadie, loving wife of Jacob. Beloved mother of Joyco and Ira. MotherInlaw of Janet. Devoted grandmother of Michael and Richard. Funeral services Tuesday 1:45 P.M. at the I. J. Morris Inc. Funeral Home, 1895 FlaIbush Ave. it block North of Kings Hwy.), Brooklyn.

title: COFFEE SUBSTITUTE UNSETTLES MARKET
description: News that the General Foods Corporation planned test marketing for a beverage, Mellow Roast, made from roasted coffee beans and wheat unsettled the coffee trade yesterday.

title: Tennis
description: AT LOS ANGELES

title: Organized Labor's Power in Washington: Setbacks Indicate Its Influence Is Less Strong Than Was Expected
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Organized labor's fabled lobbying juggernaut is proving to be a rather weak and wheezy machine in the early weeks of the Carter Administration.

title: MRS. MORT GLANKOFF
description: Jill Glankoff, the wife of Mort Glankoff, the founder and chairman of Cue Magazine, died yesterday at Morningside House in the Bronx after a lingering illness. She was 68 years old and lived at 219 East 31st Street.

title: Smith Beats Gottfried in Three Sets
description: LOS ANGELES, April 4It had . to happen, sooner or later. The string ran out for Brian Gottfried after 37 victories in 40 matches as he was beaten by Stan Smith in a. 2hour5minute slugfest that had the partisan crowd at Pauley Pavilion in an uproar. Smith won, 64; 26, 63, and took the title of the $150,000 Southwest Pacific open and the $27,000 first prize.

title: Phileas Fogg Drives Into New York
description: On the 70th day of their attempt to go around the world in 80 days, two Norwegians parked their dieselengined car on West 41st Street yesterday and listened to a noise level they had not heard, they said, since the clamorous traffic of Mideast and Asian cities.

title: Ballet: Stravinsky Rite of Spring
description: Stravinsky's wistful and brutal Rite of Spring has become a rite de passage for choreographers attracted to its rhythmic intricacies. Maurice Mart created his version almost 20 years ago, and it remains one of his most effective ballets. Sunday afternoon at the Uris Theater, his Ballet of the 20th Century concluded its season with a performance featuring Angle Albrecht and Daniel Lommel as the chosen ones.

title: Sunshine Mining Gets Bar on Stock Deal
description: . The Sunshine Mining Company announced that a United States District Court in Idaho had issued a temporary injunction blocking the Great Western United Corporation of Denver from making any offers for shares of Sunshine. The order is scheduled to expire April 11 unless extended by the court.

title: Stage: Suicide
description: Out of what must have been a shocking experience, the suicide of his mother, and the need to explore the reasons for such an act, Spalding Gray, in collaboration with Elizabeth Lecompte, has composed (to use their word) Rumstick Road, a play that is partly a documentary and partly a series of counterpointed happenings that resemble bits from silent movies.

title: FLORIDA DEVELOPERS IN TALKS WITH F.T.C.
description: Washington, April 4The Federal Trade Commission and the General Development Corporation are negotiating a settlement of allegations that the big real estate company has engaged in deceptive sales practices, according to a prospectus made available today at the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: G.M. INCREASES PRICE BY 0.4% FOR OPTIONS
description: DETROIT, April 4The General Motors Corporation said today it was raising optional equipment prices by about $25, or 0.4 percent on the average car.

title: Venezuela Is in Red In Two Fiscal Areas
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 4The Venezuelan Government's latest economic statistics show that despite its oil wealth the nation had a budget deficit of $332.8 million in 1976 and an overall balanceofpayments deficit of $286 million.

title: A Summary of Actions by the U.S. Supreme Court on Various Cases
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Gangland Killing in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, April 4 (UPI)A restaurant operator was shot to death in front of his Southwest Side home early today in what the police said appeared to be gangland hit by a masked gunman. The dead man was identified as John Lourgos, 53 years old, the owner of Lorenzo's Pizza and Gyros, a Near West Side restaurant.

title: People and Business
description: William E. Simon, former President Ford's Treasury Secretary, let the other shoe drop yesterday. Mr. Simon, age 49, the subject of much Wall Street speculation since he left Washington and Government service, will become senior consultant on economic and financial matters to the investment banking firm, Blyth Eastman Dillon & Company, Inc.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Asbury Park and Belmar, deduct 34 min. from Sandy Hook time. For high tide at Atlantic City (Steel Pier), deduct 26 min. from Sandy Hook time. For high tide at Jones Inlet (Pt. Lookout), deduct 19 min. from Sandy Hook time.

title: ENTRIES
description: Horses .Hsted In order of post position Letter designates OTB listing

title: GUARDS AT 10PRISONS OUT IN CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, April 4Prison guards in Connecticut went on strike today despite a court restraining order. The walkout, which built up gradually from yesterday afternoon into a fullblown strike this morning, was the first by prison guards in the state's history.

title: Hopes for Accord On Cyprus Are Dim As Parley Resumes
description: VIENNA, April 4Talks between representatives of the Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots aimed at seeking federal solution to their divided island's problems resumed today with scant prospects Of an earlyagreement.

title: U.S. Denies Its Miscalculation Led To Soviet Rebuff on Arms Control
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The White House and the State Department made a concerted effort today to deny reports that American miscalculations had induced the Russians to reject proposals for limiting strategic weapons.

title: Auto Collision in Italy Kills US. Motorcyclist
description: CAMPIANO, Italy, April 4 (AP)Six persons, including an American motorcyclist, Randy Cleek, and his American mechanic, Kurt W. Keifer, were killed in a headon collision between two autos last night near this northern Italian town, the police said today.

title: At Least 72 Die in Airliner Crash In Town 35 Miles From Atlanta
description: NEW HOPE, Ga., April 4At least 72 people were killed in this tiny rural community this afternoon when a Southern Airways DC9, its two jet engines knocked out, apparently damaged by hail, crashed onto a roadway.

title: The Speaker Takes a Look at His House:I Love This Job
description: WASHINGTON, April 4  Tip O'Neill pads around his big office in the Capitol, absently puffing a cigar, whispering on the phone, chatting with aides, telling yarns, stuffing notes into his pockets and  welcoming visiting Congressmen.

title: Michigan Botulism Cases Up to 35; Restaurant Is Sued by a Victim
description: PONTIAC, Mich., April 4 (UPI)The number of cases in the nation's worst outbreak of botulism rose to 35 today. One of the victims sued the Mexican restaurant that served the tainted food.

title: Bridge:
description: One of the most curious episodes of the recent Spring Nationals in Pasadena, Calif., was that Kathie Wei of New York, in all probability, forfeited a national title by being too successful. Her Vanderbilt Cup team had such great run, beating a string of strong teams including the secondseeded Brachman group to reach the final, that she was deprived by the scheduling of a chance to play in the Women's Knockout Team Championship.

title: Advertising
description: With the matter of New York landing rights for the controversial Concorde still awaiting a decision by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, the French manufacturer of the joint FrenchBritish supersonic jet last night began an ad campaign asking, Give it a fair hearing.

title: Bruno's Boss Is Being Watched
description: ATLANTIC CITY, April 4A Philadelphiabased tobacco and vending machine concern with reputed ties to an alleged crime figure, Angelo Bruno, can operate here as long as it conducts a legitimate business, Richard J. Williams, the Atlantic County Prosecutor, said today.

title: COURT BACKS ACCUSED ON DOUBLE JEOPARDY
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The Supreme Court ruled today, 7 to 1, that if the jury in a Federal criminal trial does not agree on a verdict and the trial judge then acquits the defendant the Government may not anneal the acauittal.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: Word and Deed in South Africa
description: Clarity and liberty tend to go together, like nuts and bolts. People who write and speak in the public arena have a certain obligation, therefore, to turn the wrench every once in a while in an act of preventive maintenance.

title: jazz: Ellington
description: Although Tommy Flanagan, who has been Ella Fitzgerald's piano accompanist for the last nine years, was the official guest soloist with the National Jazz Ensemble at the New School on Saturday, the true guest of the eveningin fact, the dominant force of the eveningwas the late Duke Ellington.

title: Dow Falls 11.80 to 915.56, Sharpest Drop in 3 Months
description: Stock prices fell sharply along a broad front yesterday, the Dow Jones industrial average tumbling 11.80 points to close at 915.56 in its largest drop in three months.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Berg's Lulu, 8.

title: Racial Split Expected in Vote Today for Young's Seat
description: ATLANTA, April 4Voters in the Atlanta's Fifth Congressional District are expected to divide sharply along racial. lines tomorrow when they select a successor to former Representative Andrew Young, who was one of only three Southern blacks in Congress when he resigned to become chief United States representative to the United Nations.

title: NEW YORK'S CUTBACKS ON MEDICAID BACKED
description: The Medicaid cutbacks promulgated by the New York State Department of Health were endorsed yesterday by the Federal Government after the regional office of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare eliminated some of the cuts sought by the state.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: FIGURE IN AGNEW CASE GIVEN 3MONTH TERN
description: BALTIMORE, April 4A major figure in the political kickback scandal that led to the resignation of former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew was sentenced to three months in jail and was fined $5,000 here today

title: $1 Million Norwalk Fire Destroys 115 Pleasure Boats
description: NORWALK, Conn., April 4A fire of undetermined origin punctuated by numerous gasolinetank explosions last night destroyed 115 sailboats and power craft in dry dock at three large marinas on Norwalk's waterfront. The damage was estimated at more than $1 million.

title: N.B.A. Referees Vote to Strike Playoffs Over Contract Dispute
description: Twentyfour of the 26 National Basketball Association referees, meeting in Chicago yesterday, voted unanimously to strike the playoffs, which are scheduled to begin next Tuesday, because of the failure to negotiate a new contract.

title: Mathews, Back in Alabama, Is Suspected of Politicking
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., March 29F. David Mathews, the former Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, has returned to Alabama determined to promote a social philosophy that seems to be no better received by students and faculty members at the University of Alabama here than it was by hureaucratc in Washington

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, APRIL 5, 1977

title: F.B.I. FILES DISCLOSE PLAN TO EXPLOIT CHURCH SPLIT
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation secretly attempted to exploit a disagreement within the Catholic Church to force cancellation of a student antiwar conference at Catholic University in 1971, according to bureau files made public today.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: Companies List Earnings Reports

title: Child's World
description: THE RABBITan ancient symbol of fertility and thus of renewal, resurrection and springreemerges every Easter as a temptation. Rabbits are cuddly. They are pretty. But are they really any good as pets?

title: White Consolidated In Questionable Deals
description: White Consolidated Industries, a major manufacturer of household appliances and machine tools, has told its shareholders that it made about $1.1 million of questionable business payments abroad since 1969.

title: Best Buys
description: LEAVE the Easter bunny to children. For bargain hunters this week, it's the Easter pig, turning up in a variety of forms as the star of holiday sales in food markets.

title: MGM's Profits Increased 16.6% in Second Quarter And 19.1% in the Half
description: MetroGoldwynMayer Inc. reported yesterday profit increases of 16.6 percent in its second fiscal quarter and 19.1 percent in the half year ended Feb. 28, reflecting higher revenues primarily from feature films. Frank E. Rosenfelt, president, said all three operating divisions continued profitable, citing Network, a coproduction with United Artists as MGM's highest grossing picture in recent years.

title: Woodcock May Go to Peking
description: President Carter is reported considering Leonard Woodcock, head of the United Automobile Workers, as diplomatic representative to Peking. Page A8.

title: BREZHNEV BIDS U.S. SEEK ARMS CONTROL IN DEEDS, NOT WORDS
description: MOSCOW, April 5Leonid I. Brezhnev said today that a reasonable accommodation is possible in arms control provided the United States seeks mutually acceptable solutions not in words but by deeds.

title: Kissinger Urges U.S. and Soviet To End Rhetoric
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Henry A. Kissinger, in his first public speech since leaving office, called on the Carter Administration today to avoid rhetorical battles with the Russians over strategic arms negotiations but to speak out forcefully about the invasion of Zaire, which he said could not continue without Soviet backing.

title: Largest Exhibition Set Of Churchill's Paintings
description: LONDON, April 4 (UPI)The largest exhibition of the late Sir Winston Churchill's paintings in nearly two decades will be held from May 3 to June 5 as part of Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee celebrations.

title: Recital: Double Strings
description: JOYCE RASMUSSEN Balint presented herself in two capacities Monday night in Carnegie Recital Hallas a violinist and mandolinist. On the former instrument she performed a Bach Invention (accompanied by Sandor Balint on the guitar), Brahms's Sonata, Op. 78, and a Suite for Violin and Piano by William Grant Still (with Louise Colusso Feinauer at the keyboard).

title: COURT DISBARS HOCHBERG AFTER BRIBERY CONVICTION
description: Alan Hochberg, former Democratic member of the New York State Assembly who was convicted last December of attempting to bribe a potential opponent into not running for his Bronx seat, was disbarred yesterday when the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court granted a petition brought by the Association of the Bar of the City of New York.

title: Seattle Slew Is Sharp; Gotham Decision Today
description: While armchair trainers continued their secondguessing, undefeated Seattle Slew went for another gallop yesterday in preparation for what could be an appearance in next Saturday's Gotham Stakes at Aqueduct.

title: February Shows Rise of $2.02 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)  Consumer credit in the, nation expanded by $2.02 billion in February, the second largest monthly gain on record, the Federal Reserve Board said today.

title: Jackson Backs Arms Proposals, Questions Method
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Senator Henry M. Jackson today applauded the United States' proposals to the Soviet Union to limit longrange missiles and bombers. At the same time he criticized President Carter for his public approach in negotiating with the Russians.

title: Venezuela Holds Output Of Crude Oil at '76 Pace To Protect Its Reserves
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 5 (AP)The Venezuelan Government, concerned about declining oil reserves, has ordered production cut back. The idea is to hold this year's oil output at last year's level.

title: Sell Arms to Egypt, Sadat Urges U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 5  President Anwar elSadat asked the United States today to open a significant military supply relationship with Egypt, including the sale of F5E fighter aircraft, citing his growing concern over Soviet penetration into African countries.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Town and village policemen in New Paltz have gone back on the job after receiving word that the force's liability insurance would be extended 30 days. The officers were pulled off the road and suspended with pay last Thursday at midnight because the American Home Assurance Company had canceled the department's policy at the end of what was supposed to be the second of three years. The company had said that ]2 claims in two years were too many and invoked an annual right to cancel.

title: Dollar Again Declines Against Yen
description: TOKYO, April 5 (AP)The dollar dropped below 273 yen at the close of Japanese foreign exchange trading today, down 1.15 yen from yesterday and the United States currency's lowest level in three and a half years.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: SOGLIN WINS 3D TERM AS MAYOR OF MADISON
description: MADISON. Wis., Wednesday, April 6Mayor Paul R. Soglin overcame a secondplace finish in the February primary and won easy reelection to a third twoyear term yesterday.

title: Pain and Anger Remain in San Francisco Jewish Neighborhood After Destruction of Nazi Bookstore
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 5The neighborhood is quiet now and the bookstore that last week bore the Nazi swastika is boarded up, but anger and pain remain in the voices of many of the survivors of German concentration camps who live nearby.

title: Hail in Engines Is Blamed in Georgia Crash Killing 68
description: NEW HOPE, Ga., April 5A Southern Airways official said today that heavy hail apparently caused engine failure aboard the DC9 twin jet that crashlanded yesterday in this little village, killing 68 persons and injuring 25 others.

title: White Wins Seat Vacated by Young
description: ATLANTA, April 5Wyche F. Fowler Jr., president of the Atlanta City Council, soundly defeated John R. Lewis, the candidate of Atlanta's black leadership, in a runoff election today, to succeed Andrew Young as the Congressman from the 5th Congressional District.

title: Blood and Ink
description: WASHINGTON, April 5You can almost put it down as a general rule in this town that every big policy mistake since the last World War has been made much worse by trying to prove that it was no mistake at all. We always seem to be confusing blood and ink.

title: Chess:
description: GENEVA, April 2Roman Dzindzikashvili of Israel and Jan Timman of the Netherlands held the lead after six rounds of the Geneva International Tournament here in the Hotel la Mediterranee. Each has scored 32.

title: Chewing and Choking Over Moscow
description: They bit off too much. They prepared too little. They talked prematurely. They agonized unnecessarily. They were naive. They were devious. There seems no end to the handwringing and secondguessing over the Carter Administration's first mission to Moscow and its public rebuff there after three days of discussion of future armscontrol agreements. The American carping seems destined to cause more damage than the Soviet crabbiness.

title: Linda Lamel, Krupsak Aide, Named A Deputy Insurance Superintendent
description: Linda Lamel, program secretary to Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak, has been appointed a deputy superintendent of insurance in a shakeup of the New York State Insurance Department.

title: LEON GOTTLIEB
description: Leon Gottlieb, a fur designer, died on Friday at his home at 200 East 62d Street. He was 68 years old.

title: In Memoriam
description: BERGERR. Dora, passed into the great beyond January 10, 1971. DOREE, dear, Today April 6th, Is your seventh birthday, In SEVENTH HEAVEN. Bless YOU and love you ever more. I'm the lonesomest guy In this world. MIKE

title: The U.N. Today
description: April 6, 1977

title: Yankees' Box Score
description: EMatlack, Harrelson, Randolph. DPYanks 1. LOBMets 8, Yankees 6. 2BKingman 2. Blair 2, Munson, Perez. HRsStaiger, Milner, Wynn. SBGamble. 5Staiger.

title: Massachusetts isles Wave Secession Flag
description: CHILMARK, Mass., April 5Insurrection is sweeping the islands of Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, April 5The State Legislature's Joint Appropriation Committee began final consideration today of 367 amendments to Governor Byrne's proposed $4 billion budget for 197778 on a sharp note of partisanship.

title: Around the Nation
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., April 5Eight days before his scheduled retrial in Baltimore on Federal charges of giving official favors to friends in return for gifts, Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland entered a nearby hospital today for an indeterminate period of treatment.

title: Letters
description: Magic Memories

title: Carter Asks End to Requirement That Poor Pay for Food Stamps
description: WASHINGTON, April 5In a political compromise, the Carter Administration proposed today a food stamp bill that would eliminate the cash purchase price for the food couponsa concession long sought by liberalsbut reduce benefits for a substantial number of recipients.

title: Music: Mystifying Effects
description: THE AMERICAN Composers Alliance must be doing something wrong in its efforts to make innovative theater out of concert music. The first program at the American Place Theater last week elicited somewhat depressing reports, and the second, given Monday night, was, on the whole, so perplexing that it was impossible to figure out what the composers and the theater people involved in the project wanted to accomplish.

title: Good Weather Could Curb Rise In Food Prices, U.S. Report Says
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Good weather could still produce relatively large supplies of major crops and continuation of the modest uptrend in food prices of the last two years, the Agricultural Department said today in a report prepared for the Senate Agriculture Committee on the recent severe winter.

title: Labor and Price Reports Depress Copper Futures; Silver Falls, Coffee Gains
description: Copper futures prices dropped the daily permissible limit of 3 cents a pound yesterday on New York's Commodity Exchange, leaving several hundred unsatisfied sell orders at the close. The unexpected selling was exacerbated when the price fell to levels that activiated standing orders to sell to prevent losses.

title: Islanders' FourGoal Third Period Sinks Hawks in Playoff Opener, 52
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., April 5For two periods tonight, it was more Chicago Black Magic than Chicago Black Hawks at Nassau Coliseum. Despite a 21 lead in their firstround National Hockey League playoff game against the Islanders, the Hawks nevertheless had been outplayed, outshot and outhit.

title: Preseason Baseball
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES AT DAYTONA, FLA.

title: Russian Easter, With Paskha and Kulich
description: While most Christian families are preparing for this Sunday's Easter ham or lamb dinner, the Orthodox Russians are making enormous quantities of their own traditional Easter foods, most notably the twin desserts, paskha (a pyramid of sweet creamy cheese, bejeweled with multicolored chopped glaced fruits), and kulich ( a highdomed cylindrical sweet yeast bread, studded with nuts and raisins).

title: Koichi Kido, a Close Aide To Hirohito, Is Dead at 87; Jailed as a War Criminal
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, April 6 (UPI)Former Marquis Koichi Kido, one of Emperor Hirohito's closest advisers during World War II, died today of cirrhosis of the liver. He was 87 years old.

title: BREZHNEV BIDS U. S. SEEK ARMS CONTROL IN DEEDS, NOT WORDS
description: MOSCOW, April 5Leonid I. Brezhnev said today that a reasonable accommodation is possible in arms control provided the United States seeks mutually acceptable solutions not in words but by deeds.

title: Kohno, Mrs. Pak Take Titles in Table Tennis
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, April 5 (AP)Mitsuro Kohno of Japan scored the biggest table tennis upset in years today by defeating Kuo YaoHua, China's No. 1 player, 1721, 219, 2119, 2113, and winning the world championship.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: RESULTS

title: Life With All (in Neutral Corner)
description: BERRIEN SPRINGS, MICH. JUST off a twolane highway at the end of a flat stretch of road distinguished by a Jack Frost food stand, a row of prefab houses, a vegetable stand and a gas station, two stone pillars mark the entrance to the farm owned by the world's most popular human being.

title: Taiwan Forces Reportedly Buy Israeli Missiles
description: TAIPEI, TaiwanThe Chinese Nationalist Government on Taiwan has secretly purchased Gabriel surfacetosurface missiles from Israel, according to knowledgeable American sources here, as part of a costly program to modernize its armed forces and prepare for the day Washington may recognize Peking and break the mutual security treaty.

title: People and Business
description: The Farah Manufacturing Company, where management and directors have been turning over of late at a rate more normal to the company's line of men's slacks than to the boardroom, has a new chairman and three new directors.

title: In Selecting Kitchen Knives, Stainless Steel Has the Edge
description: Inside those two metal drawers at one end of the cutting block island in my kitchen there are 42 knives of various function and manufacture. I know the exact number because I just took inventory. Of these knives, only 10, if that, are used at what might be called regular intervals. Mindless kitchen accretion. Junk.

title: Good Will Abounds as Cuban Five Wins
description: HAVANA, April 5In a game that was more successful diplomatically than artistically, the visiting South Dakota basketball team bowed to a superior Cuban national squad tonight, 9172.

title: Carter Asks End to Requirement That Poor Pay for Food Stamps
description: WASHINGTON, April 5In a political compromise, the Carter Administration proposed today a food stamp bill that would eliminate the cash purchase price for the food couponsa concession long sought by liberalsbut reduce benefits for a substantial number of recipients.

title: German Jobless Down to 4.8%
description: NUREMBERG, West Germany, April 5 (UPI)The unemployment rate in West Germany dropped to 4.8 percent in March from 5.3 percent in February, Josef Stingl, president of the Labor Office, announced today. Mr. Stingl said the number of jobless dropped by 129,500, to 1,084,200. The number of job openings registered with the labor office rose by 19,600 to 244,100, Mr. Stingl said.

title: Gold Price Falls More Than $2
description: LONDON, April 5 (AP)The price of gold dropped more than $2 an ounce in London and Zurich today on the eve of an International Monetary Fund gold auction. The dollar fluctuated slightly on most European money markets.

title: Easter Ham U. S. A.
description: The Easter ham is second only to the Thanksgiving turkey as a traditional American holiday main course. Its glistening glaze of goldenbrown sugar and the spicy and exotic scent of the clove studs offset the saline richness of the meat. Sliced with just a sliver of its own fat for flavor, and served with bunches of cress, bright green asparagus and parsleyed new potatoes, it becomes a proper celebration of the return of spring.

title: Ruth Towne, Formerly Directed Brooklyn Ethical Culture School
description: Ruth Towne, a former headmistress of the Brooklyn Ethical Culture School, died last Sunday at Calvary Hospital in the Bronx. She was 74 years old and lived in Chappaqua, N. Y.

title: Music: The Flute In PreRomantic Bent
description: THE 19TH CENTURY'S conception of the hero as a lone soul struggling against a hostile or uncaring universe was accurately mirrored in the Romantic concerto, which pitted one instrument against the world of the symphonic orchestra.

title: State Senator Galiber Will Face Inquiry on Bronx Poverty Fund
description: State Senator Joseph L. Galiber will appear before a Federal grand jury investigating wideranging abuses of poverty funds by a Bronx addiction rehabilitation program, according to sources in law enforcement.

title: Market Place
description: When the fledgling New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority began planning the Meadowlands Sports Complex early in this decade, leading New Jersey banks put up $50 million in seed capital thinking that $302 million of taxexempt bonds would soon be sold and that the project, would thus be on a firm financial base.

title: Prio Socarras, Cuban ExLeader, Dies of Gunshot Wound in Florida
description: MIAMI BEACH, April 5Carlos Prio Socarrs, President of Cuba from 1948 to 1952, died here today apparently of a selfinflicted bullet wound.

title: Mexican Coffee Sale to Spain Is Valued at Over $14 Million
description: MEXICO CITY, April 5 (UPI)Mexico has sold to Spain 2,000 tons of prime washed standard coffee beans valued at over $14 million, the Mexican Coffee Institute said today.

title: Enrollment Starts Today For SummerJob Project; Emphasis on Cleanliness
description: Greater emphasis on public service and projects with a clear visible impact on the city, such as cleanliness in streets and parks, will be sought in New York City's Summer Youth Employment Program this year, Donald Hamer, acting associate commissioner of employment, said yesterday.

title: Suit Charges Lawyer Who Heads Its Ohio Welfare Benefit Plan Received Illegal Payments
description: U. S. SEEKS TO OUST TEAMSTER FUND AIDEWASHINGTON, April 5 (UPI)The administrator of the teamsters' Ohio Highway Drivers Welfare Fund received hundreds of thousands of dollars a year in illegal payments, the Government said in a suit filed yesterday.

title: Irrigation Projects Expected
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)The governors of the Dakotas said today that they thought that Congress would continue Federal funding of showcase irrigation projects in their states despite opposition from President Carter.

title: Sell Arms to Egypt, Sadat Urges U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 5  President Anwar e'Sadat asked the United States today to open a significant military supply relationship with Egypt, including the sale of F5E fighter aircraft, citing his growing concern over Soviet penetration into African countries.

title: Burns and Proxmire, Never Terse, Wage a War That Could Be Verse
description: WASHINGTON, April 5The seldom lyrical relationship between William Proxmire and Arthur F. Burns seems to have erupted in a burst of doggerel.

title: Wine Talk
description: I CAN honestly say I have never had a bad bottle of rioja. So wrote Hugh Johnson in his book Wine. Strong words from a man who has drunk most of the world's wines and who had admitted to finding the normal number of clinkers among them.

title: Congress Asked to Aid Latins Despite Rights Curb
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (Reuters)Senior. State Department officials today advised Congress against cutting military aid to Latin American countries in support of the Administration's stand on human rights.

title: Woodcock Among Those Considered For Post in Peking
description: WASHINGTON, April 5  Leonard Woodcock, President of the United Auto Workers, is under serious consideration to become the United States diplomatic representative in Peking, Congressional sources said today, and his selection might be one of several signals that the Carter Administration is hoping to move toward broader and more normal relations with China.

title: A Minority Inside A Minority
description: There can be little doubt about the authenticity of my credentials for speaking in behalf of the nonwhite handicapped. I am black and I walk with crutches, the result of a congenital defect. That I am a successful professional represents my own good fortune, an accident of birth and history.

title: Sharon Steel Ends Offer for McKesson
description: The Sharon Steel Corporation of Miami yesterday withdrew its offer to take over ForemostMcKesson Inc., formally bringing to an end a yearlong legal battle for control of McKesson. Sharon said that it would amend its report to the Securities and Exchange Commission and withdraw its registration statement covering the debentures it had proposed to issue in exchange for McKesson's common stock.

title: Jungle of Cities Wrestles With Brecht
description: IN THE LAST TWO seasons at the Impossible Ragtime Theater, George Ferencz has taken two of Eugene O'Neill's lesser plays, The Hairy Ape and Dynamo, and recharged them with theatrical electricity. Each, particularly the first, became highintensity experiences. The director's method was to take a literal line in the playman as animal, dynamo as earth motherand use it as the basis for an interpretation.

title: Bronx Kidnap Car Used in a Holdup
description: Emanuel Goldstein, a 65yearold salesman, didn't want to talk about it afterward, and nobody could blame him.

title: Senate Panel Backs Defense Budget
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)The Senate Budget Committee today recommended a $111.9 billion defense budget for 1978, the same figure proposed by the Carter Administration.

title: New York Health Agency in Dispute With Hospital Review Organization
description: A simmering conflict between the New York State Department of Health and a federally financed hospital review organization in Manhattan boiled over yesterday when each side accused the other of attempting to undermine and demean their respective efforts to contain publicfinanced hospital costs

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BLOOM BOOM Easter definitely looked imminent when the Frick Collection Museum adorned its art with blooms from the New York Botanical Garden. But the city's bestknown Easter lily display, opening tomorrow at Rockefeller Center, heralds the holiday with a flourish.

title: About Education
description: With the tuition gap between public and private colleges widening each year, a growing number of high school seniors and their parents are asking whether it is worth several thousand dollars a year extra to attend an elite private institution.

title: Private Lives
description: WHEN the news came to our silo last week that Mark The Bird Fidrych had torn a cartilage in his left knee and wouldnt be pitching for the Detroit Tigers for at least two months, I was on the roof, looking for lowlevel cruise missiles and trying to figure out the 1978 National Football League schedule. The National Football League schedule for 1978 seems to be a combination of a menu in a Szechwan sweatshop and the Code of Hammurabi. Is this good or bad for the SALT talks? What does Henry Jackson pretend to think? Or, more significantly, M. Donald Grant? If the Mets dont let the Nyets land Backfire bombers at Shea Stadium, will the Jets move to Vladivostok?

title: A 30Day Ban, Stiff Fine for Randle
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., April 5 (AP)The Texas Rangers suspended Lenny Randle today for 30 days and fined him what amounts to $23,407.90 for his assault on Manager Frank Lucchesi eight days ago.

title: World News Briefs
description: VIENNA, April 5 (UPI)The Cyprus peace talks have revealed unbridgeable differences between Turkish and Greek Cypriots on the future of the island, the Greek Cypriot negotiator, Tassos Papodopulos, said today.

title: Easter Feasts: Worldly and Traditional
description: pilgrims had preceded us to the small plaza in front of the church, to await the tolling of the bells that would signify the arrival of Easter morning. In the darkness someone handed us candies and as bells were tolled the priest emerged bearing a candle with which he kindled the candle of the closest member of those assembled.

title: Italian Kidnappings Drop
description: ROME April 5 (Reuters)During the 12 months ending last July, 230 people were kidnapped in Italy. That compared with 300 abductions for the previous comparable 12 months, according to official figures released here.

title: Drive to Save the Rapidly Dwindling Bald Ibis Leaves Turks Cold
description: BIRECIK, Turkey  Nobody was paying any attention to them and then suddenly they became very precious, said a resident of this southern Turkish town. I don't understand why the foreigners come and look at the birds and take pictures.

title: Robert Taylor Dies; Registrar 30 Years With City College
description: Robert L. Taylor, registrar emeritus of City College, who during his 30 years as registrar enrolled an estimated 500,000 students, died yesterday at home at 430 West 24th Street. He was 67 years old.

title: For Western Sahara's Refugees, Hope Eases the Life of Hardship
description: HASSI ROBINET, AlgeriaI am djoundi, a soldier, and am going to liberate my country, said the 8yearold Saharan child soberly, showing off his Polisario Front sweatshirt. The boy, Bachir Hila, comes from Semara in Western Sahara, one of thousands of Saharan refugees who have fled from the Moroccan and Mauritanian occupation forces.

title: Indian Center Approved
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y. April 5 (AP)The Federal Economic Development Association gave final approval yesterday for construction of a $4.9 million Indian cultural center here. Dr. Miklos Wass de Czege, consultant for the Native American Center for the Living Arts Inc., said the Government had also approved construction of a $70,000 Indian village at the Artpark at nearby Lewiston.

title: Hamilton Fish:
description: In the clutter of his Park Avenue study, among the artifacts peculiar to distinguished menworn Oriental rugs, cracked leatherbound books, dusty busts, framed sepiatoned photographs, treasured correspondence and old letteropenerssits Hamilton Fish Sr., a happy man.

title: Carter Bars WagePrice Controls To Combat New Inflation Threat
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (Reuters)President Carter and his key economic advisers expressed concern today to Congressional leaders over the threat of renewed inflation, but apparently have ruled out wage and price controls to combat it.

title: BRITISH AIRWAYS WARNS ON EFFECTS OF STOPPAGE
description: LONDON, April 5A strike of nearly 4,000 aircraft maintenance engineers that began here last Sunday could completely shut down the stateowned British Airways by next weekend, Kenneth Wilkinson, the airline's engineering director, warned today.

title: Judge Delays Decision on Shift by Jets
description: The bizarre sight and sound of 17 lawyers arguing at the same time for an hour and 15 minutes punctuated the end yesterday of the latest round in New York City versus the Jets, Mets, National Football League and the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority.

title: Goldstein's Trial Is Moved
description: WICHITA, Kan., April 5 (UPI)United States District Court Judge Frank Theis decided today to move the trial of the Screw magazine publisher, Al Goldstein, to Kansas City, Kan., because of an antipornography campaign in Wichita that could make a fair trial unlikely. Judge Theis granted a motion by Mr. Goldstein's attorneys that the trial be moved from Wichita, but denied their request for a change of venue to New York.

title: Technology
description: While much attention has focused on the space shuttle's airworthiness during captive flights above the California desert on the back of a Boeing 747, lesspublicized if noisier progress is being made with the engines that are to propel a shuttle into orbit for the first time in 1979.

title: Califano to Outline a Major Drive To Immunize More U.S. Children
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, will announce tomorrow the details of a major program to improve the immunization status of American children.

title: NEWYORK STATE RATE FOR ITS BORROWING DIPS TO 4,5% FROM 7%
description: New York State has completed negotiations for its annual spring borrowing, $3.6 billion this year, at an average interest rate of 4.51 percent, a significant improvement over last year's 7 percent.

title: White Wins in Georgia
description: Wyche Fowler was elected to Andrew Young's Congressional seat, leaving large part of the South without black representation. Page A18.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Coach Holzman, Bradley Honored as Knicks Win
description: The Knicks celebrated the honoring of Coach Red Holzman and Bill Bradley last night by outscoring the Boston Celtics, 121113, at Madison Square Garden. It was their fourth straight victory, their longest streak of the National Basketball Association season.

title: Allons, Entants, a la 5th Avenue
description: PARIS, April 5 (AP)Hector Rolland, a Gaullist legislator, called on French legislators to march with him down New York's Fifth Avenue to press or landing rights for the French  British Concorde supersonic jetliner. Mr. Rolland said in a letter to the legislators that he was ready to charter a plane to New York on two days' notice. He said an American friend was prepared to help organize the march.

title: INTEREST RATES OFF FOR TAXEXEMPTS
description: Interest rates declined in the taxexempt securities market yesterday as a substantial volume of new financing including $3.6 billion of New York State noteswas offered to investors. Despite the lower interest rates and the large number of notes and bonds for sale, investors and traders appeared to find the new securities attractive. Five major taxexempt bond issues totaling $347 million were 70 percent sold by the end of the afternoon. The corporate and Government sectors of the bond market continued to drift lower in price in light volume. In the afternoon, there was something of a rebound, but these minor trading price swings apparently were caused by no particular news.

title: BANK LOANS ABROAD CALLED SUCCESSFUL BY OFFICIALS OF U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 5The Treasury described today as greatly exaggerated fears that the big expansion in overseas lending by American banks posed a serious threat to world economic order.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, APRIL 6, 1977

title: Edward S. Marcus, ExChairman Of NeimanMarcus Stores, at 67
description: DALLAS, April 5Edward S. Marcus, retired chairman of the board of NeimanMarcus, the Dallasbased specialty store, died at a Dallas hospital last night at the age of 67.

title: Reds Sign Rose To 2Year Pact
description: CINCINNATI, April 5 (AP)The Cincinnati Reds announced today an agreement on a twoyear contract with Pete Rose, who had been threatening to play out his option.

title: People in Sports
description: Vida Blue, the Oakland A's ace lefthander, has looked like anything but a fed up star in spring training this year. He has allowed only 12 hits and two earned runs in four starts, pitched 19 innings for a 0.95 earnedrun average. The Cy Young Award winner of 1971 walked out of the A's camp in Mesa, Ariz., yesterday saying he was fed up with the man, meaning Charles O. Finley, the owner. When asked if he would show up to pitch the Oakland home opener against Minnesota on Saturday, Blue said: I don't know.

title: A Hamilton Fish In Congress Since 1843
description: In the clutter of his Park Avenue study, among the artifacts peculiar to distinguished menworn Oriental rugs, cracked leatherbound books, dusty busts, framed sepiatoned photographs, treasured correspondence and old letteropenerssits Hamilton Fish Sr., a happy man.

title: Big Square in Peking Is Quiet On Day of Festival of the Dead
description: PEKING, April 5 (Agence FrancePresse) For the first time since 1949, the traditional Festival of the Dead, coming one year after the riots in Tien Am Men Square, was celebrated neither in the traditional nor in the revolutionary way.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: IT is a solemn fact that no one goes out anymore on Saturday night. It is true that restaurants, movies and theaters are crowded on Saturday night, but they are crowded with the people whom the people who do not go out on Saturday night want to stay away from. Once, the people who do not,go out on Saturday night would never have admitted that they were staying hqme. Staying home was anathema, and the lust to go out was everywhere. Now, however, Saturday, night is not chic. Monday, Wednesday and Friday nights are not much, either. Tuesday and Thursday nights are chic; Sunday night is, too. But Saturday is out, probably forever.

title: Most Stocks Fall in Listless Day Despite Token Gain by the Dow
description: Most stocks edged lower in dispirited trading yesterday, although the Dow Jones industrial average managed to move up slightly.

title: Guterma, 5 in Family and Pilot Killed in Bronx Crash
description: Alexander L. Guterma, a controversial Florida financier who amassed and later lost two financial empires, was killed with five members of his family yesterday when their twinengine plane crashed in the Bronx while preparing to land at La Guardia Airport in rain and heavy fog. A 14yearold son was badly injured.

title: Labor Official Denounces Carter
description: WASHINGTON, April 5In a harshly worded attack, Lane Kirkland, secretarytreasurer of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, accused President Carter today of reneging on campaign promises and of building a businessoriented Administration.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT CHICAGO

title: Yankees Finally Acquire Dent, Trading Gamble and 2 Pitchers
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 5The New York Yankees added another expensive star to their glittering cast today when they sent three players and a bundle of money to the Chicago White Sox for Bucky Dent, the unsigned but longsought shortstop.

title: Why a Village In India Voted The Way It Did
description: SAHAFUR, India, April 5Om Prakash, a 57yearold farmer with a sinewy bare chest and a deeply lined face, never voted against the Congress Party before this year, and he never thought he would. But there were just too many abuses in this emergency business, he explained, laying down his hand plow for a few moments' rest in the shade of a mango tree.

title: Slovik's Widow Sees Carter Aide
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)The widow of the only American soldier shot for desertion since the Civil War met with a White House aide today and was told that President Carter has been informed of her petition for military benefits.

title: Soviet Names Oil Minister
description: MOSCOW, April 5 (AP)Nikolai A. Maltsev, the First Deputy Minister of the Petroleum Industry, has been appointed to succeed Valentin D. Shashin, the Minister who died last month. Mr. Maltsev is 49 years old.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, APRIL 5, 1977

title: Jackson Is Accused in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, April 5 (Reuters)The United States correspondent of the weekly Literaturnaya Gazeta accused Senator Jackson today of having helped to sabotage last week's arms talks. The reporter, Iona Andronov, said Mr. Jackson had waged an antiSoviet campaign to undermine the talks.

title: Bridge:
description: Swedish experts continue to dominate the Philip Morris Cup, which is the bridge equivalent of a European Grand Prix circuit. Nearly all the bridgeplaying countries in Europe have one tournament scheduled as part of the series, and players with the best record in a complete season earn substantial cash awards.

title: A Statue of Limitations
description: PARISAt the time of the October 1956 revolution, Hungarian society looked very much like a miniature form of the Soviet Union's. So did that of all the socalled popular democracies. The resistance, silent or violent, of East Europeans to Soviet domination has led to deep modifications in the structure and development of satellite societies.

title: On Profits, Orioles Mainly Strike Out
description: So far it's no runs, no hits and no errors, which isn't too bad. What's worse, is the outlook for profits.

title: News Summary
description: A reasonable accommodation is possible with the United States on nuclear arms control, Leonid I. Brezhnev said, if Washington seeks mutally acceptable solutions not in words but by deeds. In his first public statement about the failure of last week's talks with Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, the Soviet leader blamed Washington for lack of progress, but held out hope for repairing relations and advancing toward a strategic arms limitation treaty. [Page Al, Column 1.]

title: Arbitrageur Takes the Big Chances
description: Robert E., Rubin of Goldman, Sachs & Company, the huge investment banking house, spends all day every workday taking multimilliondollar chances.

title: Cannibalizing of Stolen Autos on Rise in Queens
description: Shortly after 1 A.M. yesterday, Evelyn Lieberman was awakened at her home in Forest Hills, Queens, by the ring of the telephone. It was the police. They told her that her stolen car had been recovered.

title: Amherst Names Coach
description: AMHERST, Mass., April 5 (AP)Amherst College has named David Hixon, a 24yearold Amherst graduate as head basketball coach, replacing Richard Wilson, who has retired after 29 seasons.

title: JOSEPH M. ADELIZZI OF TRUCKING GROUP
description: Joseph M. Adelizzi, a roughhewn, gravelvoiced graduate of Yale University who was a major force in unifying a fragmented trucking industry beset by strikes and chaotic rate structures, died last Friday at his home in Montville, Conn. He was 81 years old.

title: VETOED SCHOOL BILL RESTORED BY COURT
description: The State Court of Appeals restored to life yesterday the yearold StaviskyGoodman Law, whichhad it been enforcedwould have required an increase in spending on education in New York City by as much as $150 million this year.

title: Topics
description: Where They Are Now

title: Los Angeles' Mayor Bradley Takes A Big Lead in Bid for ReElection
description: LOS ANGELES, April 5Mayor Tom Bradley of Los Angeles took an early lead tonight in a bid for reelection and appeared to be headed for victory without having to face a runoff next month.

title: Congress Struggling To Clear Jobs Bill Before It Recesses
description: WASHINGTON, April 5  Congress struggled today lo clear away the obstacles it had built to enactment of President Carter's $4 billion public works jobs bill before both houses adjourn for Easterthe Representatives tomorrow and the Senators on Thursday.

title: Personal Health
description: ALTHOUGH WINTER is still whistling in the wind in much of the country, if you're allergic to insect stings, now is the time to start thinking about spring and summer. An estimated ?? million Americans have serious, potentially lifethreatening allergies to the stings of bees or wasp??. And with the growth of outdoor activities, the reports of insect sting allergies increase annually.

title: Anaconda Plans to Move Corporate Headquarters From New York in '78
description: The Anaconda Company, a major mining and metal manufacturing concern that has had its headquarters in New York City for more than 50 years, announced yesterday that it would move its corporate offices to Denver in 1978.

title: Q&A
description: Sausage with White Beans

title: Borderline Peace
description: PARISSeveral socalled thirdworld governments have been trying to convince Andrew Young, United States Ambassador to the United Nations, that South Africa should be arraigned before the Security Council as a threat to the peace under Chapter Seven of the United Nations Charter. It seems, however, that the U.S. Government and Mr. Young have been persuaded that this is an unsound idea.

title: Bill to Create a State Siting Agency on Energy Is Assailed at a Hearing.
description: ATLANTIC CITY, April 5Pending legislation to create a powerful state agency to rule on the siting of nuclear power plants and other energy facilities drew sharp criticism at a public hearing today.

title: Careers
description: Through an array of colorful brochures, many major corporations are asking young job hunters to focus on themselves, like a person looking into a mirror.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Reynolds Metals Company reported yesterday that various weatherrelated problems, chiefly droughtinduced power shortages in the Pacific Northwest, had caused a net loss of 46,000 tons in its annual smelter capacity The result has been a reduction in the company's operating rate to 81 per cent of its total annual capacity of 975,000 tons.

title: Books of The Times
description: I GUESS THEY'LL know who we are now, triumphantly wrote Anne McDonnell Ford to her mother, Anna Murray McDonnell, after she had married Henry Ford 2d. It was the cry, writes John Corry, of an Irish girl who had finally made it. The alliance between a member of the thirdgeneration Irish aristocracy and the heirapparent to the Ford dynasty (the Fords were Irish. too, but had forgotten about it) did not last, but it did symbolize the attainment of the social ladder's final rung by both the McDonnells and the Murrays.

title: Peking Said to Plan For a Smaller Army And Improved Armss
description: China plans to reorganize its army into a smaller, more flexible force with more modern weapons and with a more centralized command and control system.

title: Fireman Solves a Burning Problem
description: Fireman Cornelius J. Wallace, who had never left anything burning during 20 years in the department, pondered The Case of the Scorched French Fries.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: IN THE nottoodistant past the idea has been explored that the common hamburger might have had Russian origins. The Russian name usually given for ground meat patties that are cooked and served with or without sauce is bitok and sometimes bitock or bitoke. Many people have tried to associate the name with a distortion in pronunciation of the words beef steak.

title: Grey Bows Out of Race For Datsun's Business
description: Grey Advertising has turned down an invitation to compete for the $35 million Datsun account because the auto marketer is using an outside consultant for the agency screening process.

title: A. H. Raskin
description: WASHINGTONSunshine laws are stripping much of the secrecy from governmental decisionmaking, but no trace of that trend toward openness has yet crept into labormanagement contract negotiations that help deter mine how deeply inflation bites into the living standards of every American and how competitive American products remain in world markets. A case in point is the collective bargaining under way in basic steel, by all odds the most consequential wage talks of 1977.

title: A Black Forest Candyland in Queens
description: Few countries provide so colorful a backdrop for Easter as Germany. Every city looks like one big florist shop bursting forth with pastel colored tulips, irises, hyacinths and heady, sweetsmelling freesia, and every confectioner's window is a study in lavish excess. Nowhere is chocolate work more skillfully or intricately done. Parades of rabbits and chicks in every size and almost every position, molded in mauve milk chocolate or dark bittersweet pull chocolate baskets of jelly beans or candy flowers

title: Board Acts to Weed Out the Doctors Who Push Drugs
description: NEWARK, April 4Joseph A. Bonaccorsi, a prosperous Vineland physician, is spending 1977 in a cell in Trenton State Prison. Henry J. Vaccaro, a prominent Asbury Park doctor, paid a $40,000 fine last year after losing an appeal. Both were convicted on drug charges for illegally diverting amphetamines and barbiturates to street use.

title: Kissinger Urges U.S. and Soviet To End Rhetoric
description: WASHINGTON, April 5Henry A. Kissinger, in his first public speech since leaving office, called on the Carter Administration today to avoid rhetorical battles with the Russians over strategic arms negotiations but to speak out forcefully about the invasion of Zaire, which he said could not continue without Soviet backing.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: MONEY IS many things. It makes the world go round. It could make the subways runif not on time, at least at sufficient length to obviate the need for wind sprints along the platform to catch the Transit Authority's povertyspawned minitrains. Money is the root of all evil. But it is no substitute for good health. And though it won't buy happiness, a little bit of it still goes a long way  as the following episode illustrates  toward buying a lot of incivility:

title: Ruling on StaviskyGoodman Law Expected to Have No Impact Now
description: Despite the stunning court reversal yesterday upholding the validity of the StaviskyGoodman Law, Mayor Beame said New York City would continue to refuse to abide by the law's directives in the current year, at least until city and state attorneys could analyze the decision.

title: Some Crops in Hawaii Are Suffering After Rainfall OneThird of Normal
description: HONOLULU, April 5Like the dust blown prairies of the Western Plains, this land of trade winds and swaying palms is suffering from a drought.

title: Taiwan Forces Reportedly Buy Israeli Missiles
description: TAIPEI, TaiwanThe Chinese Nationalist Government on Taiwan has secretly purchased Gabriel surfacetosurface missiles from Israel, according to knowledgeable American sources here, as part of a costly program to modernize its armed forces and prepare for the day Washington may recognize Peking and break the mutual security treaty.

title: 28,836 Were Jailed During Indian Crisis
description: NEW DELHI, April 5 (UPI)Indian officials arrested 28,836 political foes of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi during the nearly 21 months of emergency rule, the new Government said today.

title: Maverick of the Breakfast Table
description: SALISBURY, N.C., April 5Ted Turner, who operates the Atlanta Braves under a restraining order, was the breakfast speaker today at the 18th awards meeting of the National Sportscasters and Sportswriters Association, whose members gather here annually to salute those chosen by their peers as the outstanding sportswriter or sportscaster in each state.

title: Team Canada Departs For Tourney in Vienna
description: TORONTO, April 5 (AP)Twentythree Canadian hockey players, most of them lacking international experience, leave tonight for Europe and an eightgame exhibition warmup for the world hockey championship. It will be Canada's first appearance in the championship in seven years.

title: Foreign Debt Up at Record Pace
description: Foreign indebtedness of governments, big companies and other international borrowers increased by a record $61.9 billion last year, according to the latest World Bank figures. United States banks and capital markets provided a substantial share of the loans.

title: STRIKING PRISON GUARDS VOTE AGAINST RETURNING
description: HARTFORD, Wednesday, April 6 (AP) Striking Connecticut prison guards, ignoring a judge's backtowork order and pleas by their leaders, voted last night against ending their twodayold illegal strike.

title: Scientist Says Animal Cancer Tests Must Consider Number of Causes
description: SARASOTA, Fla., April 5The fact that people are exposed to many different cancercausing agents must be considered when weighing the relevance to man of an animal test of one substance, such as the controversial Canadian saccharin study, a leading Federal scientist said here today.

title: Advertising
description: The first step by H. P. Hood Inc., the 131yearold Boston dairy, away from being productionoriented and regional toward being marketingoriented and national is Frogurt Frozen Yogurt and advertising for it breaks this month in six widely spread markets.

title: IRREGULARITY FOUND IN STONY BROOK AID
description: An auditor from the State University of New York at Stony Brook, told the State Investigation Commission yesterday that people who were admitted but who never registered at the university were receiving money from the state's Educational Opportunity Program.

title: Botulism Cases Rise to 39
description: PONTIAC, Mich., April 5 (UPI)The number of botulism cases in the worst outbreak in United States history rose to 39 today with four more cases. One new victim was in critical condition. Doctors said the patients contracted botulism last week by eating hot sauce made with improperly canned peppers at a Mexican restaurant in this northern Detroit suburb.

title: Guterma, 5 in Family and Pilot Killed in Bronx Crash
description: Alexander L. Guterma, a controversial Florida financier who amassed and later lost two financial empires, was killed with five members of his family yesterday when their twinengine plane crashed in the Bronx while preparing to land at La Guardia Airport in rain and heavy fog. A 14yearold son was badly injured.

title: A Tasty Menu of Traditional Greek Easter Treats
description: leaves. Cut off about one inch from the top. Cut each artichoke in half lengthwise and scrape away the fuzzy choke. Pare around the stem. Rub the cut portions with juice of one lemon. Place both halves in a large saucepan of salted cold water to which is added the rest of the lemon juice and the flour. Bring to the boil and simmer about 10 minutes until slightly tender.

title: Cincinnati Will Retain College Football Program
description: CINCINNATI, April 5 (AP)The University of Cincinnati board of directors voted unanimously today to continue participation in intercollegiate football, but ruled that a new funding arrangement must be developed to support rising costs of the athletic program.

title: Cardinal Urges an Assault on Smut and Prostitution
description: Terence Cardinal Cooke urged New Yorkers yesterday to take strong community action  such as picketing against the indescribable horrors of pornography and prostitution. He also urged lawmakers to join the fight if they want to stay in office.

title: NURSINGHOME UNION SETS A STRIKE DATE
description: The union representing 15,000 employees at 67 private nursing homes in the city served notice yesterday that it intended to strike on April 15 if its contract dispute were not resolved.

title: Elections Elsewhere
description: In Washington's Seventh Congressional District, 25 candidates were competing in a state primary to choose candidates for the House seat that Brock Adams left to become Secretary of Transportation.

title: Books: Minutemen's Lives
description: CONCORD in April is a poem, a battle and a bridge to the past. Emerson's hymn to the embattled farmers who fired the shot heard round the world tends to obscure the rude event by sentimentalizing those who picked up their muskets and aimed at the King's occupying force. We know a little about the broadsides and motivations of the era, thanks to Bernard Bailyn's classic The Ideological Origins of the American Revolution. We now know much more about the humans behind those muskets because of Robert A. Gross's The Minutemen and Their World.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Labor Aide to Push Rise in Shoe Tariffs If Carter Plan Fails
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (AP)Labor Secretary Ray Marshall said today he would recommend higher tariffs and quotas on foreign shoe imports if the Carter Administration is unable to negotiate voluntary reductions in those imports from foreign countries.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Decaying Animal Carcasses Found Unburied at Site of Jungle Habitat
description: WEST MILFORD, N.J., April 5At least two dozen dead animals have been left unburied at the site of the former Jungle Habitat drive through zoo here and state and local officials today began looking into any possible hazards posed by the decaving carcasses.

title: Doctor Says V.A. Hospital Killer Might Not Have Been Near Victims
description: DETROIT, April 5A killer at the Ann Arbor, Mich., Veterans Hospital two summers ago could have poisoned patients without being near them, according to testimony today at the trial of two Filipino nurses who are charged with murdering two veterans and nonfatally poisoning seven others.

title: MONSON M. BURR
description: Monson M. Burr, general assistant finance manager of the General Motors overseas operations division, died Monday at Englewood (N.J.) Hospital. He was 63 years old and a resident of Englewood.

title: Theater: And Now... Here's Talk Show
description: BRIDGEPORT, CONN. WHAT IS IT about television talk shows that makes them extraordinarily vulnerable to satire? The consistency  indeed, the treacly consistencyof their format? The unashamed selling of productsbe they books, records or nightclub appearances, television specials or even pet causes and charities? Or is it the selfcongratulatory air surrounding themwhere seldom is heard a discouraging word?

title: Dead and Survivors in Jet Crash
description: ATLANTA, April 5 (UPI) Following is an unofficial list of those aboard Southern Airways Flight 242 that crashed yesterday at New Hope, Ga., and those killed or injured on the ground. Hometowns and ages are listed where available.

title: U.S. Says It Lacks Evidence Of Cuban Involvement in Zaire
description: WASHINGTON, April 5The United States has no evidence that Cuba is participating in any way in the invasion of Zaire by Katanga exiles based in Angola, officials said today.

title: Burn Unit at St. Barnabas to Open
description: LIVINGSTON, April 5After more than seven years of waiting, the St, Barnabas Medical Center here will open its 12bed burntreatment unit tomorrow hospital officials announced today.

title: Flaherty Confirmed by Senate
description: WASHINGTON, April 5 (UPI)The Senate confirmed Peter Flaherty as Deputy Attorney General, the No. 2 post in the Justice Department, by a vote of 87 to 4 today. The rollcall was asked by Senator Howard Metzenbaum, Democrat of Ohio, who led the opposition to the former Pittsburgh mayor. Those voting against were Senators Metzenbaum, Daniel Patrick Moynihan of New York, Don Riegle of Michigan and William Proxmire of Wisconsin, all Democrats.

title: VETOED SCHOOL BILL RESTORED BY COURT
description: The State Court of Appeals restored to life yesterday the yearold StaviskyGoodman Law, whichhad it been enforcedwould have required an increase in spending on education in New York City by as much as $150 million this year.

title: Kuwait's G.N.P. Up 10% for '76
description: KUWAIT, April 5 (AP)Kuwait's gross national product rose by more than 10 percent, to $12.6 billion, in 1976, according to a report released today. This put per capita income at about $25,000. This oilrich state on the Persian Gulf is known for having one of the highest per capita incomes in the world. The Chamber of Commerce report said oil accounted for more than 72 percent of the G.N.P.

title: Close Race in Ann Arbor
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., April 5Mayor Albert H. Wheeler edged his Republican challenger, City Councilman Louis D. Belcher, by one vote in yesterday's election, in an unofficial tabulation, but a recount was assured.

title: Palestinians Defeat Attack by Rightists In South Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 5Palestinian guerrillas and Lebanese leftistMoslem militia forces today beat back a counterattack by rightwing Christian militia units trying to recapture the roadjunction village of Taibe near the Israeli border.

title: Rumanian Painter in Paris Keeps Busy Schedule as a Dissident in Exile
description: PARIS, April 5Yesterday was a busy day for Sergiu Manoliu, a 24yearold Rumanian painter who says that, together with his mother, he has founded a dissident movement in Bucharest.

title: Focusing on the Furnace
description: If the United States is serious about easing its energy crisis, it must promptly develop a fuel conservation program. If a conservation program is to succeed, it must focus on the furnace.

title: New Bank Affiliate in Cairo Announced by Bank of America
description: A new banking affiliate, MISRAmerica International Bank, in Cairo, was announced yesterday by the Bank of America. Capital of the Egyptian affiliate, which will engage in all aspects of banking, has been set at about $10 million. Bank of America is the largest shareholder with 40 percent, followed by the Development Industrial Bank in Egypt, 26 percent and MISR Insurance, 25 percent.

title: Yankees Add Shortstop
description: The Yankees ended a long quest by trading three players for Bucky Dent and giving the shortstop a contract for three years. Page B5.

title: Notes on People
description: THE new teacher at the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor yesterday received good marks for his first lecture, from both fellow professors and students. Speaking of visiting Professor Gerald R. Ford, Milton Neumann, an assistant professor who gave over his hourlong class on Politics of Civil Liberties and Civil Rights to the newcomer, said: His performance was excellent. You could tell he was well prepared, that he wasn't going to wing it completely. It wasn't a cute, gimmicky thing, it was a real acadamic experience. A student, Peggy King, said Mr. Ford stood the whole time and he kept his suit coat on, but you could just tell he was relaxed. Mr. Ford is spending four days, lecturing to 10 classes, at his alma mater. Betty Ford remained home in Palm Springs, Calif., recovering from the flu.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The debate over open access to beaches at the Jersey Shore will go before the State Supreme Court. The State Public Advocate's Department has been fighting in the courts to keep communities from closing their beaches and bathing facilities to nonresidents. The community of Deal is trying to keep outsiders from using its popular Deal Casino beach club.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: How to Say It And Get It Right
description: Two centuries after the upstart colonists broke away from the mother country, the Arco Publishing Company has brought out the first American edition of Debrett's Correct Form, subtitled An Inclusive Guide to Everything From Drafting Wedding Invitations to Addressing an Archibishop.

title: W. B. BROWN, DEAD AT 79; WAS INVESTMENT BANKER
description: W. Barrett Brown, an investment banker and philanthropist, died Monday at his Greenwich, Conn., home. He was 79 years old.

title: Red Smith Named to Hall
description: SALISBURY, N. C., April 5 (AP)Red Smith of The New York Times was named today as the 18th member of the National Association of Sportswriters' and Sportscasters' Hall of Fame. Jim Murray of The Los Angeles Times and Keith Jackson of ABCTV were named as sportswriter and sportscaster of the year, respectively.

title: So. Dakotans Awed on Tour Of Havana
description: HAVANA, April 5Setting a pace considerably less languid than the weather, the Cuban hosts of the South Dakota basketball team took it on a dizzying view of the city's projects today.

title: Need Original Of Puccini? Bid
description: A firstedition vocal score of Puccini's La Fanciulla del West, inscribed by the composer and autographed by Toscanini, Caruso, Destinn and other participants in the world premiere, will be among the items to be sold at an auction next Monday night in the Promenade of the New York State Theater for the benefit of the New York City Opera.

title: Sopranos Gain In Bid to Join Hawking Cry
description: A New York City Council committee moved yesterday to lift a 115yearold ban on women hawking at such places as baseball parks, football stadiums and Madison Square Garden your ice cold beer or Get your hot dogs here. The ban is largely ignored and is unenforceable anyhow, since the New York State Civil Rights Law prohibits such discrimination.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Weaving Wonder

title: Dance: Quick and Subtle
description: There's something to be said for brevity and precision. So, when Judy Padow choreographs short dances, as in Cameo, she times them in seconds. An overlong blink would have eliminated one of the six charming vignettes of the piece. It wa shown on her program at the Dance of Gallery on Monday evening.

title: Antiboycott Bill Advances in Senate, With Critics Saying Carter Weakens It
