Blanche, also a Founcer and a long time friend or the Medical school, served as the First President or the College's National women's Division. our sincere con??lences are o??ed to Mr. Etra and the en??

title: Mexico Is Dropping Drug Charges
description: MEXICO CITY, April 16In an unexpected easing of its tough antidrug laws, Mexico has decided to drop charges against persons caught with small amounts of marijuana, cocaine or heroin.

title: The Russian Tea Room Blend: Food and Memories
description: Unique is hardly a word to be thrown around. Still, there are a lot of peoplefamous overachievers in the arts, musicians, dancers and conductors who've been all over the worldwho swear that the Russian Tea Room has no true counterpart anywhere.

title: Americans Reported ZaireBound
description: FRESNO, Calif., April 16 UPI)A crop duster who recruited American mercenaries for the war in Angola says that American soldiers of fortune will leave within a week for Zaire to join the fight against forces that are invading Shaba Province. David Bufkin, 38 years old, of Kerman, Calif., said yesterday the recruits would receive two weeks advance pay in Zaire before going into battle. Mr. Bufkin had placed an advertisement in a newspaper seeking former military men with combat experience for service in Zaire.

title: GARDENING
description: GARDENING ?? Sound is different fron gardening inland. Planters find ?? have to battle the ele??. But when they win, there are gen?? rewards.

title: NEW LOANS TO ITALY TO TOTAL $1 BILLION
description: PARIS April 16The United States and other major industrial countries agreed today to lend $1 billion to economically troubled Italy, provided the Italian Government takes new steps to put its financial affairs in better order.

title: One Plan Needed
description: PRECISELY on schedule, on March 21, a pair of ospreys settled down onto a tall nesting pole along the shore of the Sound in the town where I work. These powerful and stately fish hawks had just completed another roundtrip journey from their wintering grounds in South America.

title: The Pro Bowler:  Alone in a Crowd
description: Like many other pro bowlers, I am often asked if I consider myself an athlete. The answer is yes.

title: Evangelistic Drive in New York, And Debate About It, Intensify
description: The most ambitious Christian evangelistic campaign to hit New York City since the Billy Graham Crusade of 1970 today enters its most vigorous phase amid debate over its methods and purposes.

title: Connecticut
description: RESTAURANTS on the Connecticut shore are, on the whole, disappointing. Like many on Manhattan rooftops, they seem to believe that striking views will compensate for inferior food. The shoreline sustains fewer eating places than one would expect, and many of those face out upon their own parking lotswith sea, sand and sky only a remote backdrop.

title: Suited for the casual look
description: Although Seymour Edwards has always liked traditional, conservative suits, he says that as he gets olderhe is 61he finds that he enjoys wearing casual clothes. I am a factory sales representative and my work doesn't demand that I dress up. My time is pretty much my own. And seeing different people each day means that I don't have to maintain too extensive a wardrobe. But I do like to look a little different every day.

title: Owen Reports Rhodesian Gains
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Sunday, April 17 (Reuters)Foreign Secretary David Owen of Britain reported today that further progress had been made toward a Rhodesian settlement after new talks with Prime Ministaer Ian D. Smith.

title: Light, bright jackets
description: Left, small checks in green, yellow and brick pattern a polyester and linen sport jacket, traditionally styled with natural shoulders and a center vent. By . Freeman & Son. $210 at B. Altman & Co. Slacks by Jaymar. Shirt by Sero. Tie by John Weitz for Burma. Right, a ropeshouldered sport coat has a blockplaid pattern in blue, tan and natural. Blended of polyester and wool, the jacket has flapped pockets and side vents. By Mavest. $95 at Gimbels. Shirt by Golden Vee. Tie by Prince Consort.

title: Readings of Edith Wharton
description: WHEN Edith Wharton was a married woman of 27, she received her first recognition as a professional writer. In girlish Joy she ran up and down the stairs of her New York house: The sense that she might indeed have an identity beyond her ordained role as a society matron made the event enormous, In this strong critical biography, Cynthia Griffin Wolff has interpreted the solitary excitement of that prophetic moment in the life of a great American novelist. In R. W. B. Lewis's Edith Wharton: A Biography we have the story of Edith Newbold Jones Wharton complete, from the baptismal certificate of 1862 in fashionable Grace Church to the decorous funeral service she had planned in Paris in 1937. What Wolff, who worked with the Wharton manuscripts while Lewis wrote the definitive biography, brings to the facts is inspired readings of Wharton's texts. Her discovery is that the real lifethe lonely childhood, the socially correct marriage and disgraceful divorce, the late love affairnot only fed directly into Edith Wharton's work, but that the fictions instructed the novelist's life.

title: Concrete Canoes To Vie in Princeton
description: RACING in a canoe made of concrete sounds about as enjoyable as swimming in red bathing trunks, but next Saturday engineering students from 20 different colleges plan to prove otherwise on Lake Carnegie, the site of the first Princeton Eastern Invitational Concrete Canoe Race.

title: Long Island
description: SEAFOOD restaurants dot Long Island's North Shore harbors and beachfronts, as if being directly at the water's edge guaranteed the freshness of their fare.

title: INTERVIEW
description: FOR historical reasons, a relatively few people occupy most of the Sound's shoreline. The majority make due with what's left.

title: Beauty
description: It's a sandal yearflat sandals for walking, gold ones with skyhigh heels for dancing, mulelike sandals with no backs at all, gladiator's sandals laced up the leg. Sandals are cool and sexy, and they are most fashion designers' favorite shoes.

title: Serengeti Perhaps Will Die
description: THE headlines in Kenya's Daily Nation on March 9 proclaimed: Tanzania's tourist trade collapses. On Feb. 5, Tanzania closed its border with Kenya in retaliation for the breakup of East African Airways and in frustration because the majority of the revenue generated by Tanzania's parks stays in Kenya's capital of Nairobi, which is the center of the East African tourist industry. The result of the closure, however, is that Tanzania now has no tourists at all, and this means that the wildlife is not paying its way. Under the circumstances, the conservation dilemma in Tanzania is acute. Why should one of the 25 poorest countries in the world set aside any of its land for wild animals? If the answer is foreign exchange, then is there any reason for Tanzania to keep its parks now?

title: Mets Score 4 in Seventh and Win, 41; Yanks Allow 3 in Ninth and Lose, 43
description: When Nino Espinosa was a boy in the Dominican Republic, he used to press a radio to his ear to follow the bigleague adventures of his countryman, the great Juan Marichal of the San Francisco Giants. He would imitate Marichal's high leg kick, hope that Willie Mays or Willie McCovey would help by hitting a home run and create the fantasy that one day he also would be pitching up North.

title: Nancy Suzanne Roosevelt Fiancee of Thomas E. Ireland
description: Franklin Delano Roosevelt Jr. of Poughquag, N. Y., and New York and Mrs. Erasmus H. Kloman of Washington have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Suzanne Roosevelt, to Thomas Ellis Ireland, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Ireland 3d of New York. A September wedding is planned.

title: Denton Wins at Toledo For First Bowling Victory
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, April 16 (AP)John Denton edged Mike Samardzija, 204198, in the final match today of the $70,000 Toledo open and captured a Professional Bowlers Association tour nament for the first time.

title: ART
description: THE RECONSTRUCTED village of Mystic Seaport on Long Island Sound would make an ideal set for an Eastern, if movie moguls were looking for a convincing New England backdrop, Eastern Seaboard counterpart to Westerns.

title: 13 Rights Cases Awaiting Decisions
description: WASHINGTON, April 16 (UPI)At least 13 civil rights cases are nearing the enforcement stage at the Department of Health, Education and Welfare and are awaiting decisions by the Carter Administration.

title: Westchester
description: ALMOST within an anchor's cast of Mamaroneck's busy harbor are several restaurants offering diverse fare for visitors arriving by wateror, for that matter, for Westchester neighbors. You don't have to be a seafood fancier to sample their wares, but since our focus today was to be life around the Sound we took a special look at what each restaurant presented in the way of edibles from the sea. The following rundown, please note is, in geographical, not quality, order.

title: Some Surprises in the HighLevel Game of Musical Chairs
description: In the perennial game of musical chairs in the executive suite, Henry Ford 2d surprised the world by hanging on to his job as chairman and chief executive officer of the Ford Motor Compiny, while the first woman to hold a seat on the New York Stock Exchange became the first woman to head the New York State Banking Department.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: IF YOU want to study human nature, and marvel at it, one of the best places to do it is behind the circulation desk of your local library. I was there for a while in my salad days, and what I saw then has served me well ever since.

title: A STUDY CROUP URGES AID FOR RURAL SOUTH
description: ATLANTA, April 16  A blueribbon study group that once included President Carter and two Cabinet members has asserted that the rural South needs special aid and attention because many of its residents, particularly blacks, have been by passed by the Sunbelt boom.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The lively looking medal pictured here, issued for the 10th anniversary of the American Israel Numismatic Association, will go on sale at the fifth annual Greater New York Coin Convention which opens at the Sheraton Hotel in New York City on April 28.

title: Seoul Nervous Over Carter Move To End Travel Curb for Aliens
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 16South Korean officials expressed concern today over President Carter's decision to lift travel restrictions on foreigners living permanently in the United States. They are worried that this will allow South Korean residents of the United States to travel freely to North Korea, something that is prohibited for all citizens of South Korea.

title: Standout Bearded Collie Continues to Blaze Trails
description: The first best inshow bearded collie in the United States is a sweettempared house pet that answers to the whimsical name of Bonnet, but she has made a habit of arriving ahead of the breed competition. Heads turned and seasoned campaigners faded into the background on Easter Sunday as Ch. Brambledale Blue Bonnet, C.D. forged her way through to the breed's first working group victory and then on to he top award over 708 competitors at the LewistonAuburn allbreed event in Maine.

title: SMALLER STAFF SAID TO CUT PATIENT CARE
description: Staff shortages at New York City's municipal hospitals are shortcutting patient care, sometimes dangerously, a visiting committee of the United Hospital Fund of New York warned in a report released yesterday.

title: Letters: Poetic Detour To St. Ives Via Kew
description: Regarding the EncounterTo Kew in Lilac Time (Travel Section, April 3), when I was stationed with the Army in Europe in 1943, I often thought of a poem I'd been taught at Norwalk High:

title: Connecticut
description: RESTAURANTS on the Connecticut shore are, on the whole, disappointing. Like many on Manhattan rooftops, they seem to believe that striking views will compensate for inferior food. The shoreline sustains fewer eating places than one would expect, and many of those face out upon their own parking lotswith sea, sand and sky only a remote backdrop.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: Our major museums are in and out of the newspapers every day. But the smaller ones are quite another matter. There is no one comprehensive and reliable guidebook to this country which sorts them out as Baedeker and the Guides Bleus between them sort out the museums or Europe. Often they are difficult to get to. Sometimes they keep strange hours. Half the galleries may be shut for lack of money. Visitors may be so few that the custodian almost has to oil the lock before we can get in.

title: NATO HAS NOT MENDED A SPLIT ON ITS FLANK
description: ATHENS, April 11Continuing tensions between Greece and Turkey have caused significant but by no means fatal damage to the military preparedness of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in the eastern Mediterranean, according to analysts here and in Ankara.

title: Soft plaids
description: Left, woolworsted suit has a black block plaid on a blue ground. The shoulderpadded jacket has angled flap pockets, a deep center vent; the pants have angled front pockets. By Hammonton Park. $275 at Schlesinger's. Shirt by Manhattan. Tie by Oleg Cassini for Burma. Right, traditionally styled naturalshouldered suit, a blend of silk, polyester and wool, has a brown and natural glen plaid overplaided with rust. By Norman Hilton. $255 at Paul Stuart. Shirt by Philippe Venet. Tie by Gino Pompeii.

title: Mayoralty Has Always Fascinated Governors
description: New York State Governors seem unable to resist the mayoral politics of New York City, the offspring that often overshadows its parent in appeal and notoriety.

title: Some Plants Don't Like the Salt
description: GARDENING on the Sound is different from gardening inland. Planter find they have to battle the elements. But when they win, there are generous rewards.

title: The Game Of House Renting
description: NO DOGS. No children. No heterosexual singles. No homosexual singles. No parties.

title: Cornell Wins in Lacrosse
description: ITHACA, N.Y., April 16 (AP)Topranked Cornell defeated Johns Hopkins, 1211, in a battle of college lacrosse powers today. A junior, Tom Marino, had five goals, including the winner.

title: And on the Shore, Attractions Galore
description: THERE'S more to cruising the Sound than meets the radar screen. Throughout spring and summer, its shores are alive with enough easily accessible sounds of music and theaterand sights of art and historical museumsto keep intrepid boatmen at anchor.

title: The Region
description: Mayor Beame has not said that he will seek reelection, but portions of his forthcoming budget for New York City leave few doubts about his intentions.

title: Bowling Clinic
description: While all golfers seek to shoot under par, the corollary holds true In the ranks of the professional bowler: How far over para 200 averagehe can go determines how much money he'll take away from the P.B.A. tour. Last year, when he averaged 215 pins, per game, for almost 1,000 games, Mark Roth walked off with honors.

title: Reflections on My Seven Years Of Being at Swords'
description: In Avatars of the Tortoise, Jorge Luis Borges said sadly: There is a concept which corrupts and upsets all others. I refer not to Evil, whose limited realm is that of ethics. I refer to the infinite. I once longed to compile its mobile history. The numerous Hydra (the swamp monster which amounts to a prefiguration or emblem of geometric progressions) would lend convenient horror to its portico; it would be crowned by the sordid nightmares of Kafka.... Five or seven years of metaphysical, theological and mathematical apprenticeship would allow me (perhaps) to plan decorously such a book. It is useless to add that life forbids me that hope and even that adverb.

title: Dr. Albert W. Schilke, a Dentist In Bergen County for 30 Years
description: Dr. Albert Walter Schilke, a dentist in Englewood, N. J., for more than 30 years and past president of the Bergen County Dental Society and the New Jersey State Dental Society, died in Englewood Hospital. He was 53 years old and lived in Tenafly.

title: Purtzer, Nicklaus Share Lead
description: CARLSBAD, Calif., April 16Jack Nicklaus came off the course at LaCosto Country Club today tied with Tom Purtzer for the lead in the MONY Tournament of Champions at six under par, and found himself ambushed by oldtimer remarks.

title: Marriage Is Planned
description: Dr. and Mrs. Harrison P. Eddy 3d of New York and Pleasant Valley, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Catherine Locke Eddy, to M. Alain de Lauzon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jacques de Lauzon of St. Valery sur Somme, France.

title: FORD TELLS REPUBLICANS PARTY MUST BROADEN BASE
description: LOS ANGELES, April 16 (AP)Former President Gerald R. Ford said today that Republicans must concentrate on broadening their base and should forget about ideological purity if they wanted to remain a viable political force.

title: Long Island/ This Week
description: COLD SPRING HARBORExhibition of paintings by Max Ginsburg; through May 14: today 1 to 5 P.M.; Tuesdays through Saturdays 10 A.M. to 5 P.M.; Harbor Gallery, 43 Main St

title: ALBANY STRIKE TALKS FAIL TO MATERIALIZE
description: ALBANY, April 16With a strike threatened for Monday morning, New York State and its largest publicemployees union spent the day today saying publicly that they were ready to resume negotiationsbut, not telling each other. As of late evening, no new meetings had been scheduled, and strike preparations continued.

title: Questions/Answers
description: Is is possible to make a successful hedge of spruce? If so, how and when should it be planted and pruned? Mrs. G.D.P., Salibsury Ct.

title: China Has Come Up Faster Than Mr. Carter Expected
description: WASHINGTONRelations between the United States and China have been so delicate and difficult for so long that one of the early recommendations that President Carter got from Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and Zbigniew Brzezinski, his national security adviser, was not to rush into the China question. They said he should first deal with the Middle East, strategic arms limitations, Panama, Cyprus, Europe, Japan, nuclear proliferation and then, around the middle of 1977, look at China.

title: U.S. BOWS TO POLICY OF UNIONS AND BARS 3 SOVIET LABOR AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, April 16  Despite President Carter's pledge to liberalize entry into this country, the State Department has acceded again to A.F.L.C.I.O. policy and refused to allow three Soviet trade unionists to attend a longshoremen's convention in Seattle next week.

title: Energy: He Can't Please Everyone
description: Although the details of his energy plan will not be confirmed until this week, President Carter has apparently decided to deal with the nation's energy shortage mainly by using Federal taxing authority to impose financial penalties for high fuel consumption and incentives for practicing conservation. Each of the elements of the President's plan, which affects automobile use, home heating and industrial uses, is likely to offend one or more influential interests.

title: How a Horowitz Emulator Turned Into Garrick Ohlsson
description: I suppose I went through my Vladimir Horowitz phase when I was about 15, began Garrick Ohisson, who performs with the Guarneri Quartet Wednesday and Thursday at Tully Hall. I was terribly enamored of his recordings, and I sort of thought I was a minidemon myself. Well, as I strove to express intensity and emotion I was tightening and tightening and tightening, with my elbows locked in at my sides, my arms tense, my stomach muscles in knots, and my fingers pounding away like ten little sledge hammers, probably making one hell of a racket.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: ALGER HISS: The True Story, by John Chabot Smith. (Penguin, $2.95.) A newspaperman who covered the case 27 years ago reconsiders the evidence and concludes that Hiss was innocent; however, since the book's first publication a year ago, F.B.I. files, not yet fully appraised, have been opened.

title: Golf Balls a Potential Hazard
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (UPI)Golf balls can be dangerous, said a warning issued by the Florida Medical Association. Golf ball centers are made by freezing liquid material into a solid and wrapping windings around it, the association said. When the center thaws, great pressure is exerted against the covering. When the liquid center of a golf ball is cut, it can explode, sometimes causing serious injury, the association said.

title: Tennis on the Run: A Tourist Guide
description: If you are among the 60 minion tennis players in this country today, you may hesitate, as my husband and I did, to take a sightseeing trip. How could we live without the Saturday morning singles, the Sunday mixed doubles, the Wednesday round robin? Would the withdrawal symptoms ruin our trip?

title: Stenmark Is Victor
description: TARNABY, Sweden, April 16 (AP)The World Cup champion, Ingemar Stenmark of Sweden, won the men's giant slalom as the Swedish Alpine ski championships began today.

title: Only Yesterday, It Was a Glacier
description: LONG ISLAND SOUND as we know it today is relatively new on the landscape. Twenty thousand years agowhich appears to be a long time on a human scale, but is only a few seconds in the severalbillionyear history of the eartha huge glacier covered the Sound with ice, terminating on what is now Long Island.

title: Elsie S. Proxmire Is Married
description: Elsie Stillman Proxmire, daughter of Mrs. Miles McMillin of Madison, Wis., and Senator William Proxmire of Washington and Madison, was married yesterday evening to Dr. Alan Zwerner, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Zwerner of White Plains.

title: Shore BirdsA Fight for
description: IN ABOUT two months, the New Jersey Shore will be invaded by thousands of tourists bent on simple pleasures: a suntan, a salty swim, a frozen custard cone. But very soon now, in early May, another invasion will be taking place there, one that has been occurring annually almost since the beginning of the world.

title: Summer nights
description: Left, dinner jacket of paleblue polyester shantung has a shawl collar, straight flapped pockets, a center vent. By After Six. $120 at Barney's.

title: To Protect the Sound's Kitchen
description: IN a few weeks, if all goes better than it has so far, New York's long overdue inventory of tidal wetlands will be ready. When the maps are published and registered, the final stage will be set for an effort whose main goal is seen as no less than the salvation of the Sound from extinction.

title: SHOP TALK
description: BACK in the days before the airplane took over as the most popular method of international transportation, the oceangoing vessel was queen, and liners were supplied by ship's chandlers who provided everything needed for the return voyage from the smallest shackles to the food required. Today, marine supply stores still carry the smallest shackle, but some have items in stock that appeal both to the salty and the landlubber.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, April 16 (UPI)A Federal district judge has dismissed charges against 21 present and former law enforcement officials named in a $47.7 million civil damage suit stemming from a 1969 police raid on a Black Panther Party apartment.

title: List of Connecticut And New York Hearings
description: Public hearings on the disposal issue and the management plan for Long Island Sound will be held by the Connectcut Department of Environmental Protection and the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation on the following dates:

title: The Mets' Kingman: Slugger and Enigma
description: Blue sky, hot sun, a fivehit shutout what more could anyone ask? All around the clubhouse the Mets were agreed that it has to be the most perfect home opener in their history. Spirits were up, jokes were funny, voices were loud. Except Dave Kingman's.

title: Deaths
description: Adams, Plerpont

title: Dining Out Around the Sound: Seafood,
description: Here is a report on some of the better restaurants on both sides of the Sound, as compiled by food critics of The New York Times's regional weeklies:

title: Casamayor Takes Sand Hills Cup
description: SOUTHERN PINES, N. C., April 16 (AP)  Casamayor, matching strides with Alvaro II as the two horses broke from the field, nosed out the challenger to win the $10,000 Sand Hills Cup at the 30th annual Stoneybrook Steeplechase here today.

title: Canadiens Beat Blues, 51; Need a Victory for Sweep
description: ST. LOUIS, April 16 (UPI)Serge Savard scored two goals tonight to lead the Montreal Canadiens to a 51 triumph over the St. Louis Blues and a 30 advantage in their National Hockey League quarterfinal playoff series.

title: Ignorants Abroad: Touring France Without French
description: Thirtyfour years ago, I dropped out of my high school French class after two months, most of which our teacher, Miss Edwards, had devoted to the life and times of her canary and the lyrics of Sur le Pont d'Avignon. My wife Sonia was as innocent of French as 1. Yet last fall we decided to rent a car and tour the country.

title: Army Corps Tackles Dredging Issue
description: BY June or July, a scow bearing dredged material may be on its way across the green waters of Long Island Sound, carrying bottom dirt from a harbor in Connecticut, a marina in Westchester County, or perhaps a creek on the Island's North Shore.

title: Islanders May Do the Unspeakable Tonight
description: BUFFALO, April 16I'd rather be three games up than three games down, said Bill Torrey, the Islanders' general manager, taking care not to say anything that might incite the Buffalo Sabres or iinx New York.

title: ROCKEFELLER GRANTS GO TO 35 IN THE HUMANITIES
description: The Rockefeller Foundation has announced this year's winners of its third annual competition for Fellowships in the Humanities.

title: Deborah E. Weinberg Affianced to Dr. Marvin Godner
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward H. Weinberg of Mamaroneck, N. Y., have announced the engagement or Mr. Weinberg's daughter, Deborah Eden Weinberg, to Dr. Marvin Godner, both of Ganado, Ariz. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Alex Godner of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Poll Reports the Concorde Is Favored Unless Landing Is Made at Nearby Airport
description: The latest Gallup Poll has found that among Americans who had heard or read about the debate over the Concorde, the BritishFrench supersonic airliner, 43 percent believed the plane should be allowed to land in the United States while 39 percent were opposed to the idea. Eighteen percent were undecided.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE CHEMICAL BANK was fined $222,500 after it pleaded guilty to misdemeanor charges for failing to report 445 large moneyexchanging transactions amounting to $7 million. The transactions had allegedly been made for narcotics dealers . . . Credit Suisse, Switzerland's thirdlargest commercial bank, reported that it had lost almost $100 million in unauthorized dealings between one of its branches and an unidentified major foreign client . . . The International Monetary Fund said its next gold auction would be held on May 4, when 525,000 ounces will be auctioned.

title: Claudia Radigan Is Bride in Jersey Of Geoffrey Mason
description: St. Teresa's Roman Catholic Church In Summit, N. J., was the setting yesterday for the wedding ceremony of Claudia Marie Ruth Radigan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Radigan of Summit, N. J., and Geoffrey Sheridan Mason. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Leattor Mason of Casey Key, Fla.

title: Confusion Over New Boat Rule
description: POLLUTION control laws for boats using Long Island Sound may become an enforceable as those against spitting in the subway or jaywalking in Times Square. according to some marine experts.

title: Protection for The Sound's Kitchen
description: IN a few weeks, if all goes better than it has so far, New York's long overdue inventory of tidal wetlands will be ready. When the maps are published and registered, the final stage will be set for an effort whose main goal is seen as no less than the salvation of the Sound from extinction.

title: West Point Will Revise Its Policies On Finding and Training of Women
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., April 16The United States Military Academy has decided to introduce some changes in the recruitment, testing and training of women after an assessment of their first year at the once allmale institution.

title: And on the Shore, Attractions Galore
description: THERE'S more to cruising the Sound than meets the radar screen. Throughout spring and summer, its shores are alive with enough easily accessible sounds of music and theaterand sights of art and historical museumsto keep intrepid boatmen at anchor.

title: Clambake At the Shore
description: THE SEASON is fast approaching for that most dramatic, ceremonious andin its own waygratifying of American feasts, the wily institution known as a clambake on the shore.

title: 3Year Inquiry Threads Together Evidence on F.A.L.N. Terrorism
description: The dynamite comes from the Southwest. The bombs go off In Manhattan, the Chicago Loop, the Newark Police Headquarters, the nation's capital. The bombers' notes call for Puerto Rican Independence, but MexicanAmericans are among the suspects and subpoenaed witnesses.

title: DETROIT IS SPURRING RENAISSANCE IN ARTS
description: DETROIT, April 16  This city's attempt to stimulate its own economic rebirths, and in turn that of the nation's Industrial Creocent, is being carried over into the arts.

title: STAMPS
description: Great Britain is issuing its own commemoratives for the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth's accession to the throne, following the earlier innovative issue by more than a score of territories and colonies. The new stamps demonstrate anew that Britain remains the stronghold of tradition.

title: The Limon Company at 30 Celebrating Survival
description: The most remarkable thing about the Jos Limn Company's season, which starts Tuesday at the Roundabout Theater, is not its dancers (excellent) or its repertory (strong though unvarying) but the fact that the company still exists at all as a performing ensemble. It is unique among modern dance companies, being the only one to survive its founder's death. Every attitude in modern dance history, starting with Isadora Duncan's, militated against survival, yet through sheer will and some luck the company is celebrating its 30th anniversary five years after the death of Limn. It has 16 dancers, half of whom were members when he was alive, and it has worked from 20 to 30 weeks annually over the past four years.

title: Lynda Helmstadter Is Bride at Stanford Of James Barber Jr.
description: In Memorial Church on the Stanford University campus at noon yesterday, Lynda Diane Helmstadter, daughter of Mrs. Eldon West and Dr. Gerald Helmstadter of Tempe, Ariz., became the bride of James Laurance Barber Jr., son of Mrs. Barber of New York and Palm Springs, Calif., and the late Mr. Barber.

title: Marion Merrill Engaged to Edward R. Hoyle
description: Mr. and Mrs. Bushnell Darby Merrill of Chestnut Hill, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Marion Farnsworth Merrill, to Edward Robinson Hoyle, son of Mr. and Mrs. Royce Augustine Hoyle Jr. of Glencoe, Ill. A wedding in June is planned.

title: DoubleDigit Inflation Breaks Out in the Executive Suite
description: When the Government wages its perennial fights against inflation, one area always seems to escape the gladiators' attentionthe compensation of top corporate officers.

title: Memorial Services for Wrigley
description: CHICAGO, April 16 (UPI)Memorial services for Philip K. Wrigley, the chewing gum manufacturer and owner of the Chicago Cubs, will be held next Thursday at the Fourth Presbyterian Church of Chicago. Wrigley, 82 years old, died in Elkhorn, Wis., last Tuesday. Burial was private. In lieu of flowers, a spokesman for the Wrigley family said contributions may be made to the Chicago Historical Society; Lakeland Hospital, Elkhorn, Wis.; Northwestern Memorial Hospital, Chicago; or the Wrigley Memorial Garden Foundation, Avalon, Calif.

title: Beame, Council Straining Amity In Minor Fights
description: As adversaries go, the Mayor and the City Council of New York City aren't exactly titans in the thick of battle most of the time. Some people attribute the origins of the fiscal crisis, in part, to the lassitude displayed over the

title: Beyond the Man in the Gray Flannel Suit
description: Even the least fashionconscious of observers, looking around the streets and shop windows these days, is likely to get an impression that, President Carter's sweater and blue jeans to the contrary notwithstanding, the fashion in men's clothing is moving rather sharply in the direction of formality and elegance. Almost all of the store windows on Fifth and Madison display suits with vests, which until recently had been in decline since the 1930's and a decade or so ago seemed to be headed for extinction, Barney's, said to be the quickest of all local clothiers to scent a trend and respond to it, has recently been featuring in its window a man wearing a velvetcollared topcoat and a bowler. Even in Greenwich Village, for years now a capital of Proletarian Drag and Conspicuous Outrage as regards dress styles of both sexes, male attire is inching its way toward conservatism. One can again walk through Sheridan Square wearing a suit and tie without feeling like a Hohenzollern.

title: Wind Power for a Windy City
description: BUFFALOThe distinction long held by Chicago as the nation's Windy City may be in jeopardy.

title: With Egos as Big as Their Fees
description: IN a career of writing and reporting I have closely observed two professions in which egomania seems, if not a prerequisite, at least rife. One is that of the cardiac surgeon, who labors in a glorious theater under piercing spotlights, surrounded by a corps de ballet of younger doctors, nurses and technicians. The second is that of the trial lawyer, who does not command center stage at every moment, but who dependably has the best part in the play.

title: Of Special Interest
description: The Laura Foreman Dance Theater, which has the distinction of having the first university residency for a professional dance company in New York City, is currently engaged at its home base at The New School. This Friday, and on consecutive Fridays through May 13, Miss Foreman will present Heirlooms, a new work with sets and costumes by Gary Stephan, who formerly assisted Jaspar Johns with costumes for Merce Cunningham, and an original sound score by John Watts. (See Dance)

title: Army Corps Tackles Dredging Issue
description: BY JUNE or July, a scow bearing dredged material may be on its way across the green waters of Long Island Sound, carrying bottom dirt from a harbor in Connecticut, a marina in Westchester County, or perhaps a creek on the North Shore of Long Island.

title: The Effects of Ice on Scotch
description: In countries where Scotch has been consumed for centuries, ice and whisky rarely mingle. But on this side of the Atlantic, the picture is quite different. While a small percentage of American Scotch drinkers take it neat, better than 35% drink it on the rocks. The rest of us add varying amounts of water, club soda. etcetera. And ice. Always plenty of ice  the great American drink requisite.

title: The Sun Also Rises In Housing
description: LAGRANGE, N.Y.The mighty sun casts its beneficent rays indiscriminately upon the world, and these days more and more people are going out of their way to catch them and put them to use in housing.

title: Rival Palestinian Groups Clash in South Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 16Members of two rival Palestinian guerrilla organizations clashed today in the southern town of Nabatiye, about eight miles from the Israeli border, because of disagreement regarding a proposed ceasefire with rightwing Christians in that area.

title: Leapin' Lizards! Guess Who's Coming To Broadway (Arf!)
... to Avoid a Silent Spring
description: LONG ISLAND SOUND is a major part of the Island's marine environment. A healthy marine environment brings economic and esthetic benefits to all who take advantage of this precious resource. As urbanization continues to push into Nassau and Suffolk Counties, the pressures on this resource increase. These pressures include human sewage, solid waste, pesticides and thermal discharges.

title: On the conservative side
description: Lucious Switzer is a designer and a successful businessman. Two years ago he founded The Switzer Group Inc., an interiordesign firm, and he is only 28.

title: SHOP TALK
description: WITH the opening of the boating season on Long Island Sound, the marinesupply stores near the Westchester coast emerge from the doldrums of slow winter months and prepare for the influx of pleasureboat owners who dock their craft at nearby marinas.

title: Women Golfers Pay Tribute to a 5Time English Champion of Past
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., April 16During the last four days, many of the country's best women golf professionals have been diffidently approaching a whitehaired stranger to ask her to pose for a snapshot, either with them or alone. Others ask for an autograph. Some simply introduce themselves for the privilege of shaking hands with her.

title: Studying the Porgy and Bass
description: IT DOESN'T look liKe much fun. Young people in white coats are peeling the scales off porgy, cutting open flounder and determining the gender of bluefish in a small room filled with fish or their remains. But the students at the Sandy Hook Marine Laboratory don't mind the lack of glamour. They don't even mind the smell.

title: REBUILDING BEGINS AT SCHOOL IN BEIRUT
description: With a tenuous armistice in effect and the savage fighting of the Lebanese civil war halted, life at the American University of Beirut is beginning to return to normal.

title: INTERVIEW
description: IN 1951, Arnold Cream of Pennsauken made a promise to God. At the time, heMr. Creamwas 37 years and 7 months old. I said that if God let me be heavyweight champion of the world, if it was only for a day, I would spend the rest of my life helping young people be good citizens, he said the other day.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Matters of faith. America is in the midst of a great religious revival. Publishers began getting that message a year or two ago when their volumes with inspirational and revelatnonal themes began rolling up marvelous sales. Any lingering doubts they may have harbored were wiped away this month when two TV specials helped turn several books into overnight best sellers.

title: MarinasPlain and Fancy
description: FROM GREENWICH to Niantic from Montauk Point to City Island, there are scores of marinas that offer refuge to people traveling in boats. They range from the plain, with only simple moorings to tie a boat overnight, to the fancy, with restaurants, bars, gift shops and pools, from the small, with 40 slips, to the large, with 850.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE BRASS PENNY is everyone's idea of the essential country restaurant. Lovely old town, handsome old house, friendly staffit's all there. Unfortunately, the food is just soso.

title: The Wild Party and The SetUp
description: IT wasn't a long obituary; it stated that Joseph Moncure March had died in California in, February of this year at the age of 78. Reading this made me sad. Not only is Joseph Moncure March barely known to the younger generations of writers, critics and academics, but he is also scarcely remembered by the older generation.

title: The Case for Conservation
description: President Carter will go before Congress three days from now to propose a major change in American ways. According to all advance indications, he will stress an uncomfortable and possibly unwelcome theme for a society that has grown rich and, some say, lazy while devouring enormous quantities of fuel and that has become accustomed to consuming ever greater amounts of nearly all basic resources. We will be told, in effect, that we must think and act frugally hereafter in using energy, our most basic of all resources, or risk economic calamity.

title: Fisher Body Workers Walk Out
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., April 15 (AP)From 750 to 1,000 workers walked off their jobs Friday, forcing a production halt at the Fisher Body plant of General Motors. The workers, members of United Automobile Workers Local 488, said they were protesting the disciplinary layoffs of 18 workers.

title: Other African Nations See a Test of National Integrity in Zaire
description: KINSHASA, ZaireIn rallying the defense of his rule, President Mobutu Sese Seko of Zaire has succeeded in depicting the troubles in Shaba province as an attack on national integrity and has thus touched a cord that resonates in almost every African capital.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: A POPULAR feature of many homes that border on or over look the North or South Shores of Long Island Sound is a raised outdoor wood deckor, in some cases, a waterfront dock on pilings t??a?? is also used as a sun deck and outdoor lounging area.

title: Army Corps Tackles Dredging Issue
description: BY June or July, a scow bearing dredged material may be on its way across the green waters of Long Island Sound, carrying bottom dirt from a harbor in Connecticut, a marina in Westchester County, or perhaps a creek on the North Shore of Long Island.

title: Editors' Choice
description: A BOOK OF COMMON PRAYER, by Joan Didion. (Simon & Schuster, $8.95.) A novel that searches the wreckage of the 1960's.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayNorth Shore Equestrian Center, C. W. Post College showgrounds, Northern Blvd., Greenvale, L. I. Green, special and junior working hunters; preliminary and novice hunters; adult horsemanship, ponies, equitation. 8:30.

title: Sunday Observer
description: The cats wanted a conference. Here was a disagreeable development. It was bad enough having conferences with people. A conference is nothing but a committee of the upwardly mobile in search of a victim, and one of the chief reasons for keeping cats was that they hated committees.

title: A Bronx Class Predicts Weather With Own Professional Devices
description: Ralphy Rivera can tell you what a cold front, a hot front or a stationary front looks like on a weather map. He can point out high and lowpressure systems, tell you the effect of steering winds and predict when the weather will change. Ralphy is 10 years old.

title: The Way We Treat the Old Is New
description: THROUGHOUT much of human history, the old, whether numerous or few, have been treated with respect. They have held positions of privilege, as so many of our honorific words imply senator, veteran, guru, alderman, seigneur, presbyterall transmogrifications of the words for old. So why, in modern America, are the old regarded vindictively?

title: On City Island,
description: SOME time next month, the 12meter yacht Enterprise will be rucked across the country from San Diego to the Minneford Yacht Yard on City Island in the Bronx for modification and a final outfitting in preparation for the America's Cup challenge in Newport, R. I., on Sept. 13.

title: 19 DISSIDENTS HELD IN NEW SEOUL DRIVE
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 16The South Korean security agencies, over the last few days, have taken in for questioning a large number of Christian activists and other dissidents in a move that appears to signify a new Government crackdown.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: While all the attention has been focused on the new Westway project in Manhattan, New Jersey's highway proponents have been steadily, if less spectacularly, promoting still more highway projects in a region already overmacadamized.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Today356 Porsche Registry swap meet at H.O. Penn Co. office parking lot, opposite Ramada Inn, off Route 684, Armonk, N.Y., 10 A.M. (Rain date, April 24).

description: Grass begins to green our corner of the earth again, the new young blades of the least pretentious of this world's everyday plants and the most important to mankind.

title: INTERVIEW
description: FOR historical reasons, a relatively few people occupy most of the Sound's shoreline. The majority make due with what's left.

title: Vietnamese Girl, 16, Is Slain in Queens
description: A 16yearold Queens girl, a South Vietnamese refugee, was found slain yesterday morning, and detectives arrested a 30yearold neighbor on charges of murder and rape, the police reported.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: The Sunny Sea at Our Back Door
description: MYSTIQUES hover like fog over bodies of water. The mystique derives not so much from the water itself as from humanity's struggle with it. Water has been both bridge and barrier, and our constant efforts to make it do what we want have challenged and harassed literary people since the days of Homer. Implacable. Storm toss'd. Ranging. Towering. Painted. Cruel. Romantic. These are the words that futilely try to capture the sea while it runs through our fingers or inundates us.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10:30 A.M. (Channel 4), Sunday: Ronnie Eldridge, aide to former Mayor John V. Lindsay; Tai and Rosita Missoni, husband and wife designer team.

title: Gore Vidal, Scorekeeper
description: Q. Mr. Vidal, you recently wrote in The New York Review of Books, when it comes to matters of prose and of fiction at this time and in this place, I am authority. Is this authority conferred by fiat? By whom? Or is it seized? Or revealed?

title: Frederick Eayrs Jr. to Wed Andrea Notman
description: Mr. and Mrs. Donald D. Notman of Washington have announced the engagement of their daughter, Andrea Trotter Notman, to Frederick E. Eayrs Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Eayrs of Middleboro, Mass.

title: Castles on the Sand
description: NOWADAYS the Westchester and Fairfield coasts of Long Island Sound are, with few exceptions, playgrounds reserved for a strictly local clientere. But in a time well before Tshirts and metal tennis racquets, the coast was a thriving resort area for bathing, sailing, clambakes and other lighthearted pastimes.

title: Here's What I Would Do About Energy...
description: History should tell everyone that the United States citizen knows how to react in a crisis. He did it in 1973, although no one liked it. Therefore, we can count on voluntary actions in a crisisonce the people have become convinced that there is a crisis.

title: Russian Hotel Is All Western But Its Cement
description: LENINGRADOn a muddy construction site overlooking the sea, workers in hard hats move beneath a rising skeleton of pillars and walls, against a constant background of grumbling cement mixers and forklift trucks, within a filigree pattern of cranes and steel reinforcing rods.

title: San Diego State Joins W.A.C.
description: DENVER, April 16 (UPI)San Diego State University will join the Western Athletic Conference as one of two schools replacing Arizona and Arizona State, officials announced today. The membership will become effective July 1, 1978, the day after the two Arizona schools leave for the Pacific8 conference.

title: Anne Catherine Lynch Bride of Peter Hadekel
description: Anne Catherine Lynch and Peter Hadekel were married yesterday in Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Charles B. Weiser of the Aquinas Institute performed the Roman Catholic ceremony in the Princeton University Chapel.

title: Two Israeli Parties Register With U.S.  To Solicit Money
description: Representatives of two Israeli political parties have registered as foreign agents with the United States Department of Justice in order to continue their fundraising activities in this country.

description: Nagler

description: FOR historical reasons, a relatively few people occupy most of the Sound's shoreline. The majority make due with what's left.

title: The Passive Way
description: Then there are the passive systems. One went into effect in Princeton, N.J., two years ago at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Kelbaugh. It has a Trombe wall, named after the French professor who developed the idea.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: I wish that all of the actresses in Ladies at the Alamo, accompanied by their director, Frank Perry, could find time one evening to slip over to the American Place Theater for the specific purpose of watching, and hearing, Martin Balsam stumble over a line. Mr. Balsam is appearing just a few blocks away in Ronald Ribman's Cold Storage, a play that is essentially one very fat, necessarily wordy character sketch, and every once in a while as the words pour out of him he tripsor seems to tripover a syllable or a phrase.

description: This is one of a series of occasional articles describing uncommon moments in travelthose encounters with the unexpected that are, for better or worse, the most memorable adventure of any journey.

title: S. K. Lynner to Wed Miss Angermueller
description: Mr. and Mrs. Hans Angermueller of Summit. N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Marianne Angermueller, to Stephen Kent Lynner of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sigurd Lynner of Daytona Beach, Fla., formerly of Saddle River, N.J.

title: Berkey A Photo Finish in a Race With Giants
description: Berkey Photo Inc., a pygmy enterprise that battles the giants of the photographic industry on many fronts, will enter a Federal courtroom next month to take on the biggest of them all, the Eastman Kodak Company.

title: Late Afternoon Seen, as Likely Time For Super Bowl XII in the Superdome
description: The Super Bowl will not become a night gamenot yetfor the advantage of television. But the next Super Bowl game, at New Orleans on Jan. 15, 1978, will be played in late afternoon if Commissioner Pete Rozelle of the National Football League accedes to the request of CBS, the network whose turn it will be to telecast pro football's championship game. A twilight game? Hardly. Super Bowl XII will be played indoors, under the lights of the Superdome.

title: CareyBeame Proposal to Create City Health Chief Is Condemned
description: A proposal by Governor Carey and Mayor Beanie for a sixjob health czar for New York City has been condemned by the Health Systems Agency, the federally mandated and federally financed planning agency for the city area.

title: The Hills Record at the S.E. C.Decidedly Mixed Reviews
description: WASHINGTONTomorrow morning Harold M. Williams, 49yearold former head of Norton Simon Inc. and most recently dean of U.C.L.A.'s Graduate School of Business, takes office as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Anne Bowman Engaged to John D. Martin
description: Mr. and Mrs. Fielding Lewis Bowman of New Canaan, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Anne Fielding Bowman, to John David Martin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bradford Robinson Martin of Chicopee, Mass. A summer wedding is planned.

title: Clambake At the Shore
description: THE SEASON is fast approaching for that most dramatic, ceremonious andin its own waygratifyng of American feasts, the jolly intitution known as a clambake on the shore.

title: Mine Paper Halts in Election Fight
description: WASHINGTON, April 16Union politics is interfering again with publication of The United Mine Workers Journal, a prizewinning biweekly magazine regarded by many as one of the liveliest and most informative American labor periodicals.

title: German Driver Is Killed In Crash at Hockenheim
description: HOCKENHEIM, West Germany, April 16 (AP)A West German sports car driver was killed today at Hockenheimring, the supposedly safe race track which Formula One drivers picked as a substitute for traditional Nuerburgring this year for the grand prix race.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: The literature of Everest expeditions is young, but it has already hardened into a genre as formal and predictable as the sonnet. Such books begin at sea level, where a plucky and tireless visionary (usually the author) finds the money and men, angles successfully for permission from the Nepalese to make his assault (it comes at the last minute), and through enormously complex planning and courage (author describing self again) leads a small army of mutually competitive climbers and doughty Sherpas. (they are venal, too, but this is softpedaled) through the literally abysmal maze of the fabled Ice Fall and then ascends, in slow and painful stages, marred by inadequate radio communication between the expedition's tail and head as well as by insufficient oxygen for the final push, to the of the world.

title: Corporate BondsThe Yield Is Nice, but ...
description: There are pitfalls for the small investor who puts his money into corporate bonds.

title: ART
description: IN the art column of an issue devoted to Long Island Sound a writer might discuss one aspect of the Sound before everything else, a phenomenon of singular importance: the preeminent beauty of the body of water flowing between the Island and Connecticut. Any art writer who fails to do that cannot possibly appreciate the glories of landscape whether they are on canvas or in nature, and especially this landscape, a most glorious combination of water and land, enticing geographical contours, and especially wondrous light and atmosphere and an unmistakable character all its own.

title: A taste for designer clothes
description: Jon Peters, a 35yearold documentary film maker, owns three pairs of cowboy boots. He keeps one pair in each of his three homesthe lizard skin in his 22nd Street loft, the leather in his Aframe in Pawling and the armadillo in his beach house on Fire Island.

title: A Solitary Sentinel
description: IN the days when great wooden ships sailed Long Island Sound under taut canvas clouds, men and ligthouses stood watch over the rocks and shoals that dotted the waters, lying in wait for the unwary Today the wooden ships are only beautiful and romantic curiosities and the weathered lighthouses are for the most part victims of an advancing technology no loner needing the hand of man.

title: In the Wake of the Boat Boom:
description: BOATING gets bigger and bigger every year, and there's no place to keep the boats. Robert Kohlasch, a boatyard owner, gazed about him at the hulking, shrouded yachts crowded onto his land in New Rochelle, drew his weathered face into a squint and added: The waterfront is getting shorter and shorter.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: THEATER

title: Behind the Best Sellers: Brooke Hayward
description: A phrase recurs in Brooke Hayward's Haywire: It's a bummer. Bad news. Dealt a rotten hand. A downer. The living daughter of Margaret Sullavan, Hollywood dream girl, and Leland Hayward, everybody's favorite agent and Broadway producer. The Hayward family, beautiful people from the Hills of Beverly and the watering holes of Manhattan, going haywire. Anna Karenina, meet Miss Lonelyhearts.

title: Signals Crossed on Pollution Control
description: POLLUTION control laws for boats using Long Island Sound may become as enforcable as those against spitting in the subway or jaywalking in Times Square, according to some marine experts.

title: Egyptian Accuses Libya Of Executing 49
description: CAIRO, April 16 (UPI)An Egyptian diplomat said today that Libya executed 45 officers and four civilians this month for antistate activities.

title: GARDENING
description: MAKE a place for roses in your garden this spring. There's room for a few in every garden. Dr. Cynthia Westcott, New Jersey's famous rose specialist, grew more than 600 roses in her Glen Ridge garden, but a dozen or so would satisfy most of us.

title: CRIME
description: Here are two for the price for one. ENOUGH! by Donald Westlake (Evans, $7.95) contains two entries. One, A Travesty, is a short novel; the other, Ordo, is a long short story. A Travesty is a crime novelette in Westlake's typically frenetic vein. But Ordo is a strange companion piece. There is no real mystery involved, no crime. Rather, it is a story or a sailor who goes to Los Angeles to see the girl he married during the war. She is now a movie star and a sex goddess. Ordo is written skillfully enough, but what it is doing in this book is anybody's guess.

title: Clambake At the Shore
description: THE SEASON is fast approaching for that most dramatic, ceremonious andin its own waygratifying of American feasts, the jolly institution known as a lamhake on the shore.

title: Zaire Says That Its Forces Have Driven Back Invaders
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, April 16 (Reuters)Zairian forces have pushed back invaders 12 miles in heavy fighting in southern Zaire, the Zairian press agency said tonight.

title: Spanish Forces Are Admonished
description: MADRID, April 16 (Reuters)  Six Spanish newspapers, in a joint editorial, called on the armed forces today not to interfere in politics. The editorial was published after hostile military reaction to the lifting of a ban on the Communist Party provoked the worst political crisis since the death of Franco in 1975.

title: Recreation Beached
description: AS WE struggle to come to grips with the global implications of energy, food and water shortages, a serious manifestation of our collective inexperience in dealing with scarcity lies at our very shores. Increased leisure time has created an unprecedented demand for leisure activities, especially outdoor recreational services at shoreline parks and beaches, and it is a demand we will be increasingly hardpressed to meet.

title: Facing up to skin care
description: The cosmetic world's next biggest area of opportunity has got to be skincare products for men, says John Horvitz, vice president and director of marketing of Aramis Inc. Men are finally awakening to the fact thatjust like womenthey have skin problems. Their skin is too dry or too oily, it's irritated by shaying, and it's sometimes marred by blackheads and blemishes. These and other problems have aroused male imerest in treatment products.

title: Rounding Up the Latest Opera Recordings
description: New opera recordings have appeared in profuse quantities over the past several months and the fare is varied, from standard repertory items to the latest Romantic resuscitations, from Russian opera of the past to Soviet opera of the present, from Offenbach in French to Wagner in English. Here is a sampling of the latest releases.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: A POPULAR feature of many homes that border in or over look the North or South Sheres of Long Island Sound is a raised outdoor wood deckor, in some cases, a waterfront deck on p??gs that is also used as a sun deck and outdoor lounging area

title: Northeastern, Navy Crews Win in Upsets
description: PRINCETON, N.J., April 15Princeton and Yale, with high expectations for their varsity crews this spring, were both beaten today in concurrent regattas on Lake Carnegie. Navy nipped the Tigers by twotenths of a second at the finish line, and Northeastern upset Yale by one length.

title: How Madison's Radical Mayor Has Mellowed With Age
description: The first time I saw Paul Soglin was in 1967 when he helped organize a University of Wisconsin student protest against Dow Chemical, the manufacturer of napalm, The protest began outside my classroom where tear gas thrown by police forced me out of class and onto the street. Many of us were there by chance, not choice. Frightened police barricaded us in a culdesac between two classroom buildings. I could hear the sound of hard clubs on flesh, could see blood staining faces and hands, matting the hair. Police faces were flushed under riot helmets; their mouths open, eyes slitted. Beside me, a woman vomited on the steps.

title: Jane G. Adams, Designer, Bride of George Bunn Jr.
description: Jane Grace Adams, a fashion designer with Art Shirt, maker of women's sportswear, was married yesterday afternoon to George Regan Bunn Jr., who is with the New York law firm of Davis Polk & Wardwell. The Rev. Alanson B. Houghton performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest.

title: Warren H. O'Hara, Manager For Producers on Broadway
description: Warren H. O'Hara, company manager for several Broadway producers, died yesterday at Leroy Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: (For week ??nded Arra 15. 1977)

title: TV: Reversing the Sexual Roles
description: In the hardedged sitcorn world of All That Glitters, women play all of the competitive and dominating roles traditionally cherished by most men. While women run giant corporations, olan massive product campaigns, drink huge martinis and casually cheat on their spouses, men are limited to being domesticated househusbands or sexobject secretaries. Women are the aggressors, in the executive suite and the bedroom. Men sit at home and complain about unfaithful partners, or scheme to advance themselves using the prudent tool of good looks.

title: Wrong Turn in Brazil
description: The evolution of Brazil had been one of the more encouraging trends, in the Western Hemisphere. Economically, despite unspeakable poverty, the nation's dream of industrialization is well on the way to being realized and its ambition to become a world power is realistic. Politically, despite military rule and repression, a commitment to liberalization had been evident in recent years. But now there is cause for concern.

title: Stephanie Zurhellen Wed to A. G. Hepburn
description: Stephanie Jo Zurhellen, daughter of J. Owen Zurhellen Jr., Ambassador to Surinam, and Mrs. Zurhellen of Washington and Putnam Valley, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Angus G. Hepburn, son of George Hepburn of Edinburgh and the late Mrs. Hepburn.

title: BOND PRICES SHOW RENEWED STRENGTH AS TAX REBATE DIES
description: The credit markets were so pleased last week that President Carter abandoned his plan for a tax rebate that they scarcely paid any attention to the news of a record jump in the nation's money supply. As a result, bond prices scored their biggest gains since late November, and analysts could see little reason why the trend toward higher fixedincome prices and lower interest rates should not continue a while longer.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Daley Successor Expected to Win By Big Margin in Chicago Primary
description: CHICAGO, April 17It seems a foregone conclusion to politicians and citizens alike here that the Democratic Party organization will prevail in Tuesday's primary election to fill the remaining two years of the term of the late Mayor Richard J. Daley.

title: Women in Liechenstein Vote for First Time
description: VADUZ, Liechtenstein, April 17 (Reuters)Women voted for the first time in the history of this tiny Alpine principality today in elections of justices of the peace in the capital, Vaduz.

title: Egypt Announces the Indictment Of 57 in January Food Rioting
description: CAIRO, April 17 (AP)Indictments were announced today against 57 persons who were allegedly involved in last January's bloody rioting that followed a Government attempt to raise food prices.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Critical of the Media
description: But what is disorienting about Mr. MacDougall is that he writes as if he were more than just a salesman and packager. He speaks as if the image were the same as the substance, so that he can write such a phrase as ... the President said, in a magnificent closeup, which, though it makes a kind of sense, sounds as if there were no distinction to be made between the act and the image of speaking.

title: Rochelle Abramson Makes Local Violin Debut
description: Rochelle Abramson, a Juilliardtrained violinist who studies with David Nadien, made her New York recital debut Saturday at Carnegie Recital Hall in a program stressing the Romantic virtuoso literature.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Like everyone else, I have a tendency to misplace recipes. And not just any old recipe. Almost invariably it's the ones that we treasure for one reason or another.

title: Brock Warns on Gas Tax
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 (UPI)The chairman of the Republican National I Committee said today that President Carter's energy plan might have a tremendously negative effect on the economy and employment.

title: Young Wins Praise at N.A.A.C.P. Dinner in Detroit
description: DETROIT, April 17Andrew Young, the United States delegate to the United Nations and the target of frequent criticism for his candor on human rights issues, found himself the subject of praise here today. He was characterized as a refreshing voice in world diplomatic circles.

title: Sun Ock Lee Dancers Link Asia With Edith Piaf Songs in Karma
description: The idea of linking the songs of Edith Piaf with an Asian sensibility might seem too extreme to contemplate. Yet this was the core principle behind Karma. a dance premiere presented Saturday night by the Sun Ock Lee Dance Company at Miss Lee's StudioTheater, 105 East 16th Street.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: A.T.& T. Finds Annual Meeting Needs Careful Staging
description: Sixteen years ago, when the American Telephone and Telegraph Company held its annual meetingthe first outside New York Cityit was in for a shock. Attracted by prospects of a close look at the top brass and a free lunch, an astonishing total of 20,109 shareholders showed up at McCormick Place in Chicago. That smashed all attendance records.

title: BERGLAND IS HOPEFUL ON DROUGHT'S IMPACT
description: MONTEREY, Calif., April 17Secretary of Agriculture Bob Bergland says that he sees no need for retail food prices to rise this year because of the twoyearold drought in this state. However, in an interview as he prepared to return to Washington, Secretary Bergland said that a third year of drought would bring a real crunch in food supplies and prices.

title: Major League Scores
description: EFerguson, Cabell DPHouston 2. Atlanta 2. LOBHouson on 7, Atlanta 6. 2 BMonlacez, RMetzger, Gilbr??ath HRCJohnson (3). SBJCruz. SMoore, Pocoroba SFPocoroba, Royster.

title: Investigators Obtain Congressmen's Letters in Praise of Korean Lobbyist
description: WASHINGTON. April 17Justice Department investigators looking into al leged influencebuying activities by the South Korean Government have obtained letters that members of Congress wrote to President Park Chung Hee of South Korea, praising the effectiveness of Tongsun Park as an advocate of Korean interests here.

title: Miss Palmer Wins on a 281 After Losing 5Stroke Lead
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., April 17Sandra Palmer, a hardworking and dedicated golf professional with a fighting instinct, let a fivestroke lead slip from her grasp today and then, with the help of Jane Blalock, her principal pursuer, recovered to win the second Women's International by two shots.

title: ALBANY PACT TO GIVE STATE VIORKERS RAISE OF 14% OVER 2 YEARS
description: ALBANY, April 17New York State and its largest publicemployee union agreed to a new contract today, granting more than $215 million in increased wages and fringe benefits over the next two years.

title: Service at Temple Recalls Warsaw Ghetto
description: WAYNE, April 17Thirtyfour children held lighted candles and slowly walked down the aisle to the altar of Temple Beth Tikvah here this afternoon. Each candle represented a year since the uprising of the Jewish people held captive in a Warsaw ghetto in World War II. The white and blue can dles were placed in a row behind wooden triangle on which the figure six millionfor the number of Jews killed in the Jewish Holocaustand the word Remember, in Hebrew, were inscribed. The emblem was made by Ralph Weiss, of Fair Lawn, a survivor of the Lodz ghetto in Poland.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: QUARTERFINAL ROUND

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, APRIL 18, 1977

title: Cry 100% Cotton, and Civil War Erupts in Denim
description: A civil war has been precipitated in the denim industry by the campaign of Cotton Inc., the promotional arm of the cotton industry, to promote 100 percent use of the natural fiber in denim.

title: LAWRENCE S. HARRISON, 85,  AN ARTLIGHTING EXPERT
description: Lawrence S. Harrison, a former executive with the International Business Machines Corporation who became business administrator of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, died Saturday in the PutnamWeaver Nursing Home in Greenwich, Conn. He was 85 years old.

title: Around the Nation
description: MIAMI, April 17 (UPI)  Hundreds of rock music fans who had waited through the night for tickets to a concert crashed a gate and rampaged through the Orange Bowl early today before being subdued by the police, who used billy clubs and tear gas.

title: British Patrol Kills Man in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 17 (UPI)A British Army patrol shot and killed a man carrying what was later found to be an air rifle in the mainly Roman Catholic Ardoyne district of Belfast today. An Army statement said patrols had called on the man five times to stop.

title: Umpires Balk at DisputedCall Replay on Scoreboard Screen of Braves' Stadium
description: From now on, the fans in Atlanta's County Stadium will not be able to take an automatic second look at all close plays on the stadium's electronic scoreboard. The Braves have agreed to place Hank Roundtree, a former umpire, in the television booth to decide whether instant replays are too controversial to show fearing a violent reaction by fans.

title: Music: Colgrass Concertmasters a Diffuse Hybrid
description: The more composers know about the past the less they seem able to define themselves with confidence In the present. Tugged in so many direction, composers in our century often settle upon a hybrid style, hoping that juxtaposition of ideas from various eras will add up to something new, individual and homogeneous, Stravinsky, the great hybridizer, did it successfully throughout his career, so did Strauss and many another.

title: Unorthodox Newcomers Reshaping the Assembly
description: ALBANY, April 17The State Legislaturenotwithstanding its image as a haven for middleaged lawyers and parttime politiciansisn't what it used to be.

title: Unorthodox Newcomers Reshaping the Assembly
description: ALBANY, April 17The State Legislaturenotwithstanding its image as a haven for middleaped? lawyers and parttime politiciansisn't what it used to be.

title: World News Briefs
description: AMSTERDAM, April 17 (Reuters)Western European Socialist leaders agreed today to keep pressing the Soviet bloc to respect human rights, saying their aim was fully compatible with dtente.

title: CORRECTION
description: Cold Storage, a new play by Ronald Ribman, continues through next Sunday at the American Piece Theater, Ill West 46th Street. It did not close yesterday, as listed in Sunday's Arts and Leisure Guide.

title: Moroccans Report On Fighting
description: RABAT, Morocco, April 17Reports from the Moroccan force in Zaire say that it has begun participating in the fighting around Kolwezi, the key city of Shaba Province.

title: Feliciano Mesmerizes, but Songs Lack Bite
description: Jos Feliciano, who performed at the Bottom Line on Friday evening, is entering a new phase in his recording career. After making dramatic, overproduced albums for RCA, he has moved over to Private Stock records and to Jerry Wexler, a producer who has taken him in the direction of Southern popsoul.

title: OBSTACLES REMAINING IN ORE WASTE DISPUTE
description: ST. PAUL, April 17One of the nation's premier environmental controversies, the discharge of potentially harmful ore wastes into Lake Superior by the Reserve Mining Company, may be resolved in the next several weeks.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: BHUTTO OFFERS FOES SOME SOCIAL CHANGE IN APPEAL FOR UNITY
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, April 17Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, continuing his effort to end Pakistan's political crisis, today offered a program of legal and social changes designed to appeal to the more conservative Moslem elements among the coalition that is opposing him.

title: Warriors Oust Pistons As Brawl Erupts, 109101
description: OAKLAND, Calif., April 17 (AP)The Golden State Warriors, down by 3 points when a brawl broke out in the third quarter, rallied on the shooting of Rick Barry and beat the Detroit Pistons, 109161, today to advance past the first round of the National Basketball Association playoffs.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Corporate Ethics: A Report, and Talks Held Off the Record
description: HARRIMAN, N.Y., April 17There are more ways to kill a horse besides choking him to death on cold cornbread.

title: Sir Peter Kirk, a Tory Legislator And Member of European Assembly
description: LONDON, April 17 (AP)Sir Peter Kirk, a member of Parliament and leader of the Conservative Party's delegation in the European Assembly, died of a heart attack last night at his home in Steeple Bumpstead, northeast of London. He was 48 years old.

title: Carter Plan Would Give Amnesty To Illegal Aliens Already in U.S.
description: HOUSTON, April 17The Carter Administration is shaping new immigration policies that would include amnesty for hundreds of thousands, perhaps millions, of foreigners, mostly Mexicans, who are living in the United States illegally.

title: U.S. CRITICIZED BY TASS FOR BARRING UNION AIDES
description: MOSCOW, April 17 (AP)The Soviet press agency Tass said today that the United States had violated provisions of the 1975 Helsinki accords relating to international contacts by blocking a planned trip to the United States by Soviet trade union officials.

title: Belgian Chief's Party Holding Edge
description: BRUSSELS, Monday, April 18 (UPI) Prime Minister Leo Tindemans's socialChristian Party gained ground in Belgium's national elections yesterday but was given no hope of winning a majority in the 212seat Parliament.

title: A Crowded Exhibit Suggests Parisians Prefer Home Products au Naturel
description: PARISIf an exhibition called Marjolaine '77 is any guide, ecological concerns are adding fresh spice to French life.

title: MRS. RABIN IS FINED $27,000 IN BANK CASE
description: JERUSALEM, April 17Lea Rabin, wife of Israel's Prime Minister, was fined about $27,000 today for her role in maintaining bank accounts in Washington in violation of Israeli currency regulations.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Capeman was still on the loose yesterday, according to the state police at Fishkill. Salvadore Agron, 33 years old, failed to return to the Fishkill Correctional Facility near Poughkeepsie from New Paltz State College on Friday, according to prison officials.

title: 28 Nuns in Order Mark Anniversaries of Taking Vows
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, April 16 Twentyfive or even 50 years isn't such a long time when you enjoy what you are doing.

title: Irwin Goldman, 54, Executive Of Pharmaceutical Company
description: Irwin Goldman, vice president for corporate planning of Merck & Company, manufacturers of pharmaceuticals, died Saturday in Hackensack Hospital in New Jersey after suffering an apparent heart attack while playing tennis in Teaneck, N.J.

title: Sneed's Birdie Wins Golf On First Hole of Playoff
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 17 (AP)Ed Sneed of Pompano Beach, Fla., sank a 12foot putt for a birdie on the first playoff hole today and defeated Lon Hinkle of Santee, Calif., for the $16,000 top prize in the Tallahassee open golf tournament.

title: Golf
description: AT CARLSBAD, CALIF. TOURNAMENT OF CHAMPIONS The Final Scores

description: Theater

title: FLORIDA NUCLEAR PLANT MAY CLOSE FOR 2 YEARS
description: MIAMI, April 17 (AP)The Turkey Point nuclear power plant south of Miami may have to be shut down for up to two years to solve repeated leaks of radioactive cooling water, according to officials of the Florida Power and Light Company.

title: Companies Plan Reaction to Carter
description: WASHINGTON, April 17Some companies are preparing elaborate position papers, press releases and background briefing books. Others are lining up spokesmen to issue their responses. A few plan nothing special.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: BHUTTO OFFERS FOES SOME SOCIAL CHANGE IN APPEAL FOR UNITY
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, April 17Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto, continuing his effort to end Pakistan's political crisis, today offered a program of legal and social changes designed to appeal to the more conservative Moslem elements among the coalition that is opposing him.

title: Fourth Woman Slain by Same Gun
description: A young woman was shot to death and her male companion was critically wounded early yesterday as they sat in a parked car in the Bronx. The police said the killing was similar to the slaying of three other women in the city over the last nine months.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Sore Tooth Killed 350Pound Miamian
description: MIAMI, April 17(AP) An autopsy has determined that Willie Moore's sore tooth caused his death, doctors said yesterday.

title: Flyers Again Beat Leafs in Overtime, 65
description: TORONTO, April 17The tattered Toronto Maple Leafs, having squandered a fat threegoal lead over Philadelphia in the waning minutes of regulation time tonight, suffered their second straight overtime loss to the Flyers. Reggie Leach scored his second goal of the game on a speedy slap shot with 50 seconds remaining in the first overtime period to give Philadelphia a 65 victory in the rough contest and tie the fourofsevengame quarterfinal series at two apiece.
